Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: richknebel
Reviews.Content: Clean, fancy, great location. Seconds from robson st. Minutes walk from the waterfront. Cactus club nearby was nice perk. Only complaint was lack of free Internet. This is 2012 were talking about. And for the price you pay for the room, you'd expect free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great updates”
Reviews.Author: mkay604
Reviews.Content: Living in Vancouver, the Hyatt has been around for what seems like forever. With that said, you would imagine that it may be outdated, despite being one of the marquee hotels in the downtown core. Staying there two times in January, the hotel and service did not dissappoint and was pleasantly surprised with the updated rooms! Clean and comfortable, it had everything a 4/5 star hotel could offer. Location for Vancouver could not get better. Walking distance to the convention centre, great restaurants, shopping, and entertainment. We booked two rooms (king bed suite, and a 2 queen suite) which was adjoined with a "living room" space. All together it felt like a large living quarter (minus a kitchen) that provided more than enough sleeping arrangements, bathrooms, TV's and mini fridge for our party. I also was able to spend some time in the presidential suite - which was uber modern, with luxurious finishes (marble granite), decor (loungers, couches, eating area, living room area, fireplace), with a beautiful bedroom (plush king bed), full size tub, closets and bathroom - perfect for a special stay, or honeymoon suite. Came equipped with a desk for office work, kitchen, and wine cooler (which may have been an add-on). Sleeping there was probably the best and peaceful sleeps I've had in a long time - kudo's to the buyer of pillows and mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, needs wifi”
Reviews.Author: wisconsinb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Easter and it is a beautiful hotel. We loved everything about it and the only thing preventing me from giving it 5 stars is the fact that you have to play a hefty fee to access wifi. That seems a bit prehistoric to me. Other than that, beautiful hotel in a great location. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OH MY GOD THE ELEVATORS”
Reviews.Author: hbear85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt in Vancouver this Winter while i had friends in town & wanted to be close to their hotel. The hotel has recently implemented a new elevator system. Elevators are numbered from A-F. When you arrive at the elevators you hit the # of the floor you want to go to. The screen then prompts you to line up in front of your letter. Once you are in your elevator you cannot hit any buttons, get out at any other floor than originally chosen. Over the 3 days I spent at the hotel, there was not a time i waited less than 15 minutes to get up or down. On the Saturday night we had tickets to a concert and dinner reservations. It took me 35 minutes to get to the lobby, where at this point we were way passed our dinner reservation & our table was given away. I asked the concierge "what is wrong with the elevators" and she snapped back at me that nothing was wrong & it was just a busy weekend at the hotel. I'm sorry, but I've stayed at plenty of hotels when they are running at capacity & that has never happened. Towards the end it got so crazy if i saw someone getting into another elevator that was going less than 10 floors above or below mine i would jump in it and then walk up or down that many flights of stairs. Luckily I am 26 and i am physically able to do that. I complained again the last day after going to use the gym & waiting 20 minutes to get back to my room. the concierge offered me 50% off my parking. Not really what i would expect, but oh well, i was just ready to get out of there! When i checked out somehow i had almost $250 in parking charges. I was really confused, so was they guy at the front desk. After it took me 20 minutes to get down stairs to check out, it took him another 20 to figure out what was wrong with my bill. He also mentioned he was hungover & math wasn't his strong suit on Sunday's... nice buddy. After him making no sense i eventually had to use his calculator, add up the charges for my stay and what my parking should have been & then show him how to subtract that from the total. Overall, terrible experience. I will NEVER be back to this Hyatt again. If you are staying in Vancouver there are so many wonderful small hotels. L'Hermitage, the Loden, Hotel Georgia. Stay away from the Hyatt. It is a nightmare! It's unfortunate too, because their rooms are not bad, neither was the room service or gym. But when it takes 20 minutes to get to the gym, or 35 minutes to get to the lobby, those things fail to matter.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Ally V
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Hyatt because of the location but not much is included. Extra for parking, Wi-fi and it is expensive. Location is ideal and the rooms are always clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury but not remarkable...”
Reviews.Author: maddalena c Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The impression is that people booking online are needed but not considered as favourite clients... Room and toilet were large and clean but the view was on the back courtyard facing a rooftop. The wi-fi is not free (just in the lobby because of a starbucks that stands inside it...) and after discussion they opened freely the room wi-fi (really poor) but just giving all my data for a hotel membership passport... The hotel is beautiful and used for national and international conferences, the breakfast is expensive and I suggest to search for a coffee in the hotel surroundings...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: OzinGulf
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location. Walking distances (literally only a few blocks), to Canada Place, Pacific Place, Robson Street, Gastown etc. (not quite Granville Island, although you could). All the tour buses & hop-on-hop off companies stop at the Hyatt. 2 blocks from Canada line stop 'Vancouver City Centre' from the airport (don't get off at Waterfront, it's a longer walk than VCC). I had room service 2 nights, and the service was incredibly fast, professional, and the food was awesome. Walls & windows were a little thin. I could here my (loud) neighbours talking at 1am in the morning (!!), and the windows don't do much to block out all the sirens and street noise of Burrard Street (even up on 12th floor). Large rooms, and huge comfy beds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location For My Stay In This Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: maxbialy
Reviews.Content: I lucked out with a two night stay at The Hyatt Regency in Vancouver. The staff could not have been nicer and more helpful. At check-in, they explained all the neighborhoods of this vast and charming city. So persuasive were they, I signed up to become a Gold Account member. They put me in a room on one of the higher floors for my photography. The room was very classy, large, with a desk, and the usual amenities, even an umbrella, which came in handy one of the days I stayed. If costs are a factor, keep in mind, right next door, is a McDonalds and a Tim Hortons,(soup and sandwich shop) open 24 hours. This hotel is also on a bus route and close to everything. I was very happy with my accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown convenience.”
Reviews.Author: Stiletto666
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Friday, 6th of April and was pleased to be able to finally get to my hotel after a long flight. Check in was easy and the reception staff member was quick to make sure all the details and requirements were met. The whole check in took approximately 6 minutes including the same staff member walking me to the elevator to show how they operated as it was my first time at this hotel. If this is standard for the front desk staff then well done. The Regency Club floor is snug and located at the end of the 29th floor but though smaller than most this room is enhanced by the concierge on the the Raine ( spelling? ) who makes everyone feel comfortable and is intuitive enough to meet client's requirements without being overbearing. This itself is a hard thing to master but she seems to have is a tremendous asset to the hotel. My room ( 2910 ) was what I would have expected from Hyatt Regency but I did note that complimentary water is not available in the room. This was something that I missed and after being in SE Asian and Oceanic hotels of this chain I expected similar service here. This is the only fault I had with the room. The hotel is located conveniently to down town with shopping nearby and the subway close by as well. The restaurant downstairs does suffer a little from noise creep from other areas especially if there is a loud convention/conference on the second floor. I have to say the staff are quick, willing and knowledgable of their fare though the menu was a little sparse there was a fair variety available with a natural balance towards fish. Would I stay there again? Yes but unfortunately when I am returning to Vancouver the hotel is booked out which is a shame but I did enjoy my overnight stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Average to the last...”
Reviews.Author: Vanislandergirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt on a trip to Vancouver that ended up being twice as long as we had planned. We were not able to stay at the original hotel that we has stayed at the previous 3 nights becuase they were too boooked to be able to extend our stay unexpectedly which was a shame. The staff member that checked us in was very good but the hotel amenities were pretty much average and the parking was a complete aggravation. The noise in the hallways work up myself and my boyfriend. The shampoo/conditioner/body lotion smelled acrid and repellent and there was only one robe... in a double occupancy room... the best thing they offered was a courtesy umbrella. I had called ahead to find out what the price of parking was, bracing myself for the expense and was told by the front desk that it would be $38 a day. When we arrived, we spoke to the valet and he advised us that if we do not need to come and go, and if we were just leaving the car parked, then the cheaper option is to just take the ticket form the machine and save ourselves $20 and to just leave the front desk out of it all together. Baiscally the hotel will not tell you this tid bit as they want to charge you more than double for the privilage of taking out your car in a city where most people would rather walk anyway.... It felt like a bit of a racket and we weren't impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and would stay there again but...”
Reviews.Author: G S
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room and great location. There were two reasons I gave it a 3 star. Parking $ very pricey (I did know this coming in after reading other reviews). And even though the hotel website says the hot tub would be closed from March 6-26 as of April 10 it is still closed. This was very disappointing to my son and friend he had with him (and my wife). The hotel should update the website and give more current information. The front desk staff was very nice and friendly on check in. Would probably rate a 4 star once the hot tub is up and running.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location in the heart of vancouvet”
Reviews.Author: M2266
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hyatt in March ad I was attending a conference . You cannot beat this location, very close to shops, restaurants and conference centre. I was very pleased with the services and the hotel restaurant. This hotel exceeded my expectations as I have stayed at several hotels in Vancouver within the last few years. I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “COOL elevators”
Reviews.Author: Mainecowboy
Reviews.Content: Alright, so the elevators are cool with the touch screens outside the elevators for where you are going and then it tells you which one to get on. That said, this is still a nice property. 4 blocks from convention center and right downtown- walking distance (or a very short cab ride) to nearly everything needed. Rooms are very clean and sharp. Starbucks downstairs (one on every corner though so don't worry about getting enough caffeince). Helpful people.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DGAT1989
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to the public transport. Just steps from mass rail station which connects to the VIA Rail station (10 minutes), airport, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely clean, conveniant with a great staff.”
Reviews.Author: hawker59
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Vancouver with my son for a father son getaway. We were able to check in early the staff did a fantastic job describing the hotel and the area. The front desk clerk even walked us to the elevator to make sure we were comfortable with their unique system. Room service was flawless, never had to wait more than twenty minutes for the food to get to the room. The bedding was fantastic. The towels could have been a little larger. The hotel was convenient to downtown as well as the major sporting venues. Not sure why someone would complain about power ports as they are mounted right on the desk. Concierge recommendations and advice were excellent. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay downtown in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Good sound business property”
Reviews.Author: wildthing271
Reviews.Content: My company booked me into the Hyatt as opposed to L'Hermitage on my previous visit. Like L'Hermitage, the Hyatt has a good central downtown location. I arrived late - around 11pm, and reception was empty. Curiously the doorman insisted that I use one of the automated kiosks, which proceeded to guide me through the whole check in process, only to tell me that I needed to see an agent at the last step, by which point all the agents were attending to other guests. Technology! I eventually check in to a nice room on the 12th floor - it was a standard functional Hyatt room, with a comfortable bed, clean bathroom with nice towels and amenities (but frustrating, no showe gel as I had forgotten mine!). There was a good workspace, and the wifi was solid. I can't add much more than that as everything was as expected for a Hyatt. I did not eat at the hotel - at $26 breakfast was far too expensive for my masters who approve my expense reports, so it was a quick trip each morning to Tim Horton's next door! A nice touch was complimentary loan umbrellas for the rain. Check out was quick and efficient - no forced use of kiosks, and the staff were all friendly and polite. A good business hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “parking expensive and sucks!!!!”
Reviews.Author: canmap
Reviews.Content: parking management don't know how to management, i park in P1, there is no sign to say how to get out from parking lot, then i have to find staffs to talk, take me to p2 then i can get out from underground parking, poor management! Don't go there, expensive and bad!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and unimpressive”
Reviews.Author: b s
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights on business march 23 - 27/2012. The first thing you come up against is parking which is very expensive around $28/day. Then you get your room for $200 night and the TV is small, no microwave,and very hard beds.The hot tub was closed while I was there and the outside pool is very cold,small and shallow... it's hard to even do a lap and not touch bottom. The hotel restaurant has OK food but expensive....$28 for the breakfast buffet and $9 beer. Then if you want to go on the internet it will cost you $24.95 a day! Most places offer that free but they want another $25 day. There really is nothing impressive about this hotel and would not stay there again unless I had no other choice. The only good thing I can say is it's a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: barossashiraz
Reviews.Content: the beds at this hotel are fantastic...but when you're 6 feet long PC powercord doesn't reach the nearest powerpoint, you have to question their claims to being a business friendly hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Uplscale Hotel, Despite Lobby”
Reviews.Author: Lane H
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency in Vancouver B.C. is in an excellent location, close to everything you need in downtown. The beds are extremely comfortable, and the rooms are very big compared to New York hotel rooms. The style is modern, but the lobby feels sort of cheap and tacky. Service is okay and is normal for a four star.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and high tech”
Reviews.Author: cliffview12
Reviews.Content: First time I waved my key to get in the room. First time I selected my floor from outside the elevator and an arrow directed me to the quickest elevator. There are no buttons to push in the elevator. You just get on and it stops at the floor you selected. This must be the newest trend. I liked it! The decor was pretty sleek; the rooms were nice and comfortable and also had a mini fridge. We were asked at check in if we wanted to upgrade the room to a "view room" for $25 and we opted for it. Not sure if it was worth it. We were up high (30th floor) and had a room facing the water; however there were a few higher hotels in front of ours, so it was just a so-so view. But, you could see some of the mountains, so if money isn't an object you might consider it. We ate lunch in the hotel restaurant and it was very good. Also has a Starbucks in the lobby so that was convenient. The hotel is about 5 blocks (short blocks) from the convention center. There are also yummy restaurants nearby. The Italian Kitchen and The Cactus Club were both excellent. There was a wine merchant store and a nice grocery store both about 5 blocks up the road on Burrard Street (walking away from the water). I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: manticore82
Reviews.Content: Great service, excellent location.. I spent 7 consecutive nights and could not find a single thing about which to complain. The fridge (no minibar) was a fantastic amenity for a longer stay like mine.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonsCanada
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations from the Hyatt and am pleased to say that they were all met. The hotel is modern and functional and very conveniently located in downtown Vancouver. The staff were very friendly and helpful, assisting with the various questions I had about the town and making excellent restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, awesome location, great service”
Reviews.Author: pmohanram
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thru Expedia. Got a package deal, which meant that I payed less than 100 per night after taking into account the plane tickets. Got a nice room on the 23rd floor. Rooms are spacious, with a real fridge and no minibar. You can buy groceries etc and store. Bathroom was nice with a rain shower. Hotel is really hitech. Lifts don't have floor buttons, you enter your floor on a Krupa and it tells you which one to take. Service is really nice. They offered me free wifi just for signing up for the rewards program. The room service menu is the usual ripoff but they have a number of reasonably priced kids menu options. Lastly, location is superb. 2 mins to vancouver art gallery. 5 minutes to the waterfront and a further 5 minutes to gas town. 2 minutes to Robson st. This hotel is the perfect spot to explore this great city from.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient, with a great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Amanda F
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here while attending a conference; the convention center was an easy walk down the street, and there were several restaurants nearby. I was pleasantly surprised by how good the hotel restaurant was, I had an excellent dinner there two nights in a row. Everything was very modern, clean, and classy; the only minor complaint was the amount of street/traffic noise that somehow managed to find its way up to my room on the 24th floor. With earplugs, I slept fine. Loved the slate-tiled bathroom and rain shower. Being able to check in for my flight via a kiosk in the hotel lobby was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the city experience, not for outdoor lovers”
Reviews.Author: bcchik
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, the staff were great, the room was clean and comfortable, the location is conveniently located connected to a mall with a food court. It's right downtown in a nice area. Transit is very close. On the negative side, for an outdoor lover like me, there's not much close by. Also, the wifi cut out often and was expensive. The hot tub and pool were out of order.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Emily L
Reviews.Content: This was by far one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. I was there for a conference in November. The room was very spacious, clean, and had a 'homey' feeling. The bathroom was also really nice - some people had a rain shower in their rooms as well. It is pricier as it's the Hyatt but if the money isn't too much, definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, modern rooms !”
Reviews.Author: Daniel S
Reviews.Content: First the hotel is in a great location, we stayed here as a get away from the inner city. We took the skytrain in to avoid the ludacris parking fees that all hotels charge. This hotel is literally right beside the burrard street station. Right in the middle of Vancouver, everything is within walking distance. We checked in early and luckily they had a room available for us, the new elavator system is very nice. The room itself is very modern and very nice. We phoned down and asked if there was a hotub available to use and the lady on the phone said yes on the 4th floor, so we got ready and went down and noticed only a pool. We went back up and called back and the lady in a but of a rude tone said "sir, like i said its on the 4th floor" I replied we were there and she said beside the pool, so we went back down and again nothing but did notice a large tarb covering lots of wood and other construction materials. My girlfriend went down this time and the desk said it was being renovated and were misinformed...how does the own staff within the hotel not know this ? We really enjoyed the bar at the hotel and the breakfast buffet was excellent. The bed was comfortable but we had some noisy people next to us who were loud till about 4 am.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: flashpacker_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for one night in Feb, as a stopover after a long flight. The main reason we choose to stay here was the downtown location, and also because the Whistler snowbus picked up right outside the hotel. The staff were really friendly, and the room really comfortable. We were overlooking the street, and were a bit concerned about potential noise, but the only thing that woke us in the night were the noisy guests in the room above. Location was great, with a good choice of nearby restaurants, and also to the waterside. We ate in a great restaurant nearby called Coast - surf and turf place, The restaurant bar also looked good, but we didn't sample the cocktails, as we were pretty tired after our 10hr flight. The hotel breakfast was great, a good choice and reasonably priced. We had wanted to eat out for breakfast, but other than McDonalds there weren't any breakfast type places open nearby that we could find. The hotel allowed us to check out a bit later (1.30pm) for no extra charge, which enabled us to see a bit of Vancouver and take a walk along the water to Stanley Park, before we had to get on the snowbus. I would stay here again if visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “All around good experience, a few issues.”
Reviews.Author: SpwP
Reviews.Content: After booking I e-upgraded to a suite, which is based on avability upon arrival. When I arrived I was very pleased to learn that I received the upgrade, and the suite was amazing! The Lounge on the Second floor is a great location and very convenient when waiting for friends to arrive. The location is excellent, as you are right in the heart of Downtown, whether you are looking for shopping or business its all right there. Also access to transit (Sky Train) is right next to the hotel. The downsides to my experience was the Agent who checked me in, as she was unpleasent and had made several mistakes when checking me in. This was especially frustrating as I had arrived early and was told that my room wasn't ready however the Agent from that encounter was very friendly and personable, as it was already after 3PM so the agent gave my some complimentary drink vouchers while we waited. So going back to check-in at 4:30 and dealing with someone who just frowned and didn't even make the effort was upsetting. The other big issue was that I was staying during a busy conference time, and the lobby was filled with people and tones of luggage both when I arrived and departed. With all the people and luggage you didn't know where lines were or really what was going on.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great experience”
Reviews.Author: LShe
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 mights at this hotel. I had a good experience from check in until check out. Great location, very central. Friendly, helpful staff at check in. Elevator service was unique and fast. Standard room on the 23rd floor was tastefully decorated, clean, and had a great view. Room service was fast and the quality of food was excellent. This is a great hotel and I would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Spacious rooms. Comfortable bed.”
Reviews.Author: rshamni
Reviews.Content: Overall it was good. The only thing that I did not like was tea/ coffee machine in the room ( only two coffee sachets and two plastic cups and two tea packets with a machine that does not keep the coffee warm. Once it filters out into the cup, you can't keep it warm). The bathrooms are nice though. The standard Internet is not that fast. Just ok for mails to flow. Stayed fr 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: lid_9
Reviews.Content: there for 2 nights for quick business trip. Room with king on 23rd floor was great, clean, spacious. Elevators neato with floor swipes. Internet is not free; however, go to Starbucks in ground floor, get passcode and it works in room for awhile. Drinks on 2nd floor bar - comfy but $$$

Reviews.Title: “Nothing extraordinary. Just about average.”
Reviews.Author: kmjfd
Reviews.Content: I am currently writing this on my 5th consecutive night at the Hyatt. My check-in was excellent. I arrived in a taxi and was met at the door to assist with my luggage. My check-in was processed quickly. When I went to my room, I had no idea how to use the elevator as it was not explained to me. I quickly figured it out after jumping on one elevator and realized that I could not select my floor after I was already on it. When something is out of the ordinary, I think the hotel staff should explain that to you. My room was clean and modern, however quite small. Despite being in a corner room, the hotel was quite noisey, especially on the night of a Canucks game. Housekeeping was done quite late in the day. On Monday and Thursday of my stays, I arrived back at the hotel after work between 4:30 and 5:00 pm and my room was just being attended to. I then had to sit in the chairs in the hallway and wait. I found this to be extremely frustrating. The location is great, near all amenities. It is about a $35 cab ride from the airport, but extremely close to the Sky Train, which is quite convenient.

Reviews.Title: “close to skytrain”
Reviews.Author: Elisang
Reviews.Content: Th concierge lady was very rude. she was so lazy she told me to use the phone in the room to book my bus to whistler so I went to the fairmount on the next block and they booked it for me. no wonder the other review the guy complained about the phone bill when he left the concierge does nothing. with the internet now who needs that postion. I hope they get rid of her. Will not come back there are so many hotels in that one mile radius awful service.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, and location.”
Reviews.Author: teggy6
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stay here on 2/14-2/16, it was really nice, from someone meeting us right out of the elevator check in was easy, i booked through priceline for 80$ and night, and got updated at the front desk for extra 30$ night, for the king balcony. which was awesome. great to be able to look out at the streets and at the fairmount hotel. i was disappointed that the hot tub and such where having construction, and i didn't know a head of time, as that would have been nice to relax. we rented a movie pay per view, and was disappointed in the quality. seems it was in SD and not HD. but overall it was a good hotel with great location next to shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Bad Bathtubs”
Reviews.Author: Darrin S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 2/7/12 - 2/10/12 I have to say that I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt! The room looked great, the bed was comfortable, and the staff was great. A lot of times when I travel, I get annoyed at how disingenuous the employees can sometimes be at a hotel. I thought the staff here was very genuine and very helpful when I had questions about where to go. The only gripe I had with the Hyatt was that the bottom of the tubs have a lot of dirt built up in the anti slip in the bottom of the tub. Not what I would expect from a Hyatt and kinda gross. I really appreciated the umbrella as well. It came in handy. One last thing, I am very grateful for the complimentary internet access they gave for the week. That goes a long way with me. Especially since I noticed that someone was on here mentioning that they didn't like that they have to pay for it.... sounds like you are actually listening to your customers! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “All good”
Reviews.Author: Jules63
Reviews.Content: As others mentioned, the Hyatt is in a great location! Close to Stanley Park, the waterfront, shopping, restos, transit, etc... Rooms are nice, not super, just nice. Soundproofing was a bit of an issue for us but the rooms are modern, have great views, beds are comfy, bathrooms are new and hot water was never lacking even at rush hours. Service was excellent, elevators were an irritant as at some points during the day, you could wait up to 10 minutes but overall, I'd recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, easy access to our office!”
Reviews.Author: reddya
Reviews.Content: this was my second stay in this hotel...for business. Was on the top floor this time...32 floors up! Had a great view...could see the mountains and ski slopes from my room. Everything was very clean and I was very comfortable. A couple of items worth mentioning: the coffee pot in my room was broken...I was too busy to request another one and I'm sure they would have if I'd asked, but worth noting. The breakfast was super over-priced, but with the Starbucks in the lobby and the Tim's across the little road at the entrance, there are other choices. And finally...the new elevator system! Wow..they have some bugs to work out! There were folks there servicing it during my stay, but I experienced some very long waits for the elevator. Oh..the umbrella in the closet...very nice touch! Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “``white bread`` business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geordie_calgarian
Reviews.Content: hubbie travels once a week to Vancouver and uses the hotel as a bed so this is from a vacation perspective. I used to travel extensively worldwide for business so am used to business hotels and what they offer so my review is not so off the mark for what most business travellers would expect but this is from the perspective of being the hanger on sharing with the business traveller. Check in was fine albeit a little strained as someone obviously not welcome at the front desk asked for some matches (very politely) and although our front desk agent handled it okay it was obvious he wasn`t happy about it. ``upgraded`to an upper floor due to Hubbies status really did nothing for us except cause a longer elevator ride. The rooms are fine though, standard business hotel fare, clean. Had brekkie one am with in the hotel restaurant and had a horrible $14 oatmeal (yes, seriously - the inedible roasted pears and apples were worth about $13 and he didnt eat) paid the bill then the server asked for feedback so hubbie shared. She said she was sorry but it was too late as the bill had been paid but if he wanted he could eat from the buffet for free. He respectfully declined. Had a drink in the lobby each night, and boy were there some personalities and some territorial issues in terms of what tables belong to who that management needs to address. Uncomforable enough that it was being discussed between guest tables. Very pleasant bellman although twice gave incorrect instructions on which buses to take and where to take them from. Received an invite to a breakfast reception to meet I think the F&B Manager and Marketing Director so decided to go, brought our invite, were sat at a table for two told to help ourselves to the buffet ate, left a tip and left the restaurant - not sure why it was billed as a meet and greet as it clearly wasn`t. We didn`t mind at all that it wasn`t but if it was just to encourage someone to try out the restaurant they should have said that. Hubbie never eats breakfast at the hotel, there is a Tim Hortons and McDonalds next door and a Starbucks right in the hotel which is great. Location is very convenient to everything. If all you are looking for is a clean bed in a great location then the Hyatt works, which is really what most business travellers are looking for anyway.

Reviews.Title: “A step up for me!”
Reviews.Author: RuthAnneFergie
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hyatt in downtown Vancouver as I had a conference there. I usually do not frequent such high end places, although I like to! I became a business member at the recommendation of the reservation clerk, so that I could get the wifi and breakfast with the room.It worked out to about 154.00 a night, which worked out cost-wise. I was surprised that in this day and age, and in the city especially at a hotel that must be frequented by business people...how can they charge for wifi?? No one should charge for wifi nowadays!! I didn't have any trouble getting wifi and it worked fine. The new elevator system was still being installed and it occasionally didn't want to work which was a little annoying with so many people in the hotel, although it was a pretty cool system when it worked. But...the food was great, the service was great and the room/bed was comfy and clean!! I really enjoyed my stay and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Street”
Reviews.Author: Divina181
Reviews.Content: Hi, this is my first review! Good pleasant stay on Canada's thanksgiving 2011. Good quality, nice room, and kind staff. Also is located on downtown in one of the best areas, close to Stanley park, Vancouver Art gallery and subway station. There's also a good pass through directly from the hotel to get to the adjacent Mall. by Divina

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Lobby very chaotic”
Reviews.Author: MTCB
Reviews.Content: As a Diamond member I was upgraded to a room on the 30th floor. The regency lounge offers a great selection even in it's temporary home. Others have complained of hearing neighbors but I didn't have any issues- Had a sound sleep. Rooms are modern and clean. Only issue I found was the chaotic lobby amd check-in process that took much longer than necessary. Gym even in it's temporary location is also good. Definitely recommend and plan on going back next time I am in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Weird! But Bellman Moon is ACES”
Reviews.Author: wundersmack
Reviews.Content: Listen, Hyatt Regency, I like you... but you have to get it together! I am a top-level Hyatt customer, meaning I'm supposed to get free WiFi among other perks. But what a hassle! I had to call the IT company involved with Hyatt, and go through a lengthy process to register my IP address in order to get our comp WiFi. First of all, it's ridiculous that you still charge anyone $9.95 a day for internet access. But to promise your Platinum members (or whatever you call us = we spend tens of thousands with Hyatt each year) FREE WiFi and then make it a hassle for us? My room was fine, but entirely UNsoundproof. I could hear every word my neighbors spoke, every bathroom function, every TV channel, loud and clear. I expect this sort of nonsense at a Super 8, not at Hyatt. Word to the staff: please do not ignore your female guests. I am an executive woman, and I did not receive the eye contact, service or attention sent to my male counterparts. Note: I mostly experienced this discrimination from female staff members, who are used to sucking up to men. Hyatt -- please attend to this matter, or risk alienating your female executive class. I did like the new elevator system. I especially loved the services of Bellman Moon, a great guy who stowed my luggage and recommended the Vancouver train to the airport, saving me about $30. Also, he was just a super-swell and very nice man.

Reviews.Title: “Service... not so good”
Reviews.Author: fulrach
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Sept 25th-30th for work. Hotel is overpriced in my opionion but so is every other hotel Downtown Vancouver. The room was quaint (small) but very modern in decor which I liked (not the size of the room). Issues I took was I could hear next door neighbour talking every day, walls seem to be very thin! TV remote never worked and Hotel made no attempts to fix it after me mentioning to 3 different people in 3 different occassions. Never really watched TV anyways but would have been nice to have a working remote. Parking like all other places in Vancouver is also ridiculous being over $30/night! Nice to have a Starbucks downstairs in the lobby though and the restaurant had great food!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Heart of the City!”
Reviews.Author: Robin N
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the weekend at the Hyatt in Vancouver BC, Canada. Though the weather outside was cold the staff was warm and welcoming. Our room was a large suite with a balconey. Unfortunately, it was too cold and rainy to spend time out on it, we enjoyed the view. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom large and accomadating, with a separate shower and bathtub. Having two rooms we were both able to work from either bedroom or living room. They also had a nice touch of a coffee machine that was easy to use and lots of flavors of coffee, tea and hot chocolate. Two large televisions and comfortable furniture. I highly recommend the Hyatt if staying in downtown BC.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, convenient to SkyTrain in the heart of downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Provida
Reviews.Content: Super soft bed, killer city views and the SkyTrain connects you to the city right outside the front door. Even better, there is a 24-hour Tim Hortons adjacent to the lobby. The price is reasonable as well and the hotel catering was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - simple, clean but nothing out of the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: hotsyd22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for two nights - one night either side of week skiing at Whistler. We chose this hotel as it is the downtown pickup and drop-off point for the coach transfer to Whistler - this is very convenient. The hotel itself is fine. It it located on Burrard street (good central location) has been recently renovated and was clean. Service was a bit hit and miss but nothing worth complaining about. One thing to note was there was no room service following our late arrival which was disappointing and the room had no minibar - fortunately, adjacent to the hotel is a 24 hour McDonalds which had to suffice. The breakfast buffet was a bit sparse but the waffles were fantastic and certainly deserve a mention!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service - this is how all chain hotels should treat their customers”
Reviews.Author: no_hills
Reviews.Content: We were based here over the New Year's holiday period, chosen primarily because of an incredible price for a regular room. The hotel was exceptionally busy with a Catholic Youth conference (not the reason we were there) and lots of holiday travellers. The hotel is in the midst of renovations (pool closed) and there was construction in the lobby. Despite these things, it felt like almost 5 star service at a boutique hotel. The concierge was very helpful and patient, and able to book a great new year's table at the last minute. Any service requests were handled quickly and professionally. Staff also handled our complaint properly (re not allowing children in the lounge, despite another employee's recommendation we bring the children there). There didn't appear to be any special programs or activities for children, but the kids were treated well by the staff. The room (standard 2 bed room) was very large, very clean, and had a gorgeous bathroom with a stone shower and interesting fixtures. We could see a sliver of ocean and gorgeous sunrises. This hotel exceeded my expectations, and we will make this our downtown Vancouver hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: giramondo007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hyatt Regency Vancouver for seven nights and I really cannot write any negative remarks about my experience. From the airport take the Skytrain Canada line to Waterfront station, change to Burrard station and the Hyatt will be right in front of you. The exterior and the lobby may look a little cold and impersonal, but the rooms are modern, large and confortable. The best rooms are obviously on the upper floors (30th floor and up), overlooking the beautiful Christ Church. Service is really excellent: everyone is smiling to you and your requests are answered quickly. When I told the reception I had lost the umbrella I had found in my room, for example, they did not charge me anyting, and 5 minutes later I had a new one. Breakfast, if not included in your rate, costs about 30 dollars per person and the buffet offers you great choice and quality. From the hotel you can walk to Stanley Park in about 20 minutes, and you have a large choice of inexpensive restaurants nearby. High speed internet connection is not included and costs 15 dollars per day.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Nice hotel, one issue”
Reviews.Author: zhivago22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just as it looks in the pirctures. It is nice and in a good location with a starbucks in the lobby and a 24hr Mcdonald's, 24hr Tim Horton's in the parking lot. The hotel is connected to a mall and therefore connected to the skytrain. Close to everything except english bay. All in all a very good and quiet hotel (rooms are spacious). One issue: Travelled with an infant and required a crib/sleep arrangement. The crib they gave us was an unsafe playpen without the matress. Thus the bottom of the playpen was as hard as rock. when we complained the staff tried to fix this, however this is what is used at the Hyatt chain. When staying at the Westin Grande in an earlier part of the month, they provided us with an actual crib and plastic sealed sheets for the matress. Quite a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant two night stay over new year”
Reviews.Author: cjd0
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very good downtown location close to Skytrain. We arrived late (2am) following a delayed flight but found hotel staff to be welcoming, particularly the friendly bell hop who helped us to our room with our bags. I had requested quiet rooms and we were happy with the two adjoining rooms that we were allocated, which were spacious with very comfortable beds and good bed linen. While the breakfast buffet isn't cheap most family members enjoyed it. And there are plenty of other alternatives (e.g. Starbucks or Tim Hortons) if you wish.

Reviews.Title: “Under Construction”
Reviews.Author: 15Dave15
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, remodeling was going on in the lobby elevators. This made things very confusing and frustrating when trying to see which elevator was available when it arrived in the lobby. Our visit occured a couple of days after Christmas. There were interesting large-scale gingerbread displays in the lobby that were festive until the hotel decided to demolish them in the middle of the day (loud, distracting and messy). Why not after/before waking hours? Additionally, while advertised as offering a "spa-like" experience, we arrived to find that the pool was closed and that the excercise facility was temporarily (and unsatisfactorily) relocated to another floor. When packing to leave, we found a dirty sock on the floor that was not ours. VERY unsatisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: marcus12345
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the hyatt on my last trip to vancouver and found it to be excellent i had a standard room but couldnt have ask for more the room was clean staff excellent and very helpfull will stay again next time i go back to vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location, Great Value, Passionate Service”
Reviews.Author: BearX220
Reviews.Content: It's difficult indeed to find fault with this tall, stylish slab of a hotel in the very heart of what may be North America's most beautiful city. On a recent pre-Christmas shopping-and-dining trip to Vancouver my family and I found ourselves happily ensconced on the 23rd floor, enjoying a dramatic view of the business district Coal Harbour, and the mountains to the north. Beds, fixtures, towels and linens were top-notch, HVAC was responsive, and the wi-fi Internet ($10 per day) was robust. (Points off, though, for the too-small flat-screen TV mounted a long way from the beds... and the silly ceiling-mounted shower head, intended as a luxury touch but merely a complicating factor. Also, road noise and commotion in adjacent rooms are both audible, but only minor annoyances.) You're steps from Robson and Alberni, with shops and restaurants galore, and the Burrard Street SkyTrain station is right next door. The Cactus Club Cafe across the street serves well past midnight and there's a 24-hour Tim Horton's next door, both excellent in their respective ways. Underground parking is $23 per 24 hours, not so bad by in-city standards, in a shared-access parkade that also serves an attached shopping center. The lobby was decorated for the holidays with an assortment of giant gingerbread houses, entrants in a city-wide competition, so the place was bustling with sightseers, but the genial staff made it seem like a big, friendly party. Every employee we met, from the check-in desk to the chambermaid to the bar waiter to the managers, was "on" -- welcoming, helpful, happy to see us -- even those stuck working Christmas Eve seemed pleased to be part of the show. On that basis alone I'd call this one of the best Hyatt Regency properties in North America. The excellent (though decidedly special, off-season) rate we paid, around US$120 per night, was just the icing on the cake. It's a happy operation that copes effortlessly with businesspeople and tourists alike, and it's definitely earned a spot atop our must-go-back list.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: 6starluxurytraveler
Reviews.Content: The check-in in the lobby was smooth. We stayed in a very spacious Executive Suite, room 3308 which was approximately 180sqm. The suite consisted of a guest powder room, a living room, a dinning room with 8 chairs, a pantry area next to the dinning area with coffee machine and microwave, a second more cosier living room with a large bathroom with separate tub and shower and double sinks as well as a spacious bedroom with a large bathroom with separate tub and shower. There were views of bustling Burrad and Georgia Street intersection. To our disappointment there was no fruit basket in our room, no milk or cups to accompany the coffee machine, no tea bags, no minibar and no plates for the microwave. There was also very limited closet space in the accommodation. The Regency Club Lounge was not very fancy, it wasn't very big and the area in which the food was presented was minisculus, they offered a limited selection of food at breakfast which was mostly cold cut, at cocktail hours there was a small selection of snacks you could have, they charged CAD$8 for a glass of wine. This was acceptable as we only paid CAD$29 extra per night to have club access. The cuisine in the Mosaic Grille is of the highest quality, the scallops are cooked wonderfully as well as the meat and fish, a dinner for two persons with half a bottle of wine would cost approximately CAD$140. The location of the hotel is very good, there is Starbucks in the lobby and a large convenience store is located in the connecting shopping mall, the Vancouver Art gallery is only a 5 minute walk and Sears is close by. All in all it was an affordable stay as we only paid CAD$299 per night during our four night stay for a 180sqm suite in the heart of the city, the normal rate for this suite is CAD$699, I recommend if you have a Hyatt Gold Passport to use the affordable upgrades they provide.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Bang for your Buck - Excellent location, room size, decor and service”
Reviews.Author: AKCToronto
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night (6 day) stay at Hilton and I was pleasantly surprised by our stay. I booked on hotels.com and the price was quite fair (~$118 for Sun-Wed and ~$129 for Fri/Sat). For a 4 star hotel, you'll get good value for your dollar (reminder, this is not a 5 star, this is not Shangri-la; this review is based on what you get for a 4 star hotel). Rooms: The rooms are refurbished and very contemporary and spacious (well at the least the king size room we had was spacious) and equipped with an Ipod docking station (in the case you forget to bring your iPhone charger - not necessary to bring it), with a desk, bench, arm chair, etc. The bed and pillows are super comfortable. Bathroom: The amenities are limited (was expecting that due to the reviews) but if you call them they will supply the cotton balls, q-tips and anything else. There is a rain shower head with inner and outer bathmats and lots of space on the vanity for toiletries. Although the bathroom is a dark slate color, it appeared very clean as the sink, toilet and tub are in pristine condition. Service: The room is regularly cleaned and serviced on a daily basis and towels are replenished. The concierge is helpful for taxi fare, tours and restaurant locations, etc. The gym on the fourth floor is closed but you can access a temporary gym on the 29th floor, which has treadmills, elipticals, stability ball, etc. (Just didn't see any free weights). There are towels, water and a coffee machine located inside. There are television monitors on the treadmill and they supply headphones. Location: Can't be beat for access to Sky train, shops, Stanley Park, etc.! The Burrard (spelling?) station is located across the street - you can take the Canada line sky train from the airport (with one transfer change on the way) for $7.50 per person. It does get noisy at night due to the downtown vibe but overall we slept well (our room on the 23rd floor overlooked Burrard and Fairmont Vancouver). Maybe you can get a room that is located opposite from the downtown city streets and it may be more quieter. I liked that the spa I booked (at Fairmont's Absolute) was within walking distance (~3 minutes away) and you can shop/browse at Louis Vuitton, also located across the street. The Pacific mall is also within walking distance. Here is the best part: Starbucks and Tim Horton's located right under your feet - literally. The Starbucks is in the lobby and there is a mall attached to the Hyatt where you can access Tim Horton's, Micky D's, Rexall pharmacy, Staples and another Starbucks and other stores - in case you don't want to venture outside. CONS: Internet charge; $9.95/day for light; $14.95/day for full service; $69.95 for one week. I think this hotel appeals to business travellers - what's with the internet charges? That is a major turn-off and needs to also be factored into the room charge when clients are comparing staying at other hotels in the same category. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would return due to the cost-savings and value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with Choice”
Reviews.Author: kingofsp8s
Reviews.Content: Staying here one night after a ski holiday to Whistler. Needed one more night for platinum renewal, so was the only choice even though I would've preferred closer to the airport. Was pleasantly surprised at both the cleanliness and functionality of the room. Spacious and comfortable with high quality beddings. As some say, not much character or uniqueness here, but I'm not looking for the hotel to provide me that given the proximity to great restaurants and parks here. The only negative I would say is driving in and parking. We arrived around 7:00 pm and the traffic was fairly bad, particularly foot traffic, and we sat trying to get in while pedestrians continually - and literally - rushed to get in front of our car. Door and bellman just sat and watched - would be good if they actually monitored traffic for a bit. The parking also is very expensive. Self-park would be the first order of rule, and second is consider that from 6pm to 6am the parkade is only $8, compared with 36 for selfpark with the hotel and 48 for valet. If I had an option for dropping the RAC off (there was no rental desk at the hotel) it would've been great as the sky-train to the airport is right there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but lots of noise”
Reviews.Author: emilialis
Reviews.Content: My significant other and I just returned from a trip to Vancouver, where we stayed at the Hyatt for 4 nights. The location is excellent, we took the train all the way from the airport and only had to walk three blocks with our luggage in order to get to the hotel. We rarely took cabs during our stay as we could walk to most of our destinations (and when we did take a cab it wasn't very expensive). There was a large gingerbread display in the lobby which was nice and got us in the Christmas spirit, and also a Starbucks (very convenient). This also meant the lobby was usually quite busy (not an issue for us but it may be for others). There is also a 24-7 McDonalds and a Tim Hortons near by for late night snacks. We didn't try any of the food at the hotel but from what I saw on the room service menu it was a bit on the pricey side - but perhaps it's delicious and worth the cost! The rooms were clean and modern. The bed was very plush and comfortable. We had everything we needed (abundant towels, coffee, tea, a mini-fridge, etc.) - except complimentary water bottles would have been a nice add-on. As with most of the other reviewers, I'd have to say one of the biggest drawbacks of this hotel was the daily charge for internet use. It was cheaper for us to use the data plans on our cell phones. We also had some issues with how sound-proof the hotel was. We could hear our neighbour's tvs (on both sides) whenever they were on - even if it wasn't very loud. There was contruction going on (I think above us?) for a few hours one morning - we woke up to what sounded like drilling. The street traffic was also a bit loud - we were east facing on the 12th floor. But I was most surprised when on our last night we were able to hear a guest in a room nearby snoring! I definitly expected thicker walls then that... my boyfriend said wearing earplugs is a quick fix for this problem but I don't feel that guests should have to wear them all the time. I'm not sure if we would stay here again. I think it might be worth checking out some other hotels in a similar price range to see if any offer free internet and have thicker walls. But other then that we enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frankie644
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and the concierges' recommendations were spot on! The Italian Kitchen had amazing food and was just down the street. The rooms were modern and well appointed. The room service was surprisingly quick and full service! The food was spectacular and Vancouver is such a romantic and beautiful city. This hotel added many positives to our weekend getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: avicov
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night before my flight back to London and had a nice big room on a high floor. Not a 'cosy' hotel and not much character and feeling of warmth from staff. Feels like a bus station in reception. However, rooms very nice and big. Breakfast not great. Very boring and bland. Very good location in the centre of Vancouver. Stay here for business but not a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: LeanneElizabeth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four days in November. We got this hotel on Priceline.com via name your own price. We figured any four star hotel in the downtown area would be fine. So we place our bid and were very happily surprised when our 80$ bid was accepted and we found out we got the Hyatt. Everything here was great. We had an early flight. We got into Vancouver much before our check in time. After doing some sight seeing our shoes were soaked because it was raining all day. I really wanted to get into some dry clothes. We decided to see if the hotel would let us check in early. With luck they were very accomidating. We were checked in early and up we went to our room. Our room was on the north side of the building facing the mountains and ocean on the 22nd floor. What a great view. The room had an all glass outside wall. The rooms were very modern, clean and large. Through out our stay the staff were all friendly and help full especially the concierge desk. This hotel is in a great location. Walking distance to Stanley park and right next to the Burrard sky train station. We had a great stay at this hotel and would be happy to stay here again next time. Thank you for the great experince Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: westeddy54
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency Vancouver and found the hotel to have excellent service, attentive staff, quiet and spcaious rooms and good value for my money. The breakfast in the restaurant had a wide variety of foods, coffe was great and we were seated immediately - a great start to a busy business day! The location in Vancouver is witih walking distance to all the major stores, restaurants and attractions. The Valet parking was expensive but worth the money and they delivered our car quickly when we needed it. In today's poor customer service world, Hyatt stands out as a leader! We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DandDToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business for 12 nights. Without exception, the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Reception was excellent. I had to extend my stay over a weekend when there was a major sporting event on and hotels were fully booked throughout the city. Somehow they managed to make space for me - truly outstanding service. Rooms could be quieter: traffic noise, especially emergency vehicles, and neghbouring guests could be heard quite clearly through a connecting door. An annoyance, but not a major issue. Rooms are a good size and are very well eqipped for business use. The in-room safe was big enough to take a laptop and there was a good working desk that was well lit and provided with a proper desk chair. Food in the restaurant was middling and breakfast expensive, but there are plenty of options in the vicinity. Rooms were cleaned to perfection and the expensive laundry service was efficient.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Comfort”
Reviews.Author: TOEBB
Reviews.Content: Our experience for our daughter's 21st Birthday, left us speechless, the suite was large, with two huge queen size beds, amazing views of the harbour and downtown Vancouver. At the family dinner in the restaurant, the staff surprised us with a wonderful plate of assorted treats, and a Happy Birthday written in chocolate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Yellowblood
Reviews.Content: Very convenient downtown vancouver. Close to shops, restaurants etc. Fantastic rooms and excellent service

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: RNandfamily
Reviews.Content: While we experienced very nice staff throughout (even when dealing with some very rude comments and behavior by travelers), there was one concierge who stood out-Raine Pimentel. She made our stay feel welcoming and fun. I would recommend the Regency Club upgrade because the lounge, food, and staff are worth the cost. We loved the room with the bathroom being set back so there was no light or noise pouring out into the bedroom area. The beds are comfortable and the rooms very nice. The location is great and being right off the light rail system was a bonus, but we ended up walking most places or taking a cab (inexpensive) for longer distances.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Evanna K
Reviews.Content: Absolutely convenient location, Just blocks away from water and the financial dinstrict. Fabulous staff I should say from the front desk to the house keeping to the inroom dining. Ver helpfull and accomodating. Rooms itself were very clean, bright and comfortable. Enjoyed the stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Went for work. Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rehan H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt for a few nights for a work related trip. I was impressed by the central location as well as the helpfulness of the staff. The only downside of my entire stay was the fact that WIFI was not included in the price of the room, and once I did pay and connect to WIFI, the service was a bit slow, and constantly cut in and out. The business center also charged to use wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt always has the best service”
Reviews.Author: artist81
Reviews.Content: In the past few years, I have spent 27 nights in Hyatt hotels for business and pleasure. They are always very good about requests. The hotel in Vancouver is very large. We had the breakfast buffet and it was excellent, especially the eggs benedict and the gravlax. If you have problems with windows not opening, your only choice is a balcony room. The shower is odd with the water coming out of the ceiling. The location is great if you take the skytrain as it is adjacent to the Burrard St. station. Best of all there is a Starbucks in the lobby. There is an Urban Fare supermarket on Alberni st just a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, nice service and location”
Reviews.Author: DrASToronto
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a very good hotel. I have travelled extensively and this was one of my better experiences. The room was nicely decorated and comfortable and the service was very good - friendly and helpful and the staff went out of their way to help me. I haven't seen service like this very often. I went to ask for directions to a restaurant from the concierge and she not only gave me directions but, unasked, called ahead for me to make sure I had a reservation. I was there for a conference and had some materials couriered to me and the front desk went out of their way to make sure I knew about it and to carry them to my presentation room for me. The only complaint I had about the room was that the beds "squeaked" and I couldn't figure out how to turn on some of the lights - it was a bit odd. But that is minor - the rest was great. The gym was good - wish there was some room for stretching, but it was a nice gym and the outdoor pool was a nice touch. I would stay here again - it was central, convenient to everything,very comfortable and great service.

Reviews.Title: “great stay great and staff !!!”
Reviews.Author: erica p
Reviews.Content: Beautifu people inside and out and a beautiful staff made a wonderful experience for our family...great location as well which is close to all you couild want !!!

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: mary1335
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent location for a downtown stay, no need for a car, one can walk everywhere including Robson St for shopping, the Pacific Centre Mall , and of course English Bay and the sea wall walk, sky train is within a 5 minute walk,20 minutes to Granville Island ! The hotel room is very comfortable. One draw back, if you don't have to have a car, don't take it as parking is pricey!!

Reviews.Title: “No problems whatsover.”
Reviews.Author: Bruce D
Reviews.Content: Family holiday to Vancouver, booked the Hyatt via a Travelzoo deal. Glad I did. It was my first time staying at a Hyatt hotel and it won't be the last based on the Regency in Vancouver. Room was clean with nice decor (felt different to other brands which was a change), checkin was easy and the receptionist was helpful and efficient. Location is as other reviews say....perfect....within walking distance of whatever you could need. We did not eat at the hotel but you are in downtown Vancouver so there is plenty of choice on your doorstep. The biggest plus point for me was that I ordered a rollaway bed for my son when I booked online afew weeks ago. Most times I get to a hotel and find that this request has not been actioned and I have to call down to reception again after getting to the room. This time we collected our keys...got up to the room..and lo and behold...a rollaway bed....just as ordered. A hotel that actually actions your requests before you check in. Excellent. One minor point...the free newspaper in the morning was a Wall St Times? Is it too much for a hotel in a Canadian city to give out a canadian newspaper?

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: pamelakmeyer
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect. It is very centrally located easy walking to (most) everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, exceptional "concierge level" service”
Reviews.Author: Miraclesmom
Reviews.Content: A wonderful (free) upgrade offered through Hyatt Gold Passport at Vancouver Hyatt Regency was a VERY welcomed "treat" ... Truly exceptional service, comfortable beds, quiet, professional service.

Reviews.Title: “Conference stay - central location, nice hotel, pricy”
Reviews.Author: Hawki56
Reviews.Content: Of course it is a nice property - it is a modern, up to date Hyatt, central downtown location, in one of the prettiest cities in the world. Everything about the room and the stay were satisfactory and what should be expected in a property like this. Pricing is the only question - $257 ($297 once all-in) a night, without parking, was a lot for what was received. I've stayed downtown in Vancouver at much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, food and very comfortable bed!”
Reviews.Author: SherwoodParkTucker
Reviews.Content: We spent this past weekend at the Hyatt Regency, and found it sooo relaxing! Not only was the bed very cozy & comfortable, but the room was very pleasing and quiet. Nice shower head, (not an annoying "water saver" type! Enjoyed a delicious meal at Mosaic on our first night. Stephen was our waiter and was very good at recommending what he thought were the "best" dishes (crispy won ton appetizer (stuffed with lobster, shrimp, etc.) was the BEST ever, as were the main dishes, - lamb, and paella). We took photos of the meal, because it looked too good to eat! Breakfast and lunch were also very enjoyable with excellent food and service. (awesome brunch choices) LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION! Great location to all shopping and other eateries. Starbucks is in the lobby, with McDonalds and Tim's right outside the front door (if you need to catch a quick "something"(and they are open 24hrs.) The food court in the adjoining Royal Center also has some great choices for quick meals, (including healthy choices), and each venu is very very clean!! The Rexall Drug store is also situated in the mall, in case there is something you forgot to pack. Both are only a 60 second walk from the lobby. Major bus lines stop right outside on Georgia St & Burrard, with the sky train on the north side of the hotel. If you want to stop into the church across the street, it's an absolutely beautiful Anglican Church, complete with stained glass windows.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: chrisTO_09
Reviews.Content: Had a great time staying here - it is well located for being downtown and right beside the Burrard station. That makes it absolutely easy to get around most of Vancouver. The staff were wonderful and very accommodating!! Look forward to staying again sometime as the room was very spacious with a balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location plus friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Seaem
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a beautiful property, the staff is helpful but the main reason I would probably stay there again is the great location. It was an easy walk to the museum, shopping and restaurants. I really liked the bar but the breakfast at the hotel restaurant was a bit pricey. The one aggravation was the charge for internet access. It amazes me that you get free internet access with Super 8 motels and have to pay a fee at the higher end hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Darghan
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in the Hyatt Regency Vancouver. The hotel is in a great location, right in the heart of Vancouver. I arrived early and the hotel staff were more than happy to allow me to check in early and also allowed a late check out at 2:00 pm even though they were fully booked. The hotel room was very large and comfortable with a great bed and good bathroom. The hotel staff were very helpful especially in recommending things to do and in giving directions. There is a shopping centre adjoining the hotel and there are lots of places to eat close by. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Ozlover1023
Reviews.Content: Like Hyatts are - modern standard, clean, normal service you would expect. Really nice is the location. It is close to almost everything and right next to the explorer bus stop. From our room on 33th floor incl balcony we had a really nice view over the town. Breakfast was quite nice overlooking the streets, nothing special though. The next day we went somewhere else. Don't try to take a drink up to your room. The waiter apparently had (!) to take the drinks up although we were happy to take them ourselves. Therefore she followed us into our room and we got charged double the price. That was quite ridiculous. Overall ok!

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: NanaimoRainbow
Reviews.Content: Recently went to Vancouver for 3 days and stayed at this hotel. We booked the hypo allergenic room, and it was great. The layout and the view up Burrard street was great. Service for breakfast was very nice, had the buffet, a little pricey but the quality was great. Would highly recommend this hotel if you need to stay in Vancouver, beautiful all around.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at this hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Alaina503
Reviews.Content: I had a good experience here. The room was clean and attractive. The staff was helpful; I got a great recommendation for Italian food from the concierge (Italian Kitchen). My father had purchased the room for my husband and I as guests, and there was no hassle or problem with the special payment arrangements. I was staying for my wedding anniversary, and I was given a complimentary bottle of wine and a congratulations note from the staff, which was very thoughtful. My only disappointments were the broken hot tub and the lack of cable channels, but overall, it was a positive experience and I'd happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for shopping & dining”
Reviews.Author: KateSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: First of all, it's hell trying to get into the driveway and parking garage- traffic is brutal, pedestrians never let you turn and many one way streets send you around and around trying to get there. But once you're in, leave the car parked and walk to Robeson, Howell and other nearby streets to enjoy the many diverse stores (many very upscale) and wonderful selection of restaurants. Hotel is typical for Hyatt but the rooms were incredibly comfortable, large and the view from the towers was phenomenal. Small outdoor heated pool that was very shallow and difficult to do laps in, but the outdoor spa had powerful jets and felt wonderful. Gym was okay with chilled towels, extra swim towels and equipment to borrow. Loved the ceiling shower head in the bathroom and even the arm chair in the room was comfy, only surpassed by the bed. Starbucks in the lobby and Tim Hortons and Micky D's next door. Walk a block to the west to visit a nice urban greenspace near the tube entrance and enjoy the waterfalls across the road. We'd stay there again next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Comfortable & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: GoWest77
Reviews.Content: We took the local transit Express 257 bus from the Horseshoe Bay ferry to downtown Vancouver & got off at Georgia & Burrard & simply walked across the street to the Hyatt Hotel. Upon arrival we were greeted by a friendly front desk clerk & check-in was smooth. Our room was clean, spacious & bed was very comfortable. The hotel was close to shopping with the Royal Centre Mall adjacent to the property & the Robson Street & Pacific Centre Mall within a couple of blocks-walking distance. Had a delicious lunch in Mosaics (excellent service) in the hotel over looking the bustling street below & later ventured out for dinner. Good ol' Starbucks is located in the lobby. There is a variety of nearby restaurants & for something quick, different & delicious try the downtown food carts. There is an extra charge for Internet connection & WI-FI. The fitness facility is open 24 hours a day but the heated pool & jacuzzi are located outside & closed @10:00pm. Staff was friendly-service was excellent. I used PriceLine & was really pleased with the hotel & the end result meant incredible savings = GREAT VALUE. Would be happy stay at the Hyatt again but I would not stay if I had to pay corporate (summer) rate.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Night in the City”
Reviews.Author: Vickie_Bernie
Reviews.Content: We won hockey tickets so we decided why not make it a weekend away. We booked the Hyatt for a great price and wasn't disappointed at all. We checked in around 3 pm and the front desk was very helpful and accommodating, mainly because I always want a non adjoining hotel room. We were given a room on the 20th floor with a king bed and a view to the West, can see Stanley Park thru all the high rises. Not so important as we just live 40 min. from the city. The next morning we arranged with the bell boy to store our bags until the afternoon. We enjoyed coffee downstairs at the Starbucks. Great location, right next to Burrard Skytrain station and walking distance to almost everything. Stores are right downstairs in Royal city Mall. Love the toilitries, and the bed was like sleeping on a pillow. Hubby loved the large flat screen tv. Bathroom was so nice we took pictures so we could refer to it when we want to renovate our bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: Kez02
Reviews.Content: After some initial delay in booking in to the Hyatt (a busy afternoon combined with a clumsy checkin procedure) this hotel was very comfortable. It's handy to have a Starbucks in the lobby and the nearby ATMs help too. The rooms were a good size and the beds were really comfy. The locaion of the hotel is fantastic. Easy access for the shops, the harbour and lots of restaurants nearby. Would be more than happy to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: oblimov18
Reviews.Content: I was given a very modern, spacious room on the 28th floor - excellent shower and good service all around.

Reviews.Title: “Desirable Location, Boutique Chic Room... Our 20th Anniversary Delight”
Reviews.Author: Lucky K
Reviews.Content: The warmth of hotel staff on arrival by door, bell and front desk staffl were followed by courteous and caring service from concierge, housekeeping, and restaurant personnel. As we arrived early, our luggage was placed in complimentary storage awaiting a room being ready. We were then given bottlled water for sightseeeing. Situated near name brand stores and specialty shops on Robson St., we found diverse restaurants in the area. Hop on and off circuit buses stop at this hotel as they cover the entire city including Stanley Park and a free shuttle to the Capilano Suspension Bridge. A waterfall shower from ceiling above tub was refreshing. An in room refrigerator was helpful. The self-service coffee was delicious and appreciated. 31st floor rooms facing South were scenic at sunset, but curtains had to be closed to avoid the room being heated by the sun. When at 6 PM our AC was not maintaining a desired tenperature, a call to the front desk resulted in the prompt appearance of courteous and competent technician who quickly diagnosed the problem and made the fix while we went to dinner. Upon our return, we found our room as cold as we had wished. Upon departure, bell service arranged a van cab for all our extra luggage from our 2+ weeks of touring and cruising from Alaska. Our driver perforned as a tour guide during the drive to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: eeliechick
Reviews.Content: Great hotel & location! Was very close to everything, great service, complimentary water in the room. Was very disappointed in the pricing of Parking ended up costing me around $50 for one night!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not your best choice in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: snowbirdYuma
Reviews.Content: This hotel puts itself out in the market as upscale but they have a lot to learn about customer service. Promised a king bed room - only to arrive and find we had a double bed. They have valet parking / self parking with in & out service / or just daily underground parking choices. They haven't figured out how to actually get a person and their car in and out of the parking lot when they have paid top dollar for the in and out service. The room keys stop opening your room door without warning - prompting a trip to the lobby and a long wait in line at the desk for a new key. The in house restaurant should be avoided by anyone who wants any sort of service. None of the staff have any idea what ingredients are in the different items and tell you what they think you might want to hear - no concerns about people getting ill because they ate something they shouldn't. They advertise fresh squeezed orange juice that come straight out of a Tropicane bottle. Poached eggs arrive at the table very cold. Waiters reek of second hand smoke when they lean over to fill your coffee cups. All of this at very high prices!

Reviews.Title: “The best-located hotel in Vancouver?”
Reviews.Author: Six-Pointer
Reviews.Content: Our 15th-storey balcony room overlooked the Fairmont Vancouver, but in no way were we envious not to be staying there. The Hyatt is perfectly situated, literally adjacent to Burrard Skytrain station, and a block away from Sears and the Vancouver Art Gallery.
