The room was generously sized (our bathroom was particularly large for the city centre) with huge King Size bed, decent TV (although poor choice of channels) and pretty good coffee (for a change). If I had to be critical, the entrance does not give much of a sense of occasion – there’s no real ‘lobby’ as such, just a Starbucks and a thoroughfare to a shopping arcade - and the walls between bedrooms are a little thin (in our case perhaps due to having a (locked) adjoining door into the next room). Also the lifts could be really slow in coming (very fast in taking you between floors though) although this is hardly to be unexpected in such a tall tower. On the whole, however, it’s first rate. I’ve stayed at the Sandman near Chinatown before and, for a little more change, the Hyatt is infinitely better. The pool and hot tubs are dramatically located under the city’s towers and great places to enjoy some peace after a busy day. Just a great city centre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Convenient, Classy”
Reviews.Author: podant
Reviews.Content: I arrived in town over 4 hours late as a result of a horrific train accident. It was about 2am when I checked in, and the quick and professional way I was taken care of was so soothing. The hotel is super sleek and modern, the room well appointed. Regarding Wifi, if you go to the Starbucks downstairs they will give you a code which lasts for a day, for the price of a cup of coffee. The location is one of the best, in terms of walk-ability to shopping, sightseeing, the water, museums, pubs, restaurants and more. The only thing I noticed in my room was the draperies were covered in dust all along the top.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: TravelNewbie99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and would definitely recommend it. We took the train from the airport to get to the hotel which was super convenient. There are lots of restaurants and shopping near the hotel and everything is within walking distance. We didn't have a car and I'm glad we didn't because parking is very expensive at the hotel. Check in was very quick and the staff were very friendly. Our room was very spacious and clean. The decor looked very modern and nice and new. The air conditioning in the room was surprisingly quiet that I could hardly hear it at night. Usually in hotels I hear the air conditioner going on and off all night and I don't sleep well, but I slept great at the Hyatt. The bathroom was clean, modern and also very spacious. There's a Starbucks downstairs in the lobby and a Tim Hortons and McDonalds right next door. The only downside was that there was no free internet, but that's usually the case for hotels like the Hyatt. Checking out was also quick and convenient since they had express checkout machines. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not disappointed!”
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get this hotel on the name you own price on Priceline. Often when hotels display their best rooms on their websites and the reality of a standard room can be disappointing but not here but not in this case. Large room with lovely modern finishing. Large bathroom, with shower and bath. Everything seems very new. There was a queue at reception on arrival but I notice the electronic check-in. So simple to use and fast, with your room key dispensed out of the machine. Within a couple of minutes, we were on our way to our room. We were only there for one night, do did not use the restaurant or bar, although they looked nice. Starbucks in the foyer was a plus, although directly outside of the hotel is a Tim Hortons, so we went for a double, double instead. Filter coffee machines are in room with a fridge available too. Much prefer this to an expensive mini bar, as you can stock with your own thing. Large flat screen tv an desk with a city view, even on the lower floors. The pool is not massive but it's open until 10pm and very quiet, so we went for a swim in the evening and a dip in the hot tub, which was a treat in the middle of downtown. The location is good, with the train right on the corner and walking distance to the waterfront. I wouldn't hesitate to go back and only have good things to say about this hotel. The staff were also very helpful and friendly. I would recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Charliekaren
Reviews.Content: 6th-11th September . Just got back from a fantastic time in Vancouver staying at the Hyatt. Excellent location for all your site seeing needs. Room on 25th floor with fantasic view. Bedroom big clean and bright and again bathroom good size with bath and shower. Starbucks in front foyer, which was very handy, also here you can get free internet. Which leads me onto the downside of the hotel. You have to pay for your Internet in the rooms which in this day an age should be free and it's expensive. The other downside is the bar should you wish to spend a night in. Looks to be the only part of the hotel which has not been updated and it's a shame because they did have a pianist playing, but the surroundings where not good. There is a pool on site which is heated and yes to a good temperature. Although the jacuzzi was extremely hot for some people. All in all a very good hotel and when I visit back in Vancouver I will certainly be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable for a Conference”
Reviews.Author: GlampingK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for eight nights for an educational conference. The location is great, and the hotel is accessible via a comfortable stroll from the Canada Line Sky Train station. Further to that, transportation from the airport is CHEAP and convenient if lugging carry on luggage. The room I had was spacious, with a good view, and comfortable bed. Hard wired high speed internet was available in my room at no additional charge, which I view as an attractive feature. The restaurant (Mosaic) food is good, but there are restaurants all over downtown Vancouver, and in close proximity that are GREAT. The elevators are quick and efficient, though they get overwhelmed for conferences as large as this one. I had the unique experience of being on the 34th (top) floor when the 6.4 earthquake struck September 10, and while the building swayed significantly, there was no rattling or cracking. The staff were very friendly and accomodating. I was not disappointed in any element of my stay at the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Poor basic facilities”
Reviews.Author: FirstBites
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two days and one night. I am surprised to understand that they do not provide the WI-fi internet facility. We need to pay for the use of the internet connection. They do not provide drinking water, which you need to buy. We had to pay for parking in their parking place. Otherwise, rooms are neat and it is in down town nearer to many places. When I walked around the down town, I saw smaller hotels provide such facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: hp18
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is close to all the tourist attraction. Robson st. Is two blocks walk, Stanley park 10 min bus ride, cruise terminal $5 taxi ride. The lobby area is a bite dated, but the room is clean and been updated. Thx Willy for ur suggestion & help.

Reviews.Title: “Would definetely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Ajram
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the hotel (end of august) - Very nice hotel - clean rooms - clean washrooms - very modern - All in all, I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “The Most Expensive Breakfast I've Ever Had”
Reviews.Author: patrickbpenguin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend with a friend. I'll start with the good: very nice property. Freshly renovated I believe. Our room was very spacious, very comfortable, and very clean. I love hotels with iHome clock radios to charge my phone on. Saturday evening was disrupted by a very loud party going on in the connecting room next door, but a call down to security took care of that in a reasonable amount of time. We had drinks and munchies in the downstairs bar. Very friendly service, prices were high but in line for this kind of hotel. No wifi reception though which made it difficult to conduct our business. Unfortunately there was one thing that really dampened my stay and unfortunately is what I will remember about the hotel - the most expensive breakfast we've ever had. Yes, we knew it wouldn't be a $5 Denny's meal and we pay for the convenience. $27 for the breakfast buffet. On the high side IMO but I'm in downtown Vancouver. But charging an extra $6 for orange juice AND $6 for coffee on top of that? Are you serious? We assumed it was included since it was a buffet and since the waiter didn't mention anything, pouring freely. Between my friend and I with tip, we had a breakfast close to 3 digits. Would I stay here again? Perhaps because everything else was very good but that breakfast experience left a very bitter taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: bongkeh
Reviews.Content: Staying 3 nights here, spacious bedroom, one block away to the robson st. 2block away from the liquor wine shop. And they have a good chinese restaurant just beside the hotel. The breakfast was great, tho it wasn't much variety but not bad. The staff was helpfull but yet kinda slow, but it was ok. No free wifi, which is sad and stingy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in All Ways”
Reviews.Author: Matt2540
Reviews.Content: Hotel has been renovated better than any other hotel that I've stayed at in the same condition. PROS: + Staff is awesome + Large rooms + Excellent sleep quality + Interior looks new + Really cool fixtures and features in the hotel + Views CONS: - Parking is $40+ per day - Internet access is $15+ per day - Vancouver has a very high rate of homeless and street druggies and they are in this neighborhood, too

Reviews.Title: “I'll find somewhere else next time!”
Reviews.Author: Tony J
Reviews.Content: Dated hotel with little to offer but ok rooms. Staff generally helpful, friendly and positive.. Felt like a transient hotel rather than somewhere to stay for any period of time. Good location. They have suites but are not really suites. Upgraded our room to a suite as a surprise for my wife only to find it was an identical room to a club room with access to another identical room with a sofa bed rather than a bed. No additional facilities. No mini bar in any room. And expensive internet connection. Fortunately I have a loyalty card that meant I did not have to pay. One restaurant - lifeless. Bars closed at 11pm! Sound proofing between rooms not great. Also expensive parking. Disappointed as generally I am a big supporter of Hyatt but will not be using thia one again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jimmythehat23
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very modern, and the rooms were very nice. The view from our window was amazing! The staff was very attentive and accomidating. The hotel has a coffee shop when you first walk in. Another nice feature was the shops right in the hotel. When we walked out of the hotel, you are right in the perfect place for scenery. The waterfront is just a few blocks away, and Canada Place is where all the cruise ships dock for cruises to Alaska. There are several good restaurants as well as plenty of great stores for shopping. Also plenty of night life in the area near the hotel. Transportation is right at your front door. You can take in the sights, without walking miles to find a ride. The people in Vancouver were very friendly, and I would recommend anyone to visit there.

Reviews.Title: “a must stay”
Reviews.Author: OrangecountyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We selected Hyatt for our 3 night get away to Vancouver for the location but was pleasantly surprised with the superior room. Upon check in, Tony at the front desk, informed us that they were running a special for Orbits customers. For just $30 a night more we could up grade to patio room and get a $20 a night room credit. Our room was on the 27th floor with a fantastic view. It was nice for a change to have the hotel give us a $60 credit which we used for room service. The bathroom was large and up dated with robes to enjoy relaxing in. The bed is a special brand made just for Hyatt so needless to say the most comfortable I have had the pleasure to sleep in. Go and enjoy the Hyatt as we did you deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “Every staff member was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Darmstrong1984
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt, and were pleased with our interactions with all staff members! Lorri at the concierge was extrememly helpful, and Vidya, our housekeeper was the friendliest housekeeper we have ever encountered. Thanks Regency Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 10withamop
Reviews.Content: Had to travel to Vancouver for work. Checked out the reviews and and booked the Hyatt. First off, location is perfect right near everything including public transit. You can walk to a number of restaurants and shops as well. Hotel itself has nice updated rooms and the staff was very friendly. Price for the city and location is just about right. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huntinghouse
Reviews.Content: The location could not be better. This, plus an amazing rate from Priceline, made this a perfect home base for our Vancouver visit. We had a car and parked in the hotel the first few days, but soon found a cheaper lot on Alberni (I am sure there are others, too). Getting around by car was quite easy, but we could also walk to a lot of attractions like Gastown and Stanley Park. We had a lovely large room, housekeeping service was excellent -- I came back to the room to get something and the maid was cleaning it. She checked my key to make sure it was indeed my room and I appreciated her caution. There are numerous restaurants in easy walking distance and a lot of high end shopping. There is a McDonalds and Tim Horten's right there, for quick and cheap stuff. W had a drink in the Mirage bar one night and the bartender was very helpful and forthcoming with restaurant suggestions and shopping tips. I truly enjoyed our stay here and would happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location … nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: coxychap
Reviews.Content: With the train station on the opposite corner, and within walking distance of Canada Place and the main streets, this hotel is in a great spot. We were high up so didn't suffer from traffic noise, and the view was great - through the glassy skyscrapers to the sea and mountains. We had a very good-sized room with a balcony and a comfortable bed. A fridge in the room certainly helped, and the coffee making facilities OK. Good TV and the iPod dock/alarm was very useful, though I'll say nothing about Canadian TV as that's not the hotel's fault! The shower was (as in so many hotels) a bit hit and miss. You had to get the temperature setting just right, and the fact that the shower head came from the ceiling with very little movement, meant that you could hardly avoid the water while trying to get the temperature right. Staff were helpful and friendly (especially the concierge), and the hotel felt clean and cool. There's a Starbucks in the lobby with free wifi (once you get the password) so that's a real bonus - you don't have to pay for the hotel's wifi service which only gives you one computer or smartphone access for the price. 2 x smartphones? 2 x fees! We didn't eat there at all (too many nice places for breakfast etc.) but, overall, a very good place to stay if you want to be a t the heart of things in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back Even Though We Had to Pay for Internet”
Reviews.Author: datacat
Reviews.Content: We put a huge amount of care into choosing our hotels. We are fussy about cleanliness and air quality and noise and all that, but we also really hate to spend huge amounts of money for a bed and bathtub. After a fair amount of research, we decided that you might as well go for the good stuff in Vancouver. Staying outside of the city center seemed to offer no significant price advantages. The Hyatt is steps away from Robson Street, which pleased my wife. We had an interesting choice of restaurants within walking distance. The room was pristine. Crisp white linens, shiny bathroom, little refrigerator, newish TV, great view and real glass glasses for our nightcap. The noise level (bathroom fan and air conditioner) was very good. The parking was weird. According to the sign in the front of the hotel, Valet Parking would be $48.00 and self-parking would be $38.00. For $10 for ten minutes I thought I would do it myself. Because of some confusion when entering the garage, I wound up talking to the attendant. By paying my own, and not using the hotel system, I paid $27.00. (So self-parking saved me $21.00.) My one major complaint is that that the internet cost almost $17.00. Sorry, I think internet should be like electricity and running water. What was worse, however, is that pay system doesn't not deal with two devices. If my wife accessed the internet on her iPad, I had to reconnect on my computer, and vice-versa. I would say that through twelve hours I logged on at least fifty times. On check-out, I complained, both about paying and about the problem of having two devices. She said that next time, we should pay separately for both devices (so that each one has its own connection) and that they would refund the cost of the second one on check-out. Don't take my word for it, though. Arrange that when you check in. We will go back. The room is comfortable, the price competitive and the location superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: comingforthesun
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through Priceline and got it for 103.00 US a night. Check in was smooth, we upgraded $ 30.00 for a King and a balcony with a vIew. We were also given a $ 20.00 room credit because we went through Priceline. So we bought coffee and yogurts for breakfast. It was a great deal. We loved this hotel! The convience of the Skytrain right next door was one of the reasons, another reason being it is very central to everything. Great king size beds with ample size bathroom with tub. I like the shampoo product too. The work out room is good and it looks onto the outdoor pool. Cold towels in the fridge for after your work out. ( I love that) Lots of equipment. It opens at 6am. Filtered water to fill up your bottle. Had a great stay. Only downside was we went to dinner at the Flying Pig.... not impressed. It is a new place opened in Yale town..... But Brunch was great ... we went to Medina Cafe! I hope this helps in your choice of Hotels downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel convenient to convention center, waterfront, and shopping”
Reviews.Author: skinnyjones
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location convenient to shopping areas and the convention center. I walked daily to the convention center for a conference and strolled around at night finding various nice places to eat right in the neighborhood. There is access to public transportation immediately outside the hotel. The rooms are very nice - big and decorated well. They have a very nice desk area with trendy lighting. The bathroom was also excellent. I tried the restaurant one night, and found it to be average and a bit awkward. Overall a great place to stay if you're going to a convention or exploring the city for a few days prior to leaving out on a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown business hotel, excellent amenities”
Reviews.Author: Darlox
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Vancouver is a well-located and well-appointed hotel with a few quirks, but a generally pleasant stay. For conferences or other events at Canada Place, it's a more economic option than the ultra-high-end hotels on the waterfront, but the Hyatt doesn't skimp on amenities or comfort. Read on for more: LOCATION: Located near the corner of Georgia and Burrard Streets, about 4 blocks south of the Convention Center and Coal Harbor waterfront, the Hyatt is within easy walking distance of many key locations in downtown Vancouver. It's about a $35 taxi ride (depending on traffic) from Vancouver Int'l Airport, or about a 7-minute (3 block) walk from the Canada Line - City Center Station, for those who can use the airport train. The hotel is steps from the Vancouver Art Gallery and several theaters, and quite walkable to local shopping districts and Chinatown. For athletic types, it's within about a 20-30 minute walk from the key attractions in Stanley Park. PROPERTY: The hotel is a fairly typical high-rise business hotel in the downtown area. The lobby area is large and well-organized, including self-service check-in kiosks along with the manned desks. There is a Starbucks in the lobby, as well as a hotel bar open in the evenings. The hotel has a conference/meeting center on the first floor as well. Just across the driveway is a 24-hour Tim Horton's location, along with a McDonalds, for those who need a desperate late-night bite... Valet and self-park are available on-site, but prices were somewhat exorbitant -- if you're driving to Vancouver, you may want to consider stashing your car outside of town and riding the train in! There is wireless Internet available in the guest rooms, but no public WiFi in the lobby except the Starbucks network for coffee buyers, or the Hyatt Meeting channel that is password-protected for meeting clients. ROOMS: The rooms are about half-way between classic comfortable and ultra-contemporary. The work spaces, large comfy beds and plush room chair were all comfortable and immaculately clean. There was an in-room refrigerator available, along with a bar-service area, though (if it ever had one) in-room minibar items are no longer provided. The closet was spacious, and there were two luggage stands available in the room. Both wired and wireless Internet were available, and quite fast, though they come at a per-day or per-week charge, which is not inexpensive. (Platinum members get complimentary Internet.) The one negative part about the room was the bathroom. While there was plenty of water pressure, even on our high floor, the shower is just strange. Rather than a traditional shower head, there is a _slightly_-adjustable metal square set into the ceiling above the bathtub. About a dozen holes staggered in the plate make up the shower. In addition to being a rather poor shower to begin with, the central location above the tub, and the almost-nonexistent adjustability, made showering a bit of a challenge... Whether you want to wash your hair or not, it's going to get wet, and getting soap out of those... *ahem*... "hard to reach places" is harder than it ought to be, since the shower head is directly above you, shooting basically straight-downward. Thumbs-up on the room, the view, and the cleanliness. Thumbs-down on taking "contemporary design" to the point where form destroys function... AMENITIES: The hotel has an excellent concierge available in the lobby. There is a fitness center, with reasonably modern equipment, available for guests and open 24-hours. A well-rated restaurant (we didn't eat there) is on the second floor, along with the lounge/bar and Starbucks in the lobby. Room service is available. Internet, as mentioned, was fast and reliable, though you have to be in rooms or one of the other public areas outside of the lobby -- in the lobby, buy a coffee from Starbucks to get Internet access. STAFF: The staff we encountered was very friendly, and very helpful. Check-in and Check-out were seamless. Concierge service was very knowledgeable and helpful. Bell service handled our bags quickly and with care. Housekeeping did a great job of keeping the room in top-shape -- though, I will note, that the "Privacy" door hanger is an essential if you plan to sleep in past 8 AM, since that's when housekeeping starts knocking... Overall, we were very satisfied with our stay at the Hyatt. The staff made us feel welcome, and the rooms were top-notch. For the price, it was every bit as good a stay as the more pricey Pan Pacific or Fairmont hotels on the waterfront. If you're attending a conference, or plan to spend most of your time in the downtown business district, you'll be hard-pressed to find a better option for the price, than the Hyatt. Giving it 4-dots for an excellent stay, but less-than-excellent in-room bathroom and a few annoyances such as the lack of Internet in the lobby, and no serious airport shuttle options other than taxi or a walk to the train. Still, would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Repeat stay...still quite nice.”
Reviews.Author: letterdude
Reviews.Content: We enjoy staying at the Vancouver Hyatt due to it's location and that the hotel maintains good standards. As usual, our room was nice. No balcony, this time, however. Next time, I'll specify, as this makes the room, which can seem a little small, far more enjoyable. The bed is very comfortable. Top notch. A/c is quiet. That counts, if you've ever been in a room where it rattles the walls! What's up with the expensive internet, though? And, to be truthful, it was really quite slow. The bathroom was great. Large enough. Water was fine. Nice fixtures. All of that. Like a number of other hotels in which I've stayed, recently, one must hunt for ice! In this case, the machines are on the 4th floor...same as the fitness centre and pool. The fitness centre is better than average. Nice machines. The pool is ok. Outdoors with a decent enough hot tub. *tip! If you're staying during the summer and wish to get some poolside tanning in, you'll need to be out there by 12:30 pm and expect it to be gone by 3:00 pm. This is due to the Hyatt being surrounded by other large buildings. I timed it. Count on this as being very accurate! Overall, another nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and a cool room”
Reviews.Author: Bumblebarb
Reviews.Content: I went up to Vancouver on a family trip with my sister and her family -the hotel was my downtime away from the kids. I arrived at around 11PM on a Friday -frustrated after losing my directions and then finding several streets blocked off. the desk clerk immediately made the stress go away by explaining the parking well (cheap on weekends,expensive during the week) and generally makingiteasy to get checked in. Every other interaction I had with the staff was just as good. The room was nicely decorated in a cool modern way. It was also one of the cleanest rooms I've been in. Lots of blanket and pillow options on the bed,so you can find something that will work for whatever the room's temperature,and your own. The room safe actually held my laptop - not all do. The shower was pretty cool-installed in the ceiling. They even had good cable channels.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: mubwubba
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern upscale rooms. Pleasant professional staff. Excellent location for walking to Sunset Beach, Robson St shopping, the harbor front/ convention centre and Gastown. I booked a balcony king room. The balcony is huge. A patio table and chairs would have been a nice touch. There was lots of street noise however it was well muffled and wasn't overly distracting.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: MelCarv
Reviews.Content: A group of girls and I stayed at the hotel and found it to be mediocre. The beds seemed rather small, the walls were paper thin, housekeeping was knocking on the door by 830 and the interet was priced sky-high. I was surprised to find that the wifi wasn't free. Especially considering we just did Europe where free wifi was abundant. Not that this hotel was horrible, but with all the options in Vancouver i probably wouldn't be returning to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt nice room, easy to sleep with black out curtains..”
Reviews.Author: JForster150793
Reviews.Content: the Hyatt dowtown is centrally located, close walk to Gastown or Robson... Rooms are nice, ask for higher up rooms on the even numbered room side.. I enjoyed the room as it had navy/ blackout curtains and wrap around curtain rods that cover well over the windows...makes for a better nights sleep.. I didn't enjoy paying $15 for wi-fi as it should be included in top notch hotels...and Valet parking for $48 which I think is a little steep- even in downtown Vancouver Overall good location, good room, pricy on extras..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely property, staff the best part though.”
Reviews.Author: n0labear
Reviews.Content: Nice large, modern rooms - we had a big balcony looking down Burrard St to the inlet and north shore mountains behind. Stayed for our anniversary, the front desk clerk who checked us in had a handwritten card and special gift sent up for us the first night we were there. All the other staff we interacted with were great including in the restaurant where we were blown away by the special dessert we were presented!

Reviews.Title: “Had a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: ajs23
Reviews.Content: I loved the decor of the room and they were able to fulfill our request of being on a high floor. It was a our anniversary so we really appreciated that! The bathroom and room were spacious. The front desk staff was helpful and were able to help us with any questions we had. We will be back for sure :)

Reviews.Title: “Well...”
Reviews.Author: bwrightva
Reviews.Content: Nobody likes feeling nickel and dimed, but that's how I felt after a stay in the Hyatt Regency. Our 15th floor room had stunning views, the bed was comfortable, and the stone-tiled shower was sublime. But really? $15 for 24 hours of internet access? Why on earth does a four star hotel, which charges hundreds per room per night, charge for something as basic as wifi access? I understand a parking fee, but when it comes to internet, that should be standard. The starbucks in the lobby had free wireless, though it was somewhat spotty. To be fair, the rest of our stay was just fine. Check-in and check-out were simple, the location was unbeatable, and the staff we encountered were cordial. But come on, Hyatt, please include free wireless - is that too much to ask?

Reviews.Title: “Effective, no thrill Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pprhh
Reviews.Content: Spent there 2x 2 nights with family incl. 2 kids of 8 and 11. Our stay went seamless, great location, great concierge, good breakfast, value for money in line with other Hyatt hotels. Would return or recommend to a friend

Reviews.Title: “Great room, fantastic staff and brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: simpsob
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through RCI using our timeshare points for a 14 night stay to celebrate a special birthday. The hotel is in a great location just a few minutes walk from the main shopping street, Robson and right next door to the Skytrain station at Burrard. There are also numerous bus stops along Burrard making it really easy to get around the city. The reception staff were efficient and extremely helpful and we were given a large double room on the 12th floor. The room was spacious with a great view over the city and was spotlessly clean with a good sized bathroom. The Concierge staff were particularly helpful and we felt that nothing was too much trouble for them. We did eat breakfast in the hotel for the first few days but the buffet at $26.95 CAN each was quite expensive. Having said that the breakfast buffet was very good and although not really worth the high price it was quite helpful to use the restaurant until we got our bearings. We found a few better priced places to eat and if you want something quick then the Tim Horton's breakfast was very good and very cheap! Tim Horton's was available 24 hours and is right next door to the hotel (as is Macdonald's). Food is quite expensive in Vancouver but there are lots of nice places outwith the City centre and the street food at the fresh food markest is excellent. Would recommend the hotel as it was a great base and the room was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect business class hotel, no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: travelmedstudent
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business, I have no complaints the room was updated nicely, bright, wifi (although I didn't realize this till the last day) and a Starbucks in the lobby. I also like that the fridge was in the room, there is a grocery store a little walk away so it was nice to be able to put food in there. The shower in the room was also very nice. I was between floors 25-30, the view was also nice. Next to the bedside table there was a speaker system for apple/mp3 players which was a nice surprise. I would stay here again if need be.

Reviews.Title: “Room needs upgrade. Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: cynthia3212
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Vancouver for three nights. We used to love staying at the Hyatt but this time around, I noticed that the hotel is getting rundown. The rooms especially needed some upgrade in order to maintain a 5-star status. What I love about Hyatt is that they offer free coffee and the service is excellent. The location is also very central.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: ViewontheHudson
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, courteous, helpful staff. We stayed on the club floor (29) in a very comfortable well kept room with a nice view of the city. This was standard Hyatt with respect to the artfully, stylisly designed modern room. The bathroom had a rainfall shower in the ceiling - though probably one of the smallest rainfall shower heads I have seen. Nevertheless, bathroom and amenities were all quite nice. We took advantage of the club lounge for drinks and breakfast (nice retreat with very helful staff). We had lunch at the Mosaic Bar and Grille on the second floor. Food was very good with nice view of Burrard St. We took advantage of the free wireless internet for our blackberry's emails without incurring roaming data charges.

Reviews.Title: “5 star customer service experience”
Reviews.Author: yyesiamtrish2
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed this hotel before, and have stayed here once a month for the past while. Now, after staying once again for two nights and then going immediately on holidays, (when we stayed at more hotels), I really felt I had to comment on the consistency of the 5 star experience you recieve everytime you walk through the lobby one more time. Good value for $$. Excellent customer care from everyone you encounter. Great rooms, very clean, spacious, comfortable. Lots of plug ins for all the electronics we all pack. You have lots of hotel choices in the downtown area of Vancouver, so it might feel overwhelming if you are unfamilar with the city. So I will tell you that this location is perfect for business or pleasure. The hotel is surrounded by shopping and dining options, across the street from the sky train, a 30-40 dollar cab ride to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: RHBaird
Reviews.Content: We would definitely recommend this hotel. Great location and excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, expensive ammenities.”
Reviews.Author: Jennabebop
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely and the service was fine, we didn't experience anything wildly positive or negative. The room was clean, bed was comfortable and view was great. It is located in the banking/business district of the city, it doesn't have quite the relaxed, local flavor that the West End and other neighborhoods have, but many attractions within easy walking distance and easy access to transportation to things that weren't. Very easy walk to the harbour, Gastown, and the entertainment district. The ammenities here were expensive, $37 CAD a day for parking, $15 CAD for wireless, etc. We chose not to dine at the hotel because there were many other wonderful options nearby, so I can't review the value of the onsite options. There were 24 hr. fast food places right next door (McDonalds and Tim Horton's) which was convenient for late nights or a coffee in the a.m. Would recommend this hotel if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but amenities were pricey”
Reviews.Author: KarlPCalgaryAB
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to this hotel, but not Vancouver. We wanted to try something different and be closer to the action in the heart of downtown Vancouver. The room itself was very good. They have obviously renovated in the last few years and it shows. We paid a little extra for a balcony room but could not get a high floor. The location is super convenient - Robson is just a short walk away and the Sky Train line is a block away. I wanted internet access but am not willing to pay $15 per day for it. So I just used the free wi-fi at the Starbucks in the hotel lobby - that was good enough for me. Seriously, with what you pay for a hotel in downtown Vancouver, you'd think the least they could do is throw in free wi-fi. They don't charge to use the pool. I even checked out the business centre and they want money to use internet in there too! We got a bed and breakfast special which gave us free breakfast in the restaurant every day. Good thing it was free too, the bill came to over $60 for two people. So in summary, I guess the location was the best attribute of this hotel. But the bad taste they left in our mouth with all the nickel and dime-ing us for amenities means we didn't think it was the best value for the money. It's funny how something so seemingly insignificant can leave such a big impression.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: SkuNKik
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for 3 days upon finishing a cruise and were greeted with warm hospitality and excellent service. As we were celebrating a special occasion, one of the managers went out of his way to do something special for us. We rarely get this kind of a service from a large chain. This Hyatt is great! Rooms really nice, comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “All about the view”
Reviews.Author: Nomad1248
Reviews.Content: It's a Hyatt. You know what you're going to get. Nice conference facilities, good service, very helpful front desk staff, Starbuck's in the lobby. But in Vancouver, it's all about the view. The location is great so I had a view of the water and the mountains. Three blocks to the waterfront, two and half to the train to the airport. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Night staff barged into our room”
Reviews.Author: Marina2121
Reviews.Content: To start, when booking with hotels.com we were informed we would receive a $125 in-house credit for our three night stay. Upon check-in the agent knew nothing of this policy. We later phoned reception to enquire about this and were told they would get back to us. Later that evening a piece of paper was stuffed under our door highlighting our exemption to the in-house credit since we booked through a third party. While we weren't too concerned about not receiving our credit, we didn't appreciate the way they went about it without even a phone call-just that note, stuffed under our door. Our final night was the worst. We were playing music at the end of the evening, perhaps it was a little bit too loud. After a short while we received a phone call but were unable to answer in time. Several moments later, two male staff entered our room and said we needed to turn the music down. We were flabbergasted. Neither of us even heard a knock. Keep in mind our music was playing on the i-doc provided so it could only be so loud. Several friends of mine in the hotel industry have informed me that hotel staff aren't permitted to just enter your room unannounced and it is in fact against the law. After we returned home I phoned the manager to lodge a formal complaint. I left a message and still have had no reply five days later.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: KSB_10
Reviews.Content: I was lucky to get a really nice and spacious room with a view of the city. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was large and had all the amenities I would expect in a hotel of this class. Service was courteous and attentive. The location is also very good: a few blocks from the convention center and the harbour and close to shopping and restaurants. No difficulty catching a cab when needed. My only complaint would be the Internet connection which was rather deficient for a $15 fee one but other than that, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect for the price in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: bamboostar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located, especially for a first-time or short-term visitor to Vancouver. It is close to both the waterfront as well as many major sights in the downtown core. For art lovers, the Vancouver Art Gallery is just steps away. It is an easy walk to Robson Street, Gastown, Access by Skytrain from the Airport is very convenient. Vancouver City Centre Station is the closest stop but Waterfront Station is not too far either. This hotel met my expectations, but did not exceed them. It has all the amenities expected of a hotel of its class but you would not want anything less for the rate charged. The rooms are well appointed, clean and comfortable. As with many higher end business hotels, there is an exorbitant charge for Internet access. I attended a conference here so I spent several solid days in the hotel. The conference facilities were very good and the food was excellent, which is more than I can say for most hotel conference food that I have experienced elsewhere! Conference catering staff were not exceptionally friendly and were almost curt during the end of breakfast service when conference attendees almost had to hunt down cutlery and coffee. However, other meal service times were smooth. My one gripe was the front desk staff's blatant attempts to upsell conference guests to superior (read: more expensive) rooms. I discovered later that this upselling was inconsistent. Some guests were automatically upgraded while others paid differing charges for rooms higher up with a supposed view. I was suckered into upgrading as I was told that one of the superior rooms was available when I arrived for early check-in whereas other guests were simply given a free room. The upside is that after learning of these inconsistencies and calling the front desk to complain, the charges for most nights were reversed. I think it all depends on who is serving you, which goes against the consistency in service that Hyatt tries to put forward. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt Regency Vancouver and found my room to be quite comfortable and a relaxing refuge from the conference.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Annonymous56
Reviews.Content: Ok 4-star hotel, nothing fancy, nothing terrible. Service was good. The receptionist was very nice and profesional. Rooms were clean. Free wireless internet in the room which I always like. Good location, close to shopping area. CONS - Only minor - Poor choice for the shampoo and body lotion in the room. No shower gel (only soap). No shower cap. No slippers, no bath robe. Bar fridge with 4 beers, nothing else. We did not test other facilities in the hotel. Overall, I would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: irvinekalbi
Reviews.Content: Was here for a conference and the hotel was sufficient for the purpose. Not the grandest of the Hyatts I have stayed at, but the hotel was clean, comfortable, spacious, and can't beat the location. Didn't eat here so no comments regarding the food.

Reviews.Title: “One of my top choices in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: CascadeTraveler2
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel probably 6 times and enjoyed each stay. That's why we keep going back. The front desk is always friendly and walks you to the elevator. I thought that was a nice touch. The lobby is nice as well. I would have to say the most important reason that we stay here is because the rooms are modern, clean, and quiet. I love how the rooms are decorated. I like that it's in a centralized location in one of the most beautiful cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: LizHS88
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt with my 2 children and had a great time! The room was wonderful and so comfortable and obviously newly rennovated. The front desk staff always greeted us with a smile, in fact all members of staff did. We ate at the hotel restaurant a few times and was amazed by the the staff there too. Each time we arrived the English hostess greeted us with a smile and seemed genuinely interested in how our day was etc. We dined in the restaurant 4 times and each time she remembered us and our name which meant a lot. The server was also so friendly and went beyond what I would expect in a regular restaurant. Thanks very much Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value”
Reviews.Author: ashawna
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I have Fibromyalgia - a syndrome not unlike Rheumatoid Arthritis. The common symptoms are aching joints, severe muscle pain and being hyper sensitive to pressure points. That means I have to stay at hotels that have either memory foam mattresses or memory foam or foam mattress toppers. Even a luxurious pillow top mattress can be painful if it is button tufted with many convolutions. We were heading to Vancouver for our 25th wedding anniversary and wanted to stay somewhere nice downtown. I liked what I read on tripadvisor. I wrote the hotel about my health problem and had a phone call from the assistant manager of housekeeping within a few hours of my email. They were able to find me a feather bed and would have the bed made up for me before our arrival. Feedback: The hotel is located extremely close to a main subway line which made it very convenient for taking the subway directly from the airport to his hotel. We never had to rent a car or pay for parking which can be quite expensive for downtown Vancouver. The central location was great for transit, shopping and sight seeing. We managed to get a great AAA/AMA rate which included an excellent quality full buffet breakfast (including made to order omelets) on a daily basis and the best muffins in the city. The room was extremely clean and had been renovated to a clean, urban look but definitely was not luxurious like 5 star hotels we usually stay at. The lighting was excellent for reading. We had a connecting door with neighbors but did not hear any noise whatsoever on our four day stay. The housekeeping staff were extremely attentive to see that my stay was comfortable with the feather bed - every staff member we encountered on our stay were extremely accommodating. We had asked for an upgrade to a high room with a view and balcony but were only able to get a room with a balcony as we were told that the higher floors only have king sized beds (we needed two doubles). We were charged an extra $20 a day for a balcony on the 9th floor but never ended up using it - because there really was no view to speak of - just office buildings in all directions.The pool and jacuzzi were very basic and the gym quite adequate. The bathtub is built for the shower and definitely not for soaking. My husband said his bed was quite comfortable but it had a common problem that most hotels do that haven't replaced their beds for awhile - after guests keep sleeping on the same side of the bed over and over - the bed starts to slope to one side. This made my feather bed kind of a moot point - I was sleeping at an angle which meant my body was fighting gravity all night and therefore I would wake up in pain everyday. Housekeeping did all that they could to rectify this for me but it just didn't work out. I think that the average person who doesn't have a health issue like mine would probably have found the beds quite suitable for their needs. We did not want to pay the extra $15 a day for wireless internet - thinking we could just use the business office for our computer needs but found that they were also charging for the use of the business office unlike most hotels that we stay at. My husband and I have always traveled for a hobby for the last 25 years and have stayed in hundreds of hotels across Canada, the US and Europe. We would say that this hotel meets your basic needs. If you want more luxury - you are going to pay quite a lot more for it in Vancouver. Try to get the AMA/AAA rate if you can - you cant beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: joecambra
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here & loved it ! Very centrally located to alot of fun sights.You could walk to almost everything,if not taxi ride very quick.Staff could not be more service oriented & friendly!Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Expected more for the price paid...”
Reviews.Author: smilie604
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Canada weekend and the hotel was absolutely packed. Must say I expected more being a "Regency" Hyatt. Booked one of the Regency Club rooms and was more than the average room. Only perk that I was aware of booking the Regency Club room was there a lounge that included Breakfast. Found out the next morning that the room included complementary internet which was on a phamlet that was slipped under our door late at night. Otherwise the hotel is central right beside Burrard Station and Robson Street is just two blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: mitzyli
Reviews.Content: What I like about the Hyatt Regency Vancouver: * Excellent location: everything I needed was within walking distance * Proximity to public transportation * Great view from my room * Clean with contemporary decor * Friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel but avoid public holidays”
Reviews.Author: candyichiban
Reviews.Content: Pros: Unparalleled location (5-10 mins walk to ANYWHERE in the city), 2 small blocks from the Vancouver City Centre subway station (if you are taking the train in from the airport, which is less than 25 mins ride), friendly and professional staff, has a Starbucks in the lobby with wifi. We were there for Canada Day, and had a view of the street parade from our room (the street corner where the hotel is located is where the parade made a turn), loved the whole room, especially the bathroom! Cons: Check-in is 4pm (no later than 3pm is reasonable in my opinion), the room walls are fairly thin (we could hear the guests next door), the windows are not very soundproof (given the national holiday, there was a lot of partying/sirens/traffic on the streets late into the night, and we were able to hear everything from the 16th floor). Overall opinion: Definitely prefer this hotel to the previous one we stayed at in Vancouver. However, if next time we visit also happens to fall on a public holiday/long weekend, I might consider staying at another hotel in a less central area. Otherwise, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Recieved by every Employee”
Reviews.Author: burkean
Reviews.Content: Was welcomed by the front desk who saw that we had picked up some alcohol from the boarder and offered to have ice delivered to the room- why yes, thank you. He upgraded our room complimentary, with a beautiful view and a balcony- another very nice gesture. The next morning we ate breakfast at Mosaic, which was so delicious we ate there twice and had great service both times, Ali was one of the servers who was attentive to our table and very kind. Every employee greeted us with a smile, went above and beyond to make our stay very special. Will definitely return to this hotel with a great location to the water, shopping, and in the heart of downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms and Service! I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyG5000
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Hotel was a beautiful hotel with great service, renovated rooms and located in the heart of Vancouver. Sleek modern looks and minutes away from Stanley Park and Gas Town by foot. If you're going to stay in a nice hotel, in a prime location, then thi is greatly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: sk9758
Reviews.Content: As I planned my trip to Vancouver, I was getting confused which hotel to chose. Ultimately decided on the Hyatt and I am not regretting it at all. Check in was swift and I was delighted to know that we had been upgraded to one of the bi-level suites on the 32nd floor. We had opted for the e- standby upgrade option and that gave us an upgrade to the Regency Club as well for half the usual price! The hotel is definitely showing signs of its age which you notice as the elevator creaks its way up but everything else is perfectly in order. The suite was spacious and had a balcony too with breathtaking views. We enjoyed watching the parade and fireworks of Canada day celebrations right from our balcony. The Regency Club was ordinary and offerings very subpar as compared to other hotels executive club lounges. However what makes the place stand high above the others is the level of customer service! Each and every staff member I encountered, from the reception to the bell boy to the valet parking to the housekeeping ...you mention it,,,were outstanding and exceptional in their performance. This is something I have rarely seen in my travels around North America. You might see it is in Asia but not in USA for sure. I was definitely unhappy to check out from my 5 day stay and wish I could return soon to this lovely hotel with excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: RNS3
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, staff was extremely helpful and courteouus. Stayed on an upper floor (30th) and room was very quiet. Starbucks in the lobby is very convenient for a quick cup of coffee or for a business meeting location. For families, there is a 24 hour McDonald's right outside the front door of the hotel (We enjoyed it too for a quick breakfast or afternoon ice cream). Hotel has a room on the 4th floor which contains several ice machines and can be accessed by one's room key. Nice feature since it keeps noisy ice machines off of other floors. Very modern rooms with wide variety of conveniences, including in room coffee pot, iron and ironing board, wide selection of fine toilet articles, hair dryer, and flat screen TV. Obvious that the hotel has been recently renovated and has a nice new fresh feeling. Highly receommend bthis hotel! Only 3 blocks from the convention center and the water where the cruise ships come in. Only negatives, and these are minor, is that you have to pay a fee for wireless connection.

Reviews.Title: “"The Best"”
Reviews.Author: help014
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Hyatt Regency Vancouver for the past 8 days. Bryan Watson sorted out my reservation and made it manageable. We could see from the beginning that he cares about the patrons of thshotel. Manager Michael helped us with our room selection over the phone before we got here and helped us with an assessible room selection for August 19th when we willreturn. Michael knows people and is a great help in making us feel special. Our room was nicely prepared by Francisca and I got to know her as a friend. She's special. And what can I say about Emily, Kay, Raine, and Yvette in the Regency club. Top notch and we've see most of your Hyatts worldwide. That crew cares!! All in all, one of our best stays ever and the personnel of this hotel made the difference. We'll not stay anywhere else in Vancouver except the Hyatt and we have equal status in Starwood properties. This hotel stands head and shoulders above the rest!--Ron @Arlinda Martien (G46430731r @ G30479804a.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SouthernBelle74
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here on a recent trip to Canada. We made the purchase through Priceline - which can be a gamble - but this one was a winner. We arrived early, and were pleasantly surprised to find our room ready. It was very nice, spacious, and clean. They even had an umbrella in the closet for rainy Vancouver days. The staff were super friendly. The Hyatt is in a perfect location - walking distance to the water front, just 2 blocks over from shopping/restaurants on Robson St, and right next to the subway station. Our only complaint was the high cost of wi-fi access (around $15 per day). We ended up using the Starbucks around the corner, where wi-fi is free.

Reviews.Title: “Management puts the Hyatt brand to shame - AVOID AT ALL COST”
Reviews.Author: wdonson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two times over the course of a week end of June, and must say that while the property and the room itself was satisfactory, the behavior by the front desk staff and management (Mr Si in particular) was completely unacceptable. As a frequent Hyatt visitor at several of the chain's hotels including Park Hyatt and Andaz properties around the world both during private visits and as a corporate account guest , I was truly appalled with how the staff and the duty manager at that time dealt with a sensitive issue relating to me checking-out from the room. Without going into to much detail about the incident, a hotel of this caliber should treat all its customers and in particular the loyal ones as a guest that is extended whatever assistance needed to make both their stay comfortable and relaxing. Instead I experienced borderline hostility and general coldness from the staff resulting in hardly getting any sleep before a very long intercontinental flight the coming morning. I will never return to this property, and in general my attitude towards Hyatt as a chain has been seriously dented.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: figment7
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with excellent staff. The hotel is located within walking distance to the waterfront and is in the heart of downtown. The hotel has a small strip mall next door that has a Tim Hortons (fast food) and a McDonalds. The room was very spacious with hi speed internet and a Starbucks within the hotel. Overall great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sim87
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a nearby conference and booked the hotel through priceline. The room I was given was very, very comfortable and very large. It did not have much of a view, but it was high up as I had requested. It was very close to the elevator (I assume these are the priceline rooms) but with the door closed I could not hear anything. You receive a free Wall Street Journal in the morning, which is nice, though I never had time to read it. The pool was heated which I had not realized and I did see people paddling around in it though it was March and not warm enough outside, there was steam rising off the water. The area the hotel is in is very, very central and although I would stay somewhere more "neighbourhoody" on a leisure trip, I enjoyed this. There is a very luxe grocery shop below the Shangri-La close by that I would recommend for a nice shopping experience and on Howe street, about 20 minutes away, a Japanese sushi place that does organic brown rice and healthful lunches. Shizen Ya. And of course, coffee everywhere. The only annoying thing at the Hyatt was the business centre. The computers are loaded up with their own software and it was impossible and expensive to download some documents off the net and open them up for printing. I ended up having to use a printing shop in the Burrard mall. Hard to believe that they would advertise such a business centre, but I am guessing few use it. The high-speed net costs in the room, think it was $12 or $14 a day, I tethered my laptop. Otherwise a great choice, especially if you can get a discount rate. The beds are amazing, had a fantastic sleep every night.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel.”
Reviews.Author: IsaNorthumberland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here six nights and were very happy with everything .The room was fabulous with everything you could possibly need(even an umbrella).The views were great of the street life.I think they've thought of everything here.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie050
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a yearly congress. it was decided to hold all aspects of the meeting in a hotel instead of the conference center. The Hyatt was a wonderful choice as both hotel and congress venue. The rooms were plentiful and the right size. Food was very good, and the one dinner we had in the hotel itself was MUCH better and of better value than what I ate at the local restaurant (I review that as well). The service was amazing from every point of view. I had a family emergency that required sending out documents by scan and email and all sorts of emergency communications. The front desk helped me organize everything and did not even charge me. Whatever needed attention was immediately dealt with. Also, the rrom was great, the bed was perfect and the pillows were great as well (I am verry fussy about pillows). Also, extremely well locate, although this time the view was on the post-hockey game riot. All in all a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent quality”
Reviews.Author: Back_to_Sandringham
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while attending a conference. The hotel is very well located, equidistant from the main shopping streets and the harbour. It is very conveniently located if you are going to the Convention Centre, which is only a 5 minute walk away. The standard of the room was fine, but nothing remarkable. The gym is small but functional, and there is a small outdoor heated swimming pool which is too small to do laps in, but nice for a dip. There are no changing rooms for the gym or pool, which is a nuisance. There is a small shopping gallery underneath the hotel, which has a pharmacy and some other shops. Useful if you want to pick up some snacks. Overall there is nothing special about this hotel, but I would probably go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodation in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: OttawaNYFan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for business travel and would be equally appealing for personal trips. The room was spacious and well equipped. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable regarding restaurants, etc. While my room was not ready when I arrived, the front desk personnel were apologetic and offered to call me as soon as it was available, and, if fact, did call within a short time. The restaurant was good for breakfast, though just ok at dinner, . However, there is so much in the area that visitors should be encouraged to venture out for a meal outside of the hotel. The spa that is attached to the hotel is great - do try to sneak away for a treatment of some sort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: IMJustVisiting
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for six nights. My room was clean, comfortable, spacious, and well appointed. The bed was particularly comfortable and had very new bedding on it. The room contained a small refrigerator that was handy (and not stocked with over-priced treats), and a nice work desk with both wired and wireless internet connections (extra charge to use). I had an excellent city view from the 23rd floor. I ate breakfast in the 2nd floor Mosaic restaurant each day, and that was quite good, though a pricey alternative if it had not been included in my room rate. (For cheaper options, there is a McDonald's and a nice Tim Hortons immediately next to the hotel entrance and Starbucks nearby.) The hotel is well positioned near several of the downtown shopping centers (e.g. Royal Centre and Pacific Centre Mall), Robson Street shopping and many restaurants, the Vancouver Art Gallery, and some good restaurants on Burrard and Thurlow Streets (e.g. Kamei Royal, Joe Fortes, The Keg). The hotel is directly next door to the Burrard Skytrain station and a short walk to the Vancouver City Centre station, which collectively connect to much of Vancouver and the YVR airport; the trains are easy to navigate and a much cheaper way to get to and from the airport than a taxi or rented car. (Vancouver parking can be expensive, and I would not recommend renting a car unless you plan a side trip to beautiful Victoria or Whistler.) It is a short walk from the hotel to the harbor. If you are interested in bicycling in Stanley Park, which I'd highly recommend, it is a bit longer walk (~0.8 miles) down West Georgia or Robson Streets to the many bicycle rentals on Denman Street. Vancouver is a beautiful city, and the Hyatt is well-located to take advantage of the many things to do there.

Reviews.Title: “First class on all level”
Reviews.Author: flyguy35
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vancouver in many years. I came in a couple of days early to explore the city prior to a conference. I fly into YVR and at the suggestion of a very nice lady at the info desk; I took the Sky Train to the Waterfront station. The train trip in was very quick and it was only a short walk to the hotel. I spoke with a number of others attending the conference and they said it took 45 minutes to an hour to get to the hotel. I highly recommend taking the train. Upon arrival at the hotel, I was greeted by the doorman who directed me to the front desk. Check in was quick and informative. The person checking me in even walked me to the elevator and pushed the button. This is the first time experiencing this. Elevators are quick so the wait is never long. Upon reaching my floor, I made my way to my room passing a room attendant who greeted me with a smile. After entering the room, there was a knock at the door from the room attendant asking if everything was ok in my room, which it was. The room was very up to date, extremely clean and a pleasure to stay in. Each day, my room was clean to a very high standard. The gym and pool area in the hotel is on par with many of the hotel gyms that I have used during my travels. I ate at a couple of different restaurants in the hotel and the food was very good and served quickly. All the staff that I encountered during my stay were very professional and pleasant to deal with. They are more than happy to assist you and provide you with local knowledge, even where was the safest place to go for a run at 4 in the morning. (My body was still on east coast time). I would highly recommend staying at this hotel and it certainly deserves a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Superb - Location, Price, Service”
Reviews.Author: jovita_a
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located within walking distances of every place in downtown Vancouver - Robson Street, Gas Town, Art Gallery, Cathedral, Train Station etc..., The staff is very polite, well trained, and prompt at their services. The room we stayed was spacious, clean and an allergy free room which we received for an upgrade at a minimalistic cost difference while checking in. The breakfast options are amazing theres a Tim Hortons and Mc Donalds right besides the hotel open 24 hours to grab a quick bite. There is an express check out facility which is excellent just tick the forms and leave it with the Reception Staff and your Credit Card is debited for the payment, its real quick and easy. I personally like this hotel because it has a tourist bus stop right behind the hotel, this stop is largely used by all tour companies like The Big Bus company, The Trolley company, Land and Sea Tours, Free Shuttles to Capilano, Grouse Mountain etc..., thus making it extremely easy to roam around the city and visit tourist attractions. The other things that make this hotel a great place to be in is the proximity to good restaurants, awesome shopping and great night life of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, noise.”
Reviews.Author: emcgoo
Reviews.Content: Outstanding professional and courteous service, lovely but simple rooms, paper-thin walls. My son and I had to change rooms at approximately 9pm when a group of young women checked into the room beside us. Truth be told, it was clear they were not truly partying. Regardless, I could hear every over-excited word and sing along to Lady Gaga (were I so inclined). In the room we moved to, it was also possible to hear the neighbours talking although they were speaking at a more moderate volume and it was not really disturbing. The staff at the hotel were exceedingly gracious, professional and accommodating. I would try a mid-week stay here if I were traveling on business and the price was right, but never again on the weekend for me.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place To Stay away from the Chaos of other Convention Hotels”
Reviews.Author: LookingForQuality33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a week-long convention. I liked it a lot because it seemed like I could get away from the chaos that seemed to be occurring at the other convention hotels where events were going on, yet was accessible to everywhere I needed to go. It was easy to get a taxi and/or walk about four blocks to the convention center, and I felt safe doing either. After experiencing the crowds of people in the lobby of some of the other hotels where functions were going on, it was refreshing to come back to a calmer environment. The hotel was clean, room was nice, and the staff was always ready and willing to please. All seemed to go out of their way to make sure everyone at the convention enjoyed their stay. There is a Starbucks in the lobby, and a restaurant upstairs that offered buffet breakfasts on the days I was there. The hotel is attached to a smaller mall, that includes a spa and a food court. The LifeSpa spa services and staff were wonderful! It was a great way to relax after business meetings. Hint: Ask the concierge for a discount card if you don't find one in your room. Also, it took me awhile to figure out that the mall area was multi-level, and if you go down another level, there were more food court type options. If you don't explore the lower levels you will never know about the options that are available for you right there. This may come in handy if you don't want a full fledged meal or you are traveling with children. There were plenty of options to choose from. In addition there was a drugstore, some clothes stores, and a few other miscellaneous stores. A huge mall is located several blocks away. That mall was intriguing because it housed a large number of stores with names you don't find in just about every mall you go to in the U.S. Had I had more time, I could have done some serious shopping. The one odd thing I noticed at this hotel that I have never noticed at other hotels, is that when my "neighbor" was making coffee in the room next door, I could smell it! I love coffee, and this was fine with me, but this was the first time I can say I experienced this smell coming from someone else's room. You normally see reviews where people talk about noise from another room. I didn't experience that---only the smell of coffee in the morning! Finally, Vancouver is breathtakingly beautiful, and my room allowed me to further experience the beauty. I had a great view of the mountains with snow on top, the harbor down by the convention center, and the huge beautiful flowers that connected the space between. Ask for a room facing the direction of the harbor. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again if I traveled to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great repeat experience, flight delayed, they still kept my room”
Reviews.Author: YYZBUF
Reviews.Content: Ron at night checked me in since Alaska Air caused my arrival to be delayed to the next morning. The morning staff were understanding of my situation too. It's a great location for "you name it". The staff are friendly with a genuine service attitude. Loved the Ipod radio in the room and the ear phones in the gym Look forward to my next trip here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a nice part of downtown Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: missedme
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night before our Alaskan cruise the next day. We had a corner room on the 11th floor looking out over a park across the street. We are sorry that we never got a balcony room for a better view of Vancouver but the view we had was great anyway. It is a very nice urban hotel with everything you need close by. This is a nice area of downtown Vancouver. The shopping is great in this area and the area itself is very nice, scenic, and a safe place to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and trendy but not very kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: Truthfu1
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this Hyatt hotel as part of a conference in Vancouver. The hotel is at an excellent downtown location. The Burrard station is across the street from the hotel. It is close to many attractions. The furniture, TV, decor and bathrooms have modern themes. They are tastefully done. We had access to the Regency Club Lounge on the 29th floor. The breakfast had a baked goods, fruits, cheese and smoked salmon. We also tried the afternoon appetizers which were also nice. As we travelled with a toddler, I had some pet peeve with some of the amenities: 1. The shower comes from the ceiling, which is very trendy but not very practical for us. While we could slightly tilt the angle, we couldn't adjust the intensity. Also, water coming down from the ceiling makes it hard to shower a toddler. Unlike the Westin's heavenly shower which features double shower heads, it allows you to adjust both the angle and intensity. It was much easier to shower the toddler using the double heads. 2. The bathroom lacked counter space. The counter had a vase with live plant, soap dish, glasses and tissue box. It made it difficult to put essential children toiletry items on the counter. 3. The towels are rolled up into small cubby shelves under neath the counter. While it looks nice asthetically, it is not as practical because it is far away from the tub. It requires about 3 steps from the tub to reach the towel. It would be more practical to have the towels closer to the tub. 4. Furniture have sharp corners. The business desk, night stands, drawers, coffee table all have sharp corners. With a toddler running around, it is easy to hurt themselves by bumping into one of those corners of the furniture. Overall, the hotel is business oriented located at an excellent location. But, it could improve on some amenities to make it more children friendly.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem, in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: lovehvar
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay in a room with a view of the water and a balcony. It was a great location and there is a mall attached by breezway where you can find a Rexall. Kitty corner to Cactus club and just 2 blocks to the seawall. Location is amazing, underground metro station is also right in front of hotel. Fitness centre and concierge lounge are fabulous, and the staff were so nice. The staff at this hotel are 5 star all the way, extremely friendly and helpful, with smiles from start to finish. Thank you for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy rooms in an oh-so-central location”
Reviews.Author: Tombrasil
Reviews.Content: This hotel is uber-convenient. It's close to everything- the harbour, Granville Island, Stanley Park. Rooms are smartly decorated, indeed quite stylishly done, spacious and have good bathrooms. There's a Starbucks in the ground floor and a Tim Hortons outside the front door for coffee, bagels and donuts, so we didn't need to get breakfast, which seemed expensive. All in all, we had a great time at the Hyatt Regency Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “The staff make the overnight stay feel like a premier vacation.”
Reviews.Author: jenandjer
Reviews.Content: I live in the Fraser Valley and sometimes it's nice to book an overnight at a Vancouver hotel instead of driving home at 3 in the morning when we go out. My girlfriends and I love to go to a nice dinner and go dancing until the wee hours of the morning every once in a while to reconnect and blow off steam. We choose to book our hotels through Priceline as we never pay the full price of the room and we always get a wicked deal. Well, we got a room at the Hyatt for 100.00 plus taxes and service fees via priceline so for 123.00. When we got to the hotel, as soon as I pulled up I had a very friendly doorman/valet give me proper parking directions and even told me to make sure I pay the parkade and not the hotel as it's 12 bucks over the long weekend ! It's normally 37 so we were all pretty happy about that :) When we go to check in we dealt with Magdalena. She was so great. I am a retail store manager and I recognize when someone actually values what they do for a living and actually cares. She was so great and made our arrival so easy. She offered us a 10 dollar upgrade to a room with a balcony or view, as well as they had a promotion on if you chose this upgrade you recieved a 20 dollar starbucks voucher for the morning ! How perfect is that ? She knew we booked through priceline - as all hotels know - but for once, never did she treat us as a third party booker. She gave us a beautiful room that had a view of the mountains, as well as came out from behind her desk to give us our room keys, and show us where the elevators are. We were also aware that there was a huge convention happening for some company and never did that once interrupt our hotel experience or service. All these little things actually do matter, and it makes me want to stay at the Regency again, and I've stayed at a few higher end hotels in Vancouver, and none will stick in my mind as this one will. In the morning, we got our free starbucks breakfast and drinks and another gentleman at the front desk checked us out. We were in room 2208 and it was such a beautiful view and a beautiful room. The beds are very comfortable, the view is gorgeous and the hotel is beautiful. What we will always remember is the awesome doorman, Magdalena and the beautiful hotel room. We will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience in my life--Don't stay here if you are travelling with kids!!!”
Reviews.Author: jjjmjoh
Reviews.Content: It was our last day at Vancouver and this hotel ruined our whole vacation experience. My husband and I with three kids were on spring vacation from California to Seattle to Vancouver. We stayed at Marriot, Westin and Listel Hotels previous nights and had any problem staying with my kids. They even provided us with a rollaway bed or extra blankets for our comfort. But,,,,Hyatt stoppted us when we were checking in and forced us to book another room since we have three kids. The agent's name was Elain and the room manager's name was Kent. They wanted to separate us bying paying extra $100 to make money out of us telling us it is against the federal law to put 5 people in one room!!! I would understand if there were 5 adults trying to sneak into one room, but it was a family of five, three of them are minors!!! We felt very insulted and discriminated by their attitude because we are asians. My last son was crying because it all happened because of him being born. How can they treat a family like this???!!! My husband ended up sleeping in the car since we didn't want to pay extra money and they only allow us 4 people in the room. I am about to ask my lawyer how to respond to this situation. I just want to leave this feedback to let those families with more than 3 kids to aware their unhumanly policy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Sageschatz
