Reviews.Content: We were placed with this hotel through Priceline and, after reading some of the reviews, had some hesitations about staying here. As recommended, I emailed the hotel requesting 1 king bed for us because of some issues others had in the past. I received an email back confirming our request. After figuring out the parking situation (it was a bit unclear to me as there wasn't signage specific to hotel guests) we checked in at the front desk. Jason checked us in and was quite polite and gave me a note from the manager welcoming us and wishing us a happy anniversary (I had mentioned it was in my email to them.) However, they addressed it to Mr and Mrs Smith (not realizing my partner was a man. No fault of theirs, but made us both chuckle.) Jason actually walked us to the elevator and wished us a pleasant stay. Very impressed. We were placed in 2609, a northern facing room with a view of the harbor. Room was very clean and well appointed. My biggest complaint is that for a 5 star hotel, they should not be charging guests for wifi (CAD 15, at that.) Other than that, had a fabulous stay and was quite impressed in how we were treated.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SproutsOnSpruce
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on it being central to all, and we weren't disappointed. It was a convenient walk to the waterfront, Canada Place, downtown shopping, and many public transportation lines. With the exception of a superb doorman named Greg, we found the staff to be a bit reserved to the point of being chilly. (For example, when we asked if we could upgrade our room, the woman at the front desk replied with an unsmiling "No." Not, "I'm sorry there's nothing available right now.") At the other end of the spectrum, Greg was a delight, helping us to plan all the details of each day. Rooms were clean & comfortable but you could hear the neighbor's late night (2 am) TV through the wall. I am sure the staff would have rectified this situation, but we were too tired to call.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation in an ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: walkabout55
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel that is affordable while still a bit more upscale. The decor is modern and well looked after. The room was very efficient with all the basic needs and clean-line modern look to it. Housekeeping promptly attended to a request for wine glasses and a corkscrew. The king bed was very comfortable and the room very quiet considering the busy downtown streets below. Front desk staff were extremely friendly and would look after every request, from forgotten shave cream and razor to extra body lotion. A late night room service order was delightful; a cheese plate that was both delicious and beautifully presented. We also appreciate the hotel's "green" efforts in their products and operation. The hotel is a great value and we would chose it again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmacdonald
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hyatt Vancouver. We had a room with a balcony on a higher floor, which we extra for but was well worth it, the room was well furnishedand had a nice clean bathroom. The view overlooking the city was awesome, its fun to be able to walk out of the hotel and be right in the middle of the city. The staff is gracious and competent--most eager to help in any way. we didn't wait in line at check in or at the restaurant We walked by many other hotels and feel that this is the best place to stay while visiting Vancouver. I was a little hesitant to stay here as I was reading the reviews but I found that this hotel and its staff were warm and welcoming. Great Place !!!! We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerjerming
Reviews.Content: It was surprising to see negative comments about this hotel. When my car pulled into the drive way. The door staff was very friendly and welcomed me to the hotel. They help me unload and provide me with directions for parking and check-in. At Check-in the Front Desk Staff are very approachable and helped me to make this trip perfect. I would recommend anyone coming to Vancouver to stay @ the Hyatt Regency Vancouver. Please keep up the great work.

Reviews.Title: “There is NOTHING Regent about this motel”
Reviews.Author: Ricardorenard
Reviews.Content: Montreal to Vancouver for a sleep in before Whistler. We are not expecting Park Hyatt but at least Australian Hyat standard. It is a machine check in, it is late, we are exhausted. The foyer is cinema chain awful, the lift to regency floor reveals beige everything leading to a sterile room. No mini Bar, nothing except a bed & essentials and a view, of the rain on the city. Quick room service french onion soup was beef broth covered with plastic cheese. Sleep. 4.30am we are woken by an awful insistent noise. Housekeeping has not reset alarm clock. Can't sleep so go to swim- outside pool and no, repeat NO change rooms, so strip in gym, swim, and find myself locked out. REGENCY CLUB? Yeah- petrol service machine coffee Aussies hate, no eggs, just bagels lox and plenty of cream. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL unless your busuness is making you. you have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “They go above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: RayBoey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for one night and were fortunate to be Priceline customers to this fine hotel. I was initially concerned due to some of the comments from other Priceline customers. However, a quick email to the hotel to request our roon preference was met with immediate, accomodating assistance. The helpful professional attitude starts with the GM Steve McNally and filters down to the reception and valet service people. Kudos.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Shaup
Reviews.Content: We are loving our stay here at the Hyatt. Every person we have come in contact with has exceeded our expectations for service. The front desk concierge had information for us under our door before we even officially checked in, and the club level concierge is so sweet and friendly. We are glad we will be here longer to enjoy this hotel. I do wish internet were included though.

Reviews.Title: “Modern amenities with nickle and diming pricing”
Reviews.Author: redheadmary
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Vancouver after winning a bid on Priceline. Upon arriving, I was very impressed with the friendliness of the valet and front desk. During check-in, I was informed that the first room available was one with a queen sized sofa bed. My husband and I are mid-30s, not college kids. We’re not the sofa bed types. After refusing that, we were told the other option was a room with 2 full-sized beds. We were tired, hungry and ready to settle in, so we accepted that. The room was nicely appointed but the beds were tiny and uncomfortable and the room was 10 feet away from the elevators aka the priceline norm. Maybe we should have complained at that point, but we were ready to enjoy our vacay. Pros: Modern appointments Great location Friendly staff Nice (small but free and modern) gym Cons: No free wi-fi! If your normal room rate is $200, give your guests some free wi-fi. $15.95 a day is ridiculous. Parking. City parking is pricey – I expected that. Almost $50 a day? For Vancouver? C’mon. Crappy toiletries with weird medicinal smells Thin walls and squeaky beds For the priceline price, I was happy. But I wouldn't pay retail price there.

Reviews.Title: “Superb downtown location”
Reviews.Author: g4480
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel right in the middle of downtown vancouver, close to everything. Rooms have received a tasteful update, beds are very comfortable, staff were pleasant. When in Vancouver again, I will likely return.

Reviews.Title: “Staff wanted extra $$ for a 1 king bed room”
Reviews.Author: Nuni72
Reviews.Content: Checked in today for the weekend. Yes, the location is good, but location isn't everything. Customer service is part of the experience. And when they treat Priceliners as second-class guests, I don't have to like it. Just because PL would let them put me in ANY room doesn't mean they should. According to them, they can charge me $25/ night more for the privilege of switching to a one king bed, because, again according to them, all STANDARD rooms with king beds are sold out. I guess they've never heard of a comp upgrade to keep a customer happy. Also, when a hotel charges you $14.95 + tax for one day of internet access, you know they are there to rip you off. Oh well, live and learn. I have just been upgraded by a nearby Sheraton the other day for no other reason than to keep me extra happy. I guess now I know which chain my loyalty should be with. The double beds cannot be described as spacious by any stretch.

Reviews.Title: “Best Of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Valenor
Reviews.Content: Location is the most convenient. Right in the centre of everything. Stroll down to the convention centre. Do not take taxi. Very friendly staff. The best I have ever came across. Shopping is close by and the City itself is super clean and beautiful. 4 DAYS was too short. Have to come back with family.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Vancouver But I won't Stay there Again”
Reviews.Author: TorontoBusinessMan
Reviews.Content: When I stayed at the Vancouver Hyatt I didn't know about the controversy and this chain's practices, had I know I would not have stayed there. The hotel is fantastic and the best I have stayed in. So it's too bad. First, the rooms are amazing. They must have renovated recently because the furniture is very classy and modern. What an ambiance. The shades are very edgy. The bathrooms are unique. I have never seen anything like it. The service was fine except they try to push you to their self-serve counters. I don't want some dumb machine. I get that at work all the time. I want human, smiling, cute service. Put a nice girl with a smile behind the counter that welcomes me in a nice skirt. Seriously. It is busy in their lobby but that means they should hire more employees, doesn't it?? Speaking of which, I have since learned that they fired their staff (many news items available) because they were unionized in favour of cheaper and less quality employees. This apparently happened (at least) in their North American locations. Sad sad sad... I am not in favour of this. Sad when multinational locations do this when they earn a billion. too bad they have great location, great rooms and bathrooms, but my conscience is sad. PS: Stop charging for the Internet really. Crappy Best Western and Marriott give it away!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully impressed”
Reviews.Author: Langley_BC
Reviews.Content: We live in the metro Vancouver area and on occasion stay in the downtown district in order to avoid having to travel home due to an event taking place or as a quick getaway. This was the first time we had stayed at the Hyatt Regency and were very impressed with everything from the accommodations to the staff. We stayed the first night at the rack-rate and the subsequent 2 using frequent traveler points. For the first night, we stayed in a "regular" room and then were upgraded to a suite for the next 2. Both rooms were lovely and, frankly, while the suite was nice, nothing was really missing from the first room to really make me overly envious of having missed the suite on the first night. Parking downtown is expensive and the attendant at check-in gave us some tips on saving money. At breakfast, my wife developed a cough and a very attentive server brought over a "home remedy" of hot water, lemon and honey. When we moved from the first room to the second room, the attendant that moved our belongings was very helpful, quick, and efficient, not to mention the move took place earlier in the day than we had anticipated and allowed us to (re)settle in. Overall an excellent experience from a "local" hotel that exceeded our experiences with other local hotels in Vancouver so far.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in Vancouver city center”
Reviews.Author: epancy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is simply beautiful. It is the best Hyatt I ever stayed. Great location, directly in the city center and near to the see too. The room was quite big, completely renovated and with a nice view on the skyscrapers. The bathroom was also big, furnished with a well performing hair dryer. The breakfast was really very good, with a lot of choices and you had a chef who cooked omelets etc. as you wanted. From the top floor you can have a very nice view of Vancouver. The staff was very friendly and helpful. A good thing: to use the elevator to go to your room, you needed to insert your key. I will definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “great location for business or shopping”
Reviews.Author: yyesiamtrish2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very convenient location right in the heart of downtown Vancouver. Restaurants, shopping, etc all very close by, Parking prices shocking but in line with other hotels in the area. The service in the hotel is what you would expect it would be, smooth and efficient, nothing extraordinary to share in that category, This hotel is above an underground shopping mall and there is Rexall drugs for those items we all tend to forget when we travel. I was travelling for business only for one night but have no complaints. I give full marks in all categories because it was all I needed it to be and have no complaints. I am not a raving fan, because I really had no opportunity to test it beyond staying overnight, did not use any other services.

Reviews.Title: “Professional Service, Fantastic Location and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: EugeneChan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located at the heart of downtown Vancouver - less than 5 minutes walk from Pacific Centre, shopping at Robson Street, and about 10 minutes walk to Waterfront. Its lobby is connected to a small shopping area that has a large Chinese restaurant, Tim Hortons and McDonalds as well as a foodcourt. I will begin with the booking process, which was laden with several problems. I made my booking on the telephone and at the time of booking, I told the booking agent several times that I was to spend 9 nights with 3 adults and 1 child (1 room). After making the booking, I received a confirmation email stating the price for 1 room for 1 adult and 1 child. Upon seeing this, I immediately rang up Hyatt reservations on two separate occasions and was assured that the booking was made for 3 adults and 1 child and that the price stated in the confirmation email was indeed for the 4 people. However, upon checking out of the hotel, I was shocked to receive my bill which stated that I owed an extra CAD600 because there were 3 adults and 1 child in the room. It was beyond disbelief that Hyatt reservations, on two separate occasions, had misinformed me that the price stated in my confirmation booking was for 3 adults and 1 child. I immediately contacted the hotel manager. According to him, a second confirmation email was sent with a new price for 3 adults and 1 child. I found it incredulous that: (i) Hyatt telephone reservations told me that the original booking was for 3 adults and 1 child and not 1 adult and 1 child; and (ii) even if Hyatt reservations did change my booking from 1 adult and 1 child to 3 adults and 1 child, they did not inform me of a price change on the phone, and that a new automatic confirmation email informing me of the price change failed. Luckily, the hotel manager saved the situation by waiving the extra charge. Had it been otherwise, I would have boycotted staying at another Hyatt Hotel in the future and written letters to senior personnel of the company explaining why I had to pay for its problems inherent in the telephone booking service and its confirmation email system. Anyway, despite that issue, I was more than impressed by the service I received at the hotel. Check-in was efficient and the hotel staff were friendly. The porters knew my family and I by name and were more than willing to help carry my 16 pieces of luggage and weigh them for me (before flying). They did this without hesitation. Housekeeping was personalised. A request form could be filled out for housekeeping every morning. The number of shampoos, conditioners, body lotion etc. provided each day were exorbitant. Internet is complimentary for those who sign up for Hyatt's Gold Passport, which is free. If not, internet costs approximately $14/day from memory. Rooms are spacious and beautifully renovated. There is ample desk space and the room is quite well lit. The beds are comfortable and the sheets are smooth. However, the lobby seems a bit old and the facade of the building requires a facelift. The paint on the outside of the building is greying, making the hotel seem very old and dirty from the outside (but this is certainly not the case inside). The restaurant on the second floor was very good. Christmas Eve buffet was delicious and the restaurant staff were very helpful. I left my name, room number and contact details and they rang me up as soon as there was availability for the Christmas Eve buffet. I also had dinner on a "normal" night. Main courses are very reasonably priced (about $27-30) and are of a very high standard. All in all, notwithstanding the unsatisfactory experience I had with the booking process, my stay here at the Hyatt Vancouver was very enjoyable and comfortable. Service was very personalised and staff were attentive and at your service, which is what I expect from top hotels such as the Hyatt. I highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Service, but thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: kpand
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the middle of everything with easy access to the shopping strip and the wonderful waterfront path. We were there for a couple days over New Years so it was busy and noisy. The rooms were nice, newly renovated and had a nice view through the big windows. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was nothing special but clean. The only big complaint I had was the thinness of the walls. Our first afternoon our neighbor had their music blaring and it might as well been in our room. After a while we called down to the front dest and they quickly sent someone up and the people turned it down. Then later that night, not new years eve, the neighbors had a group of people over and you could hear most of the conversation and laughing. We didn't want to spoil the fun, so tried to ignore it, but after 1 am we were getting pretty tired! So again we called down and they quickly sent someone up. I will say the hotel staff was very helpful, and they can't really do anything about the wall thinness.

Reviews.Title: “You'll need earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: nwat
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is in a great location, and very easy to get to from the airport via the skytrain. On arriving, we checked in at the kiosks, and our room was huge! Very clean, on the 25th floor, modern and comfortable. We had breakfast in our room the next day (Christmas day) and the service and food were excellent. They even included Christmas candy canes with our meal, which was a sweet touch. The first three nights we slept well, and housekeeping was good. However our room had a connecting door with the another room and by the 3rd night new guests moved in next door and we could practically hear every word. By the second night we asked to be moved, as another set of new guests had moved in and they couldn't communicate below a shout. The staff at the desk were very apologetic, and helpful and dealt with it quickly. We were given a new room with no adjoining doors, away from the lifts on the 27th floor. Again another great room, however from this point on the noise got worse, with a family on one side who allowed their kids to jump off the bed, run up and down the corridor, and open and close drawers loudly and constantly while listening to the tv at a ridiculous level. We could also hear the tv on the other side too, even though they didn't have it particularly loud. It culminated on New Year's Eve, when the people upstairs sounded like they were dropping concrete blocks while having a massive screaming match. We didn't complain anymore as we didn't even know who to complain about. The noise levels were coming from everywhere. Now, we completely appreciated it was new years eve, however it was still a hotel, and we had saved to go on this 9 day trip, from a long flight which was now being marred by our accommodation. It was getting to the point we dreaded returning back every evening as we didn't know what kind of sleep we were going to get. It quietened down on our last night, either that or the fact that I had worked out, by turning the air con/heater to full and then putting ear plugs in it drowned out a lot of the noise. On a positive - the staff we met were pleasant and professional. Some were incredibly helpful, and the waitress in the Mosaic Grille on our last day was really really great. It was also good having Starbucks in the lobby for breakfast, and the shops etc next to the hotel were really handy. The views were pretty good, we had a good one of Grouse Mountain, and the coffee and facilities in the rooms were also good. Overall, I wouldn't return as we wanted a quiet romantic Christmas break - and this was not it at all, and spoiled our highly anticipated festive trip, which was upsetting.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, nice room!”
Reviews.Author: lvtocancun042008
Reviews.Content: Location is two short blocks from the central hussle and bussle of Robson St. and another two blocks to Granville St. Great food and shopping close by. Stayed two nights, New Years eve and New Years night, 12/31/2010-1/2/2011. Found good price on Priceline "Name your price" for $110/per night. Parking for Friday-Sunday ran $47 Canadian, and we went out with our car once. If we just left the car parked, I think it would have been $12 bucks less, no in and out privileges in parking garage. It's a shared parking lot. Since I negotiated my price, I could not choose room type and got stuck with a two double room. Very large corner room, nice entry hall. We would have preferred one king. No rooms available since it was a busy holiday weekend. We have stayed at the Westin Bayshore, the Metropolitan, and this hotel. Always negotiate my price on Priceline and have not been disappointed with any of them.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stay at The Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: koko269
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night just to get some relaxation and alone time after a hectic Christmas. This hotel is not the newest hotel in Vancouver, but not the very oldest. Their style is modern but still very comfortable and clean. If you're looking to be near the water, then stay at Pan Pacific or Fairmont. I love their views! The best thing about this Hyatt is the location. It is just a short walk to Robson Street so we walked along Robson to do some shopping. We also grabbed some snacks and food around the area too. The hotel is also next to the skytain station (Burrard Station) so it's very convenient for people to go somewhere without a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Calvin81
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. The location is fantastic, close to everything. The service and the rooms are also really good.

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressed for a Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Oli0612
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. I had a special coupon, so I had to make a reservation through the phone. The lady who was helping me with my reservation wasn't very professional. She spoke way too fast and was mumbling alot. I had to say "pardon me" many times throughout the reservation process. I also request late check-out and birthday special at the reservation. When we were checking in, it seems like the lady there didn't look through my requests. She assigned us a room on the 16th floor. We asked if there was anything they can do for us as we were there to celebrate a birthday. The lady was pretty much saying no, because we already got a very good deal. I was kind of mad about that. If they do not regularly do anything special, then they can just say it, but the way the lady said it, it seems like its because I was staying there with a coupon that I don't deserve any extras. I also had to request for the late check-in, instead of her offering it to me. The room itself was decent as it was newly renovated, but the bathroom was surprisingly small. We stayed at a corner room, so a lot of space was wasted for the hallway. The TV had snowflakes, but we didn't bothered asking someone to come up and fix it. We called to room service for a pair of slippers and toothpaste. It took us around 30 minutes before we got frustrated and called them again. When we called again, they said they'll bring it right up... and that took another 10 minutes or so. Also, the internet costs $15/day, which I found a bit pricey. They had the gingerbread competition in the lobby, so that was good, very xmas spirit. Overall, I have to say I would be okay with this stay if I was just here as a tourist and service is not my main priority. The location was good for a tourist, even without a vehicle as the skytrain station is just beside the hotel. Because this was suppose to be a special night for us, I thought the bad service was a complete turn off.

Reviews.Title: “Great location... lots of extras to pay for though...”
Reviews.Author: gman305
Reviews.Content: Right in the thick off things - close to lots of restaurants, etc. Seemed like a lot of "extras" to pay for here. Parking is pricey - garage is not owned by hotel, but they have a "deal" at something like $30/night. Breakfast for two is $50 at their restaurant (with buffet), but they set it up so, that is really the only option - for example, the coffee is included with the buffet, but otherwise it is like $5, then each a-la-carte entre is $15ish... so the buffet is of value... Internet is not free, another $15 or $16. This is not unlike many of the hotels in the area, but just good to know. Rooms were nice with modern decor. Automated check-in (if you want, no need to ever talk to anyone... which is a little a little odd!). Bar was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hyatt stay”
Reviews.Author: mclachlan4321
Reviews.Content: i like the Hyatt brand and this stay didnt fail me. The only issue was street noise, and I was staying on the 25th floor, however it was Ok. Ate here and drank in the bars. The location is great, right in the middle of the city with good access to all locations. Comfortable bed, and clean rooms. Great !

Reviews.Title: “Can't think of better hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Ginsberg
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of the city from where you can explore this great city. Freat atmosphere. Rooms and beds are perfect!! Should have them back home ;) Staff is friendly, efficient and helpful. Breakfast is just great, smoked salmon, pick your own ingredients for your omelet, too good really. Go and bike around Stanley Park !!!

Reviews.Title: “Short stay at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Aimusk
Reviews.Content: It was a pretty fancy hotel with very nice, spacious rooms, awesome balconies if you can get one, great service. Very central to the nice downtown area of Vancouver... pretty much near everything. Everyone that works there is very friendly. The hotel had a pretty well stocked Starbucks at the entrance, a bar that was open most of the time, and a super cute trendy restaurant. I'm totally thinking about copying the way they serve their penuts in vases BTW...:) The beds were very comfortable and it was probobly the best night sleep I've had in a while on a hotel bed. I have to say, and this could be a pro or a con, the hotel and the rooms retain heat VERY well. Our room would get super hot if we didn't open our balcony window. I think the rooms are pretty quiet, but we didn't have anyone in the ajoining room that I know of, but we heard the cleaning crew when they were in it...Anyway, at night our room was so quiet that we opened the balcony window to let in all of the street noise. (I've mentioned in my past review that we need to sleep with some sort of "white noise" and street noise works great!) I had pretty high hopes for the Hyatt and I was a little dissapointed in a couple of small details. There was no fan in the bathroom, which I thought very strange, and there was no free wi-fi (my friend later told me that the pricier the hotel, the less free stuff you get). I don't know if I'd pay as much as we did to stay there again, but it was really nice. I'd be fine with a lower budget hotel I think though, but it is downtown Van...so it's all probobly pretty expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation at in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Cathy6505
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful accommodations and friendly personnel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best hotel of our trip, immaculate and great location!”
Reviews.Author: KLS7
Reviews.Content: We travelled from australia for 20 hours, and this place was heaven as we entered the door. Rooms were immaculate and roomy! Beds were better than mine at home, bathroom fully renovated classy and elegant throughout. Two beds and Study area. Best location, walking distance to transport and the harbour and robson street for shopping food. We got a discount so was well worth it! Staff were friendly and helpful also. Will be back if the price is still good!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: hilburno
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Vancouver is a beautiful hotel in an amazing city. I don't really have any complaints about the room or amenities. It was a little pricey, but I guess that is to be expected in a large city. My major complaint is that I purchased the business plan which included free internet, free calls within Cananda and the U.S., free bottle of water each day and free buffet breakfast each day (not including tip). You would think that they could get their computer system to remove these charges automatically, but my final bill was wrong. They didn't remove any of my breakfast charges. I also had to ask the front desk for the maid to bring me waters each day. After I drank my first 2 bottles, she just didn't bother bringing any more, even though I was there for 5 days. And to use the internet, you still have to click that you agree to pay $11.95 a day (or whatever the daily fee was) when you log-in. It doesn't give you the option of stating you are on the business plan, so this creates a bit of confussion as one might fear being charged for the internet even though it is included in the business plan. They need to fine tune their business plan to make it seamless for the traveller. Their are lots of restaurants nearby. The waterfront is only 3-4 blocks away and their is a great waterfront walkway/bikeway called the Seawall that begins beside the convention center - right down the street from the hotel. This walkway follows the waterfront all the way to Stanley Park. Then you can run for 5.5 miles around the perimeter of Stanley Park. It is a beautiful Park. We went to Capilano suspension bridge, but I felt this was way overrated - especially if you have ever walked across a pedestrian suspension bridge. There is really nothing noteworthy there. We also went up to Grouse Mountain. Not much to do there either, but it did offer nice views of Vancouver and the surrounding valley/plain. And they had two grizzly bears which were neat to view. Vancouver itself was probably the most beautiful city I have ever seen and also the cleanest. I just wish I had more time to visit more outlying areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you have the money”
Reviews.Author: yargnits
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great. There's plenty of small theaters and small shops. The harbor is also only a couple blocks away. Great place if you like to walk around. Driving is not so fun. There's a lot on one-way streets and some are really congested due to the city removing lanes for pedestrian/bicycle traffic. The hotel is nicely decorated with nice rooms. I love the self check-in idea for Hyatt Place where the stay is economical, but I didn't care for it when I was forced to do so at this hotel. I even waited for someone at the desk and when they became available I was told to go to the kiosk. Staff should realize that I was standing there because I didn't want to use the kiosk. All other interactions with staff were great. Another BIG gripe about the hotel is the parking. It's hard to find out where to go when you first arrive and then it's very expensive. My last negative point pertains to all high-dollar hotels. They have no right to charge for internet when cheaper brand hotels give it for free. Here the internet fee was $15/day End notes: take some form of public transportation to the hotel and plan on exploring by foot.

Reviews.Title: “One night before a cruise - Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: eyw-mke
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night before departing for a cruise. I was looking for a nice hotel with a decent price and the Hyatt fit the bill! We did not use the parking, internet, fitness center, or pool, so I have no idea what kind of value they were. We wanted location, location, location and the Hyatt was perfect. I asked for early check-in, since I knew we would arrive before normal check in time. Room was exactly as requested and ready when we arrived! We had a room with a balcony it was just as described. The bathroom was very nice, but I did not like the rainfall shower head...not enough water pressure for my taste. Breakfast was included with our package and it was excellent! Yes, I would do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; beautiful renovation”
Reviews.Author: JWren
Reviews.Content: The rooms and public spaces have been beautifully updated. The bed was really comfortable. There are a lot of gorgeous hotels in downtown Vancouver but this one is just as comfortable but much more reasonably priced. We would definitely stay here again. There is a nice lounge and a Starbucks in the lobby. Safe underground parking. Easy to see from several blocks away so we didn't get lost :)

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad Vancouver Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SussexCanuck
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days here in September after returning from an Alaska cruise. The hotel was what you expect a city business hotel to be - big, clean, with good facilities, but sterile with no atmosphere. I booked 2 rooms for the 3 nights through Priceline and got a very, very good deal - otherwise it is not worth the normal rate (in my opinion). Paid an extra $25 a night to upgrade one of the rooms to a kingsize bed. Location is good, if a bit noisy. My only complaint is the cost of parking and the fact that they charge for internet access - this was the only hotel during our 2 week vaction that did so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and no complaints whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: Deb0na1r
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Hyatt. The room was modern, large and spacious, two double beds, desk, flat screen television, tiled bathroom, and efficient maid service. The Starbucks in the lobby was very useful as the option of breakfast in the dining room was rather expensive. Robson Street just a block or two away, beautiful Coal Harbour about ten minutes walk and best of all Burrard Sky Train Station so near you can exit the hotel into a small mall then take escalator down without even getting wet! To get there from airport take the Skytrain to Waterfront then change line and one stop to Burrard. Alternatively get off one stop before at Vancouver City Centre Station and walk a few blocks rather than change line. To return to Airport make sure you get Skytrain to YVR as alternate ones go to Richmond Brighouse. We found the lunch buffet at Salam Bombay 755 Burrard (few minutes walk) very good and only 15 dollars. Also Takis Taverna 1106 Davie St (about 20 minutes walk) is excellent if you like greek food - good value, great atmosphere and huge kleftiko - very popular, sometimes have to wait for a table. For authentic Dim Sum take the Skytrain to Aberdeen Centre (a mall in an area referred to as Hongcouver!) for lunch at one of the restaurants there.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your bill carefully”
Reviews.Author: menacingpickle
Reviews.Content: First, I will mention I have been staying in a lot of hotels during my month long All You Can Jet pass with Jetblue. This was the only hotel that ripped me off. While checking in we inquired about the price of parking for our stay and were quoted a price of $38 which he said we could pay via credit card when pulling out of garage. I was letdown to see the elevator from the parking garage, down a few flights of stairs into the hotel was broken. How many times would I really need to walk up those stairs? So I sucked it up. The next day we checked out and the elevator was still broken. One of us went to get the car while the other waited with the bags in front of the hotel. After 15 minutes my friend emerged and said the parking ticket wanted $50 to check out. She had to climb the stairs to tell me this. We complained at the front desk and were assured the rate was the $38 discounted rate and to try again. I went down to take care of parking, sure enough the ticket still wanted $50. I climbed back up the stairs to complain again, they told me the rate should have been $38 and gave me a new checkout card. I was annoyed and went back down to try again. This time the card said it was expired and couldn't accept it. Pretty pissed off by this time I went back up and asked to speak the the manager who was condescending and said "we don't own the garage, there is nothing we can do." That's a nice attitude. I informed him his facility connects to that garage and offers an entrance from the hotel to that garage so it is his problem and that I wasn't thrilled with the numerous trips up and down the stairs with a bad leg. He checked the parking ticket and said "well, it's fixed now." Guess what? Not fixed. I came back upstairs REALLY pissed off. An employee, not the manager apologized and said "we will take care of this." He took about 10 minutes to check on what to do and came back and said "when you get to the exit area press the help button and we will let you out of the garage, our compliments for the problem." A little annoyed no one offered to help with our bags our go with us to the many trips to the garage the entire time to ensure the ticket was being rejected, but that seemed fair. Guess what got tacked on to my hotel bill when I checked my credit card? Oooh yeah, $38 (American funds). So, here's the rundown on the hotel. It was very clean, the location is great, the rooms are very small but typical of city hotels. Room was nicely decorated and updated. You have to pay for internet, so be prepared for that. The service, it bites. The night before the fire alarm went off at 11pm. It went off for about 10 minutes when we finally wandered to the hallway to see what others were doing. There stood the other floor 6 guests having the same debate. One guest informed us firetrucks were lined up outside the hotel (she could see from her window) so as a group we headed downstairs. Via stairs of course. yay stairs. After being outside for about 10 minutes the fire department said it was a kitchen fire and safe to go back in. I mentioned this to the condescending hotel manager after I was pretty pissed off about the whole parking thing and he said "that's not true, I personally made an announcement no one had to leave their rooms after 2 minutes of the alarm going off." Ooooh, really? Since the siren and flashing lights inside the rooms and hallways kept going off, we the guests on the 6th floor thought it would be fun to head outside in our jammies for the heck of it after seeing actual fireman charging into building. He never apologized. It's a nice looking hotel, clean, lots of employees around but apparently no one other than the cleaning staff do anything. No one once offered to help with our bags, sight seeing details, or similar requests. Not the usual 4 star treatment I have experienced at other places. I called the Hyatt accounting department to complain about the charge, out of fairness it was the weekend so they were closed. We'll see if they respond. I'm not optimistic. I am waiting to hear that I clearly don't know how to use a parking ticket. There are plenty of lovely looking hotels in the area, all with about the same rating. I met a ton of other travelers who stayed at those and had great service and more than just a clean bed for their money.

Reviews.Title: “Good one night stop at a really good price”
Reviews.Author: Mary014
Reviews.Content: We had one night in Vancouver before flying back to London. We had stayed in a different hotel at the start of our trip but wanted somewhere of decent quality and not too expensive, which we found a challenge. We had a good price here and so booked it. The porters were very helpful and we had a really quick check in. We had requested a balcony view and got this type of room which was good. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom nice. Yes it would have been nice to have proper glasses in the room if they provide a mini bar but everything else was good, The location is perfect - just a few blocks from shopping, restaurants etc. We had breakfast delivered, very nice and hot and we requested a late check out which they were fine with. Overall I'd say it was standard for a 4* chain and for the price was really good.

Reviews.Title: “The Hyatt Hits All The Right Notes!”
Reviews.Author: NYCFrank
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! The Hyatt has all the things we look for when selecting a hotel, great center city location, wonderful staff, a new $18 million renovation that has left the rooms and public spaces sparkling clean, a full wall of windows that lets in lots of light, they honored our request for an early check-in, a Starbucks in the lobby, a 24/7 Tim Horton's and McDonald's 50 feet out the front door and a small upscale shopping mall attached to the lobby with a wonderful food court in the basement that offered an extensive selection of ethnic foods. In other words, all the comforts of home. Coming from New York, the rates seem like a bargain for the product offered. The buffet breakfast is top notch and room service promised and arrived in less than 30 minutes. Anyone who complains about this hotel had better stay home.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: dingwam
Reviews.Content: My wife and 9 year old daughter stayed in a room with two double beds on the 7th floor. The room was spacious enough for us all and had great views of the city. The staff were very helpful and attentive with the exception of one cleaner who, even though we specifically asked her not to clean the room and had put a notice on the door, was found in our room a short time later. There is a relatively small outdoor heated pool and jacuzzi and a decent gym. We only had (self service) breakfast in the restaurant but it was one of the better hotel breakfasts we've had. Downtown location is good next to the skytrain and shops, restaurants and bars. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Canuckontour
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my one night stay at the Hyatt Regency Vancouver. A great downtown location close to all the amenities. You are so close to all the great shops and restos on Robson and close to the waterfront. Check in was friendly and fast. I loved my modern room complete with a large balcony that had a super view of downtown and down towards the water. The room was spacious and was nicely appointed in gray tones and looked like it had been recently renovated. Bathroom was modern complete with ceiling rain shower that was neat! I liked the bathroom mirror that illuminated! The bed was super comfortable complete with lots if pillows. There were so many windows in this room making it bright and sunny in the morning which was a pleasure to wake up to. Fitness centre was well appointed and there is a pool. This is a busy, large property with a flow of activity in the lobby as it attracts a large convention business. There is a Starbucks in the lobby to grab a morning coffee and a treat. This is convenient as we all know hotel food can normally be overpriced and here this certainly was the case. My only complaints would be lack of free internet and the size of the bathtub which was on the small size. I would most definitely recommend this hotel and hope to stay here again on another trip to the West Coast.

Reviews.Title: “cut, cut, cut....”
Reviews.Author: snasp
Reviews.Content: Don't know what's happening with the Hyatt as a company, but this property offers far less than other " 4 star" properties seem to. No bar glasses in room.... have to call room service then feel obliged to tip deliver person just to get a wine glass. Bath amenities bare bones and of seemingly poor quality. Internet available at a high cost only... no free access in lobby like starwood offers. Even on-site Starbucks must be banned from offering free wi-fi at this location as it's available everywhere else in Vancouver but here. Staff seem slightly disgruntled as well, housekeeping left room half finished with the throw pillows and blanket strewn the floor! I thought the room hadn't been done when first entering only to realise it was simply a poor job. The modern decor is pleasing on some level, but the dark carpeting and bathroom flooring (dark greys to black) can hide a multitude of sins.... and given the level of service experienced I am inclined to think the colour scheme was indeed chosen for this reason (along with the very long dark hair that stuck to my foot after entering the bathroom). Upon entering the room smelt sickeningly of industrial strength air freshener... again, what were they trying to hide? Overall, not the worst place by a long shot, but with so many other wonderful options in Vancouver, the Hyatt would be at the bottom of my list next time.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service, Friendly, Great balcony view, by Ships, Awesome dining.”
Reviews.Author: diamondSranch
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our Alaskan Cruise. We arrived by Taxi from the airport. The service from the time they met us at the Taxi till we left was great. Our bags arrived in our room before we did. Our balcony faced the water and we could see our ship, just a beautiful view of downtown. It was near all the fancy shopping, yet had a Mcdonalds and a drug store right down stairs and Starbbucks too. We walked miles all along the waterfront and also down to the Stanley Park area, it was wonderful. The front desk was Extremely friendly and helpful. We booked a AAA rate, still paid over $200 but worth it. Our AAA rate included a free $55 breakfast which I thought was high until we ate it! The chef at this hotel is amazing, the meals were all unbelievably good. We had drinks in the lobby and ordered a piece of chocolate cake that was the size of a full size cake!!! We had to give over half of it to two other couples!! The shower has a waterfall head coming out of the ceiling, really nice looking. I feel it definitely rates 4 stars with me. Service and friendliness made all the beauty of the hotel come in second. When we were leaving they already had our cab waiting for us and put all of our cruise tags on our luggage for us!! Stay here, you will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Four Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LakeMichiganBoater
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline, and got a very good rate$120 per night for what Priceline said was a "four star hotel" It was not. Although the location, cleanliness, room quality and sleep quality was good, this hotel has several deficiencies which preclude it from being a "four star hotel" A. In this second decade of the XXI Century, no hotel, let alone a "four star hotel" should charge for Internet access. I expect to be "nickled and dimed" by an airline, but not by a "four star hotel" especially when I can get free Internet access from a chain hotel B. There were neither heat lamps nor a fan in the bathroom. C. The towels were thin, and there were no "bath sheets. D. The elevator security did not exist. While using an elevator to get to the floor upon which a room was located required use of the room key, if there were more than one person in the elevator, the other people did not have to use their room keys to get access to their floors. Thus a "non-guest" could enter an elevator with a guest who used his/her room key, the "non-guest" could then press a button for a different floor, get off on the different floor, and then wait for a guest to exit the elevator on the different floor and "mug" the guest. Nobody who built the security system thought of this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Second best stay in Vancouver ever”
Reviews.Author: evilbee11
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in quite a few hotels in Vancouver and this really was a fantastic stay. We got a balcony room and it was very large, clean and nicely furnished. The staff were really top notch. The only three complaints: parking is expensive and a bit confusing (because it combines parking with Royal Centre Parking), the bed is rather bouncy so you feel whenever the other person moves at all, and the bathtub is tiny. I loved the lounge (I recommend the Diamond Spiced Rum Daquiri!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HopeToronto_Ontario
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time staying at the Hyatt! What a great hotel! Rooms are beautiful, very modern and beds so comfortable! Bathroom has a rain forest shower head! Rooms were very clean however I do not think the bedding was changed in the 4 days we stayed I did not see any option cards to request them to change bedding or not! Interesting! Also I made 2 local calls and paid cash when I checked out but I was still billed on my Amex. Other than that the location is great! Close to everything, shopping, waterfront. 24/7 Timmy's and Mcdonalds downstairs! Starbucks in Lobby! Loved the Hyatt!! Service was great! Treated like Royalty! We rented a car for two days and parked down the street at a public parking lot for much cheaper rate! Would I stay again? Yes!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: hotelguest1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night on a getaway. Staff were friendly, nice rooms, great location. Overall good hotel, but i could hear guests speaking in other rooms. Also, they only have one ice on the fourth floor, so kinda annoying to keep having to go down there for ice.

Reviews.Title: “ordinary hotel, there is better out there”
Reviews.Author: Kramax
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some pluses but equally some minuses. The lobby is large and there are ample staff at all times to assist check ins and outs or to assist generally with queries. They are professional and friendly. The room I stayed in was two double beds. It had a view over offices and the street. The towels were nearly threadbare and insufficient in number. The sheets were equally threadbare and what I would expect in a 1 star hotel. Housekeeping was average, large swipe marks could be seen on the mirrors, it was ok, but for a Hyatt I expected better. The shower over bath is good. The room service menu only operates for breakfast and then not until 5pm till 11pm, which was a bit strange. I arrived from Australia and could not order anything at 3pm. However, I will state that the 4 cheese pizza on the room service menu is out of this universe. Order it! I would give gthe hotel a 6 out of 10, it could be so much better with just a little effort. I recommend the hairdressers in the complex too, if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean, modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: luxurylady99
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with this Hyatt Regency, as I feel the HR chain can truly vary from property to property. It is a bit Grand Central Station like in the lobby--but they try to have lots of staff on hand to make the crowds manageable. We had a king room on the 16th floor--I believe there are over 30 floors to the property. You could still hear sirens. The room was immaculate---really, one of the cleanest hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. The facelift it received was beautiful---clean, modern lines. The room was larger than the average hotel room, as was the bathroom. Also, we asked for wine glasses, and we received them without charge in about 5 minutes. Nice touch! Cons: Expensive parking---it will be explained upon check-in---don't do valet, its $51 per day! We've staeyd at other properties in downtown Vancouver with in and out privileges that were only $38 or so. Make sure you self park and either do the payment associated with the City or the one with the hotel. We only moved the car once, so the City version (which does not allow in an out priv. while the hotel version does) worked for us. Other cons---paying for internet! Gah! $5 waters in rooms and vending only available on the fourth floor. Slightly slow elevator to parking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, as usual!”
Reviews.Author: cubabound2008
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice for business, for a number of nights each time. Upon walking in to the hotel, guests are greeted, and checking in is a treat, including being walked to the elevator. The hotel is spotless, the service is professional, efficient, and the needs/wants of guests are anticipated. I traveled with my infant child, and he was treated like gold. The new Starbucks downstairs which replaced the old cafe was working out growing pains during my stay, and when I had to wait once for a coffee due to an internal communication error, I was given a free drink voucher. Room service was excellent. Good quality food, good service. All in all, this hotel provides a quality stay. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: BigGuy042
Reviews.Content: Managed to book through Hotwire at a rate of 109 per night. That in itself made this a deal, as other sites were much higher. The Hyatt Regency is located in downtown Vancouver and is convenient to anything you might want to do. Has an outdoor pool and hottub, which was busy, even during the rainy days. With an eight year old in tow, this was a nice bonus. Room was clean and had a nice view from the 25th floor. Housekeeping took care of things when we were out and made sure the room stayed clean. Wasn't outstanding accomodation but nice, simple and clean. The only downsides included extra charges for parking (at 28 dollars per day) and internet (15 dollars per day). I would recommend this hotel for the price I paid. downtown Vancouver can be relatively expensive, so we got a deal. That being said, not sure I would pay full price, as you can find something a little nicer for the same price

Reviews.Title: “A clueless hotel - you can do so much better”
Reviews.Author: Max_Kitty
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked in for one night at the end of an extremely relaxing vacation. We paid extra for an upper room and specifically requested one (in writing) that was quiet. Our room on the 32nd floor seemed to fit the bill. However, there was a letter from the hotel's general manager in the room advising that roof repairs were going on between 9-5. As this was a Friday, one might reasonably assume repairs would not happen on the weekend...wrong!!! At a little after 9 the next morning, here they came. Why would a hotel: 1) sell rooms at a premium price which are materially impacted (7 days/week we were told) by noisy construction? 2) assign an inferior room to a (purportedly) valued member of their passport club? 3) offer points but not a discount until pushed when a complaint was filed with the manager on duty? 4) give as a feeble excuse "sorry, we were busy when you checked in so it must have been overlooked? Clearly, this Hyatt is clueless about customer service. With so many choices in Vancouver and other major cities, why not look elsewhere?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: candyp63
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful suite on the 33rd floor, awesome view of the city. Very roomy, very clean. Huge bathroom with separate toilet room, which is convenient. The bed was extremely comfortable. Staff was very helpful and pleasant. I loved that they weren't full of themselves but seemed genuine in wanting to help you. I thought the parking rate was extremely high, but I understand it is everywhere in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Up to Standard Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoywonderTo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights and was generally pleased with my stay. It is a typical business hotel and it is certainly up to standard. The location is really good as it is right above the Burrard skytrain Station. Trains from Burrard however do not go to the airport. For that you have to drag your stuff down three blocks to the Vancouver Center Station. It is walking distance from the shops/restaurants on Robson, and only a short cab ride to Yaletown/Davie Village etc. The room I was given was large and everything were, as noted, up to standard. The bathroom was spacious, clean and fairly modern (but not too modern… this is a business hotel afterall). My only complaint about the room was that the wall was pretty thin, and the folks next door were having some sort of prayer meeting with sing song when I was trying to catch a pre-clubbing nap. A small annoyance. I was slotted for a room with two double beds. When I asked to switch to a room with one King bed, I was told I have to pay extra $25 fee per night. Otherwise, I didn’t interact with the staff that much so I can’t really comment on them. It was interesting to see the switch of the crowd in the hotel. During the week the hotel was filled with mostly older business crowd. On the weekend there was an influx of younger, suburban-looking type rolling into downtown for a party (with cases of beer as their luggage). There were no noise problems to speak of though. Overall, good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but don't drive there...”
Reviews.Author: ovimo
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay here. Beautiful ammenities, nice room, great view, clean everywhere, excellent location, very polite and helpful staff. But: $51/day for valet parking???? What a rip-off! And $15/day for internet access? In the 21st century? Wow... Still, we would go back there, just would leave the car elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: cpmof2
Reviews.Content: Our stay started with helpful courteous valet/bell boys and went over the top with a fantastic desk clerk who went above and beyond to make our stay unforgettable. We got an upgrade and service that was almost unbelievable even though we are seasoned travellers for work. I would highly recommend this hotel for work or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed, won't return”
Reviews.Author: acmorris
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in August for a vacation. We give it 3/5 for the following reasons. Pros: * Location. Less than a block from the Burrard Station. It's a short walking distance to anywhere in downtown you'd want to go to. * Bedding quality. Down pillows, comfortable mattress, good thread count, etc. * Convenience. Do you like convenient fast food? Tim Hortons and McDonalds are adjacent, and open 24 hours. * "Service." When we complained about hearing some businessman yack from 5:30am until 8:30am, they quickly arranged to move us to another room that didn't have an adjoining door. They had it ready before we went out for the day, so high marks there. We didn't try the exorbitantly-priced room service, so I can't review that. Cons: * Sound level / sleep quality. The walls must be made of paper. I heard every word of the guy's conversations next to us, and in the new room (with no adjacent door), we still heard drunk people yelling at each other all night. I'm not sure if the glass is double-paned, but we also heard "outdoor yellers" and traffic noise from the 15th floor. (Not from the 32nd, though.) * Value. $15 per day for Internet. $38 for self-park. $5 per bottle of water. Our room might have been < $200 per night (thanks Expedia), but Hyatt is on a die-hard mission to get the lost profit back, and then some. That's about it. Nice hotel, but nicer if you don't need to sleep or don't care about your wallet. We'll look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: so_traveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly fine, and the location is very central. However, the prices were a little bit higher then the other hotels of the same class. I would stay again if you have a good deal. Location: I like the location of this hotel. From the airport, you can take the metro to the City Center stop, and walk about 5-10 minutes. If you are coming from the ship terminals (Canada Place), you can hop on the skytrain and exit the Burrard Street stop. The hotel is right there. Robson Street is a 3-5 minutes walk from the lobby. If you are ambitious, Stanley Park is about a 30 minutes walk from the hotel. It's a nice walk in the morning. Service: Good. Housecleaning good. Check in very professional. The ladies working in the Regency Club were very friendly. Food: The breakfast was in the Regency Club is fine. The snacks during cocktail hours were actually very good. Gym/Pool: Gym was basic in terms of weight machine, but they were all new and the staff kept the gym very clean. The cardio equipment is sufficient (treadmills, elliptical, bike, etc.). There's a smail pool outside. In general, slightly better than an average hotel gym. Room: The room is a nice size, and the decor modern. Nothing stands out, but nothing objectionable either. The view from the room is very nice, as they have a huge window looking out. If the price is within your budget, the hotel is good.

Reviews.Title: “What A Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jumike
Reviews.Content: The welcome we received upon arrival at this hotel was excellent, the valet parking assistant couldn't have been more helpful and even advised us that self parking was more cost effective! Check in was very straight forward and upon being assisted to our room when we opened the door to it we were extremely pleased. The view of downtown was amazing, the size of the room was huge by hotel standards, the decor was very trendy and the cleanliness could not be faulted in the slightest. The hotel bar is very classy and we can highly recommend the cocktails which are priced reasonably. Nearby are a variety of restaurants as is the ocean walk which we chose as we had our children with us so we chose to eat at one of our favourite venues overlooking the marina. Also Gastown is a short stroll away as is Canada Place. Having stayed in Vancouver at least ten times over the last few years we can definately say this is a wonderful hotel. We travel extensively and the Hyatt Regency Vancouver is way up their with a few of our preferred hotels in the world! What we liked best was everything about our room and it's view, the location of the hotel and the price we paid for out one nights stay. The only criticism we have is that we weren't given a parking pass by reception so when leaving the under ground parking lot we had a slight delay. Overall we can highly recommend a stay at this classy downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay and value for dollar”
Reviews.Author: Lindasap
Reviews.Content: Attending the stastics conference from Norc, Chicago we enjoyed our 5 days saty here very much. Very comfortable in the midst of all. Attending the conference getting back and enjoying the city. Say it was so convenient. Hotel staff off all nationalities were extremely wonderfull and help full.Clean and spacious rooms with views of water and mountains was nostalgic. Their MOSIC BAR AND GRILL was a nice place to wind up too.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Travbits
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for us. We had coupled business and leisure. The staff was courteous and actually offered us a room with a decent view of the downtown (given that we had booked from priceline.) We very much like the room decor too. It is close to Stanley park, Coal harbour, shopping and restuarants. There is a quaint italian restuarant next to the hotel, the ambiance and food was very good There is a free shuttle to some of the attractions like the Capilano bridge. Also the subway station is right next to the hotel, proved to be very convinient for transportation to and from the airport(take the blue/canada line). My only dissatisfaction was the high WiFi charge of $15/day, we ended up going to the nearby Starbucks (not the one in house)

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: Dave12345
Reviews.Content: I stayed here woth my girlfriend for 3 nights in July while we were between apartments. The room was comfortable and exactly what you would expect from a "business" hotel. Staff were generally pleasant and friendly although there was one woman on the reception desk who was abrupt bordering on rude to both myself and my girlfriend on separate occasions. Location is great, right next to Burrard skytrain station, although the rates reflect this. My biggest gripe was the internet / wireless, especially as this is a business hotel and this must therefore be a service with quite a high takeup. I work from home so needed an Internet connection while we were staying here. Hyatt charge $15 per day for internet connectivity which is bad enough (amazing how plenty of cheap hotels manage to provide wireless for free), however, having paid for the service I would at least expect it to be implemented well throughout the hotel. It worked in the room but as soon as I decided to do a bit of work in the bar, I couldn't get a connection - when i asked the bartender he said that there was no connectivity on the lower 2 floors. Come on Hyatt, wireless connectivity throughout the entire hotel is hardly difficult - especially when you are charging for the service. Apart from that, this is a perfectly nice hotel without being anything special - I don't see how I can recommend it as for the high price there are simply too many better options in a similar location

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel available at low rates. Use Priceline (or similar); it wouldn't be worth full rate”
Reviews.Author: RS42
Reviews.Content: We asked for a 4-star through priceline and got the Hyatt. We called to request king-bed and non-smoking and got both without any issue. The room was nice, very clean with a well-laid out bathroom, quiet, and very restful. The location of the hotel right beside the Burrard skytrain and all of downtown is awesome. On that note, unless you specifically need it we'd recommend coming here by skytrain. Parking is $28 (self-park) or $38 (valet) plus tip; this will about double your cost if you got a good rate. We checked a couple of websites with posted rates and I must say that had I paid full rate I would give a far worse review for value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: kiwitravelar
Reviews.Content: From the minute we checked in, it was a great experience. The hotel is quite old but it has had a soft refurb. The beds are exceptional, flat screen tvs etc - all the mod cons.. Yes you only get 1 teabag but we upgraded to the Club Regency room and this had as many cups of tea as you can get. I am shocked like some other feedback that you don't have free internet. We were on the Regency level and you could only get free wireless in the Club Lounge.. not even in your room which is odd to say the least. Service at this hotel is EXCEPTIONAL and the hotel should be very proud. I didn't work out on this holiday but the gym has heaps of equipment and it looked in good working order. I was gutted I didn't take work out gear! Great location.. and the Urban Market is only abt 5 mins walk away for the yummiest fresh food to buy. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and Dimed us to Death”
Reviews.Author: michele1001
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through Hotwire and it was as though they had a problem with this. We were given a smoking room which we did not want so we had to downgrade the bed size to get a clean smelling room. We were told that if we wanted a good room we would have to pay an extra $25. There was no free internet ($15 for the night) as we didn't want the upgraded room which we found strange for a 4 star hotel. The room was okay but lacked the amenities of other 4 stars we have stayed at. The person who checked us in was very nice but overall we felt as though we were treated like second class citizens.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: drssyoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July 2010 with my spouse. It was absolutely fabulous. We spent a lot of time sightseeing, so did not use many of the facilities offered at the hotel, but the room was fantastic, clean, modern and comfortable. Location is about 3 blocks from the main sky train station - took about 30 minutes from the airport on the sky train. It is about 4 blocks from the water front and the convention center, about 10 blocks to Gastown and about same distance to Chinatown. Certainly walkable. Vancouver is a lovely city for walkers and bikers. The room was nicely appointed and the staff were extremely nice. A couple gave us information on restaurants and such that we found weren't exactly what we were looking for, but still very helpful. Had a nice drink at the hotel bar - excellent service. Internet service was $15 canadian, which is unfortunate since the rest of the city, including the airport, seems to offer free internet. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: kekbaldw
Reviews.Content: Great location. Modern rooms. Business centre open 24 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Worst night sleep ever”
Reviews.Author: KlondikeQuest
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hyatt Regency this weekend with my wife and her parents - we deliberately chose a 4 star hotel so we would be guaranteed good quality and service. I also read the reviews on Trip advisor and it sounded great. The room was pleasant enough and clean, however we were disappointed to find the room supplied only two polystyrene cups, powdered milk and only one teabag to share between the two of us (of course we could have ordered a pot of tea from room service with the additional service charge and compulsory tip each time) I was awoken at 0140am (despite wearing earplugs) by a party being held in the room next door, which continued untill sunlight. The 'guests' in the next room were leaning out of their window shouting, laughing and smoking, and it sounded as if every item of furniture was being rearranged and bashed against the walls and floor. The Hyatt Regency fill empty rooms last minute at a large discount using a 3rd party website. I know that groups of people will book one room this way, share the cost and use it as a base to go to clubs downtown, and they unfortunately tend to continue the party back at the hotel. It may be a good place to stay midweek, but I would not recommend it on a friday or saturday night. Officially the worst night sleep I have had in a hotel and the worst stay in Vancouver. I have stayed in lower rated and much cheaper hotels in Vancouver and never had a problem, and certainly will not 'treat myself' to the expense of staying in the Hyatt Regency again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel-great service-great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Snowisnotcool
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my teenage daughter. We were both impressed by the professional service, large room and comfortable beds. We arrived early in the day and I had requested an early check in which they were able to accommodate. I chose the AAA breakfast package from the Hyatt's website and I feel this was a great value. The breakfast was not your run of the mill cold muffins and coffee, but a full cooked breakfast buffet. The buffet included omelettes cooked to order, eggs Benedict, bacon, lox, cream cheese, fruit, fresh baked goods, great coffee, fresh juice, the works. I was surprised and very pleased at this nice way to start our days in Vancouver. When I had a question about a 3 dollar difference on my bill, the staff went to great lengths to solve the problem, which I appreciated. The location is fabulous- just a block from the Burrard sky train station and 3 blocks from the Granville sky train station. It is also just 2 blocks from the Vancouver Art Museum and many other great downtown attractions. The area is busy but safer than other downtown locations I think. I felt very comfortable walking around the area at night, which I could not say about some other downtown Vancouver hotels. My only complaint is with the high surcharge for wi-fi. I can't believe they charge so much for a service most other hotels offer for free now. Other than that, I was very happy and I will certainly stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable beds, easy checkin/checkout process”
Reviews.Author: southender2
Reviews.Content: I got off my cruise at Canada place and it was about a half hour walk uphill to the Hyatt. The checkin was easy. I used the touch screen computer at the front desk to check in and then it spit out my receipt and room cards. Very nice. It's conveniently located in downtown Vancouver next to the Burrard train station and within walking distance to Gastown and Chinatown. The concierge was pretty helpful in giving me directions and where to convert my currency...they even told me that I could get better rates on Robson St. instead of at the hotel. The beds and pillows were quite comfortable. I didn't like that they nickle and dime you on the little things like internet fees and local phone call fees, which other hotels offer for free. I checked out through the TV in the room and dropped off my room cards at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: didi483
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect choice without any doubt. The location is excellent. My room and bathroom were big and very clean. In the bathroom I had a professional hairdryer! The bed was utterly comfortable. From the room I had a wonderful view of the city. The breakfast buffet was really very good, with a lot of choices and if you would have desired something particular, the stuff was ready to help you. I’ve tried the fitness room. It was well equipped. The pool was ok. The atmosphere you feel is special, the staff is very kind and helpful. I’d definitely spend nights here again.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding Service!”
Reviews.Author: walkman6
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hyatt Regency tired after a long day of sightseeing in Victoria, BC. We were greeted warmly by the bellman who took our bags and walked us to the reception desk, waited while we registered then brought us to a very nicely appointed room. Nice view, roomy, nice 40" flat panel TV, large desk. The only negative for my wife was the subtle lighting in the bath. Not good for makeup, etc. Good location for walking to harbor and shopping areas. Can't say enough about Eric at the Concierge Desk. He gave us excellent dining suggestions, tour and sightseeing info and really worked hard to arrange our train transport to Seattle. He went above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mintcreative
Reviews.Content: We'd stayed in North Vancouver the previous night, and arrived at the Hyatt around midday expecting to leave our bags with the concierge while we went sight seeing. Much to our delight, we were cheerfully informed our room was already cleaned and available. Fantastic service - we were even walked to the elevator! Our room was elegant, modern and spacious, with an incredibly comfortable bed and a gorgeous bathroom. Our 24th floor room had a great view too. Being newbies to Vancouver, I really appreciated the fact that they had several city guides in our room - something that was missing from the two other hotels we had stayed at in Van in recent weeks! Great service, good location (especially with transit so close by) and fabulous rooms. I'm sure we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “I would go back”
Reviews.Author: BluDragonFlyer
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at the Hyatt in room with King bed. The hotel was extensively remodeled about 4-5 years ago and still looks great! Starbucks was recently added to the lobby--a big plus in my book. The rooms are clean and modern with Flat screen TVs, nice work desks and chairs with plenty of recepticles for recharging phone, camera etc. The beds are comfortable with great pillows & linens. The furniture and carpeting were all in excellent condition. The bathrooms have great counter space and the shower has a center rainshower head--all with great tile and finishes. A couple of minor issues: The room is quiet--except that the hotel doors close with such noise you cannot help but clearly hear people entering and leaving their rooms if they let the door close on it's own. The hotel towels are boderline skimpy. A bit on the thin side--I was hoping for something a little more plush and a little less thread barren.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest hotel staff we've ever met”
Reviews.Author: ellibusch
Reviews.Content: While planning our trip to Vancouver with maps and guides, it was still difficult to figure out the best place to stay for walking to the sites of interest and finding nearby shops and restaurants. We were thrilled with the location of the Hyatt Regency Vancouver. But, we were even more thrilled with the welcoming and friendly attitude we received from all of the hotel staff; from the Registration desk, to the Concierge desk, where people were staffed at all hours and excited to help you figure out the best way to do whatever you wanted. We made many "friends" in the normal course of our stay with employees of the hotel who all seem to love their job. The Mosaic Restaurant in the hotel has beautiful fresh and seasonal food with reasonable prices and the staff is extremely gracious. They make you feel as if you are an important guest. If you are celebrating any kind of special occasion, the chef will make you an impressive 4 layer Belgian Chocolate cake. Our room was immaculate and a classy modern style. Comfy bed, gorgeous bathroom and fantastic views of the city. We absolutely loved Vancouver and when we go back, we will definitely stay at the Hyatt Regency.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you want to be right downtown”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQue
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at Hyatt Vancouver after our cruise. We were given a free upgrade to a room on the 16th floor with a lovely balcony that overlooked downtown. The room was huge with a king bed, work desk, 2 chairs and a TV. Small frig when you first entered the room next to the closet. Good size bathroom. This hotel is the place to be if you want to stay in downtown Vancouver as you are just a few blocks from Robson Street and the many shops. However, be warned it is very busy and you can hear cars/sirens at all hours of the day/night, so if you want quiet this is not the place to stay. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt knows service if not feng shui”
Reviews.Author: monkeyface09
