Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive till the time you leave, staff are so efficient and attentive that help appears right when you need it. As for the rooms, great shower heads, but what 4-diamond hotel doesn't provide a toiletry kit with cotton swabs? While beds are comfy, mirrors placed in front of them is a definite feng shui faux pas - surprising in a cosmopolitan city with strong ties to China. Overall, an enjoyable stay, and with Starbucks just an elevator ride away, it's even possible to get over the fact that there's no complementary paper outside your door in the am.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service!”
Reviews.Author: HammerNB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for 4 nights in May with my wife as a long weekend getaway. We took the Canada Line in from the airport which was very easy and the hotel is only a 5 minute walk from the Line. Service was top notch, very friendly and professional - walking us to the elevator and booking reservations for us at restaurants. Gym is nice size and modern. Rooms are modern, apparently recently renovated - and the location could not be better. Their is a Startbucks in the lobby, and also the Skytrain (access) is next door. The only knocks are $15 for internet access per day and outside pool and hot-tub.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beds and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: FAHLaLaLaLa
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay here for my first visit to Vancouver, because of the corporate rate I received as well as the hotel's location. The location is downtown, a few blocks in from the waterfront--walking distance from Art Museum, Robeson Street, Davie Village, and Granvill St--and right next to underground train station. Hotel had recently been renovated and the pictures on hotel's website resembled what I saw in person. Beds are extremely comfortable. Staff was quite responsive when needed. The Concierge was excellent and quite knowledgable about the city and on-going activities. My only two compaints: 1) Door Man was not around to assist with door when I arrived at 2:00 pm. He was absent on several other occassions as well. 2) The walls between rooms and floors are thin so sometimes you could hear your neighbors. Other than these two minor issues, the hotel is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended; outstanding in all respects”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Pro55
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency in Vancouver was actually my second choice because my first choice had no rooms available. As it turned out, I now have a new favourite hotel in Vancouver! A lovely hotel in the heart of downtown, the Hyatt Regency is close to many of the city's most popular attractions. Located on Burrard Street, the waterfront and the trendy Robson Street area are just steps away, and Coal Harbour and Stanley Park just short drives up the road. But the hotel itself and the service guests receive are far more important than even a stellar location. The Hyatt Regency does not disappoint. Rooms are well-appointed, and many have city views. The property offers the usual amenities including a business center, fitness room, concierge service, and The Gallery Lounge and the Mosaic Bar & Grille on the second floor. It is adjacent to one of the city's indoor malls, making it very convenient to grab a snack, do some shopping, or buy that item you forgot to pack and simply can't do without. When booking online, Hyatt offers the option of choosing an upgraded room for a modest additional fee on a space-available basis. I've used this option several times in various cities and have never been disappointed. In Vancouver, an extra $12 a night garnered us a "superior" room on the 31st floor with a great view of the city and a peek view of the water beyond. And the AAA rate included either a buffet or menu breakfast at the Mosaic Bar and Grille. One drawback is the parking. Be sure to take the "hotel rate" if you're visiting during the week. On our first night I didn't, and parking the car from 3:00 p.m. on our day of arrival until about noon the next day (21 hours) cost a whopping $49! When I brought it to the attention of Mike, the hotel's manager, he immediately provided free parking for our second day, then charged us the hotel rate of $30 for our final day. That was but one example of the hotel's excellent customer service! The Hyatt Regency Vancouver has a AAA Four-Diamond rating and, based on our experience, it is well-deserved. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location; Nice place; good service”
Reviews.Author: blueshopper84
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency on Burrard St. in Vancouver is located right in the middle of downtown Vancouver. The service and check-in was painless and the room was very nice. We had a great view of downtown Vancouver from our floor to ceiling windows. For cruisers it's only about 4 blocks from the cruise harbor. Restaurants are abundant in the area and an easy walk to get to. We used the Canada Line from the airport to get here...the terminal was only about 4 easy blocks from the hotel and we walked to the hotel "pulling our wheeled luggage. The Elephant and Castle pub and restaurant is only a few blocks down the street and I'd recommend this for the dining experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business or leisure - and family friendly too!”
Reviews.Author: woolly1dog
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights at the end of April/early May for a conference, and I brought my husband and two small children. The hotel is very baby-friendly, providing a pack n' play at no extra cost with sheet, blanket, and baby towel, and complimentary pack of baby wash and lotion. The hotel room had a king bed in it, and was spacious with a desk that had easy outlet access for a laptop. There was a safe, and hair dryer available, and flat-screen TV. There was a minifridge with beverages that you could purchase, but the freezer was not cold enough and the knob was removed so I could not decrease the temperature. However, the staff informed me that if I needed to freeze the icepack for my baby's cooler, I could ask the front desk to store it for me. I heard barely any noise from other rooms. The staff was friendly and helpful and was enthusiastic about recommending places to eat or places to go. We had a great view of downtown, only blocks from the convention center and walking distance to Stanley park. If you bring your own car, the parking is actually with an adjoining shopping center and is rather expensive through the hotel, and you might want to consider just paying the weekend rate through the center instead of the hotel and then using the hotel rate for the even more expensive weekdays. The adjoining center conveniently has a Tim Horton's and McDonald's and Rexall Drugs in it.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Denali National Park and Preserve, Alaska
Reviews.Title: “Great remodeled hotel. Rooms are up to par.”
Reviews.Author: trilobite01
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with my stay. As usual, Hyatt charges too much for additional services: parking, internet, etc. But I've come to deal with it. The only complaint I can find is the towels. The towels in the room might be acceptable at Motel 6, but not Hyatt Regency. They were paper thin and not acceptable. However the bathrooms are fantastic with rainmaker shower heads in the ceiling. Rear mirror lighting, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Luv2CtheGlobe
Reviews.Content: This hotel had all of the essentials for a good hotel stay. The rooms were spacious, clean and functional- nothing fancy really. The staff was very nice and the concierge extremely helpful. There are also several tours that pick up right from the hotel (Big Bus Tours and the free shuttle to Capilano Suspension Bridge), so that was very helpful. The only negative about the hotel was the steep charge for the in room internet service. This hotel was in a very central location in the city and I could walk everywhere from it! There is also a 24 hour coffee shop and 24 hour McDonald's right outside the front door. I would definately stay here again on a return trip to Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Post Olympic Stay”
Reviews.Author: howeboyz
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for perfect location - ease to get to University of British Columbia campus, walk to Robson St and area shopping and to view the outdoor Olympic flame. Arrived around 10:30pm after a 7hr flight. Check-in has now become impersonal as it is by touch screen. Took our key cards and headed to our room... that would be the one that answered an email to requesting extra towels, two beds and a quiet room. Walked into a room with one king bed for the 4 of us... back down we all went where I found a human to fix the problem who didn't seem to care. Room service staff polite, quick but food not so great. Room was quiet and very comfortable and clean - no complaints. Both mornings we headed directly out the door to Tim Hortons for coffee and apple fritters - our favorites. We would stay again here - all in all it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Functional business hotel, decent gym, great staff, central”
Reviews.Author: CRtor
Reviews.Content: Central location, staff went above and beyond when asked for recommendations/directions, rooms are what you would expect with a few modern elements. Convenient connection to underground shopping.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: costaricanvoyageur
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, modern hotel with everything you could want! No complaints whatsoever. We are young and love hiking, etc., so we arrived at this posh hotel with just our backpacks (no luggage) and the staff was super friendly, gave us a free upgrade to a room with a balcony (we didn't even request it!) which was newly renovated, with granite counter tops etc. The Hyatt is in an ideal location, right in the thick of it. The concierge was so helpful. Staff even tried (albeit unsuccessfully) to track down a hair straightener for me to borrow since mine quit on me. We went all over Vancouver (Stanley Park, Granville island, Yorktown, Gastown,) and always walked. The pool, hot tub and fitness area were great too. You won't regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency, Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: AlisonDinsdale
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, extremely clean, staff are very friendly and couldn't do enough for us. Excellent location. Would definitely stay there next time we go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views!”
Reviews.Author: MRNKubby
Reviews.Content: There are always wonderful water views in Vancouver Hyatt. Hard to find a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NavpreetS
Reviews.Content: we loved the hotel. Its very close to all attractions of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great rooms, great view”
Reviews.Author: BlueWoman
Reviews.Content: After visiting Vancouver the previous year for a one day stop on a tour we decided we wanted to visit for a little longer. We had been in the Four Seasons previously but decided on the Hyatt. We upgraded to the junior suite, whilst expensive it was actually good value for the space we had. We didn't get off to a brilliant start with an 11 hour delay at Heathrow (Air Canada - not the weather). We arrived at 2.30am to a very chirpy check-in and a lovely bellman who was extremely helpful. Initially he only opened the 2nd room and I was slightly shocked to see only a sofa bed - made up really well and no sign of the balcony it was supposed to have. After a quick question he quickly apologised and let us in to the adjoining bedroom. Both rooms were huge and the bedroom had a great balcony with fantastic views (26th floor). The bathrooms were spotless and the bed was extremely comfortable. Having a suite was lovely, after a long day on foot I was able to chill in the 'living room' whilst my other half had a snooze. We spent ages on the balcony taking fantastic night shots. Having the ipod radios was great as we had our ipods with us. The free coffee machines were good and there also tea. The mini bar was expensive but you would expect this from any higher end hotel. The only gripe was the water at 5 dollars a bottle - very expensive. Cleaning was exceptionally good and any requests were responded to straight away. The restaurant was great for breakfast and the staff very attentive - I love that they had an egg station so I could have omlette for brekkie. However breakfast was expensive - we found a couple of great cafe's serving lovely breakfast at a fraction of the price. We had an evening meal there as well and it was ok but overly salty, I mentioned this to the waiter and he was extremely apologetic and offered a free dessert straight away. Overall I could not fault this hotel, it's really well located for Robson Street (the main shopping road) and a very short walk to the Sea Bus and train station, along with the Harbour Centre and the revolving restaurant. The only downside was the noise from an adjoining room - one evening they were playing instruments and we could hear them clearly! This only seemed an issue if there was an adjoining door as we never heard anything from the other room which did not have one.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended - 3 days is not enough!”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaTravel_Queen
Reviews.Content: We are avid Hyatt fans and when we planned our trip to Vancouver, we knew that it would have to be at this hotel. The reviews were very good and the proximity to many attractions was highly desirable. We arrived at YVR and had arranged for a limo to transport us to the hotel. Once at the hotel, the doorman, concierge, front desk, and all the staff were wonderful. We were escorted to our room on the 17th floor and concierge spent roughly 15 minutes explaining local attractions to visit, things to do, dining options, etc. all with an upbeat attitude. Everyone in the hotel was always quick to assist at every turn. There is a wonderful restaurant and bar in the hotel. A la carte breakfast items were very reasonably priced and a full breakfast was also available. In the evenings, the bar had a piano man and dancing... very nice. There were a variety of guests from doctors, convention guest, to family members of the band. The bar drinks were reasonably priced, and there was a separate area for those wishing to watch sports on the big screen. An added bonus is the close proximity to Canada Place (6 blocks), bus station (4 blocks), the new subway station (2 blocks), and various shopping/dining options within 1 block (Starbucks, McDonalds, etc.). I have absolutely nothing negative to say about our stay here. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, amazing service”
Reviews.Author: me_us_we
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel on December 12 for my husband's work Christmas party. The hotel was full, hosting several Christmas functions that night. I was incredibly impressed with the service in this hotel. I have stayed at the Four Seasons, Westin Bayshore, and other lovely hotels in Vancouver but I've never seen such courteous and completely professional staff. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, despite being very busy. The event room was great and the catering was fantastic. Our room was gorgeous. We had a King bed balcony room on the 15th floor. I loved the modern yet comfortable room decor and the dark, slate bathroom. We heard very little noise despite the fact that the hotel was very full. I can not comment on the pool or fitness rooms since we did not look at or use them during our visit. Only a couple of downsides... They forgot to remove one of the down pillows from the room. I knew I was having a strong allergic reaction but I didn't realize that it was one of the pillows until late at night. Also, I wasn't crazy about the toiletries. It was the first time EVER that I didn't use or take home the products offered because of the overly strong scent. However, these are not major issues. I would highly recommend this hotel for a romantic getaway, night on the town or business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, rooms, and location in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Devo1975
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during the Christmas holidays as a break from all the family chaos. My wife and I are in our early 30's and have a 9 month old baby. We found the Hyatt to be a beautiful hotel, very clean and well maintained. The room we had was a good-size with excellent amenities, including a soaker tub, huge comfortable bed, large LCD TV, and nice bath products. Most importantly, it is in the heart of the shopping district a mere block away from Robson Street. I is easy to walk just about anywhere downtown. The staff were friendly and helpful with our massive amounts of luggage and baby paraphernalia. They came up set up a crib in our room as well. The only gripe I have and the reason this hotel didn't get 5 stars is the parking and fee for wireless internet. As one reviewer put it, the price for parking was exorbitant at $30 per night. Wi fi was $15 per night. In my opinion, when you pay to stay in a nice hotel, the fee should include these fees or at the very least offer the services at a considerable discount. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Regency and would recommend it to anyone traveling for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travel not personal leisure”
Reviews.Author: bijalshah16
Reviews.Content: We visited Vancouver for Xmas 2009. The hotel in itself is good , but there is a major issue of parking. the hotel does not have a parking garage or a parking lot. There is a public parking right below the hotel which is bit on an expensive side when you want to have a relaxing in and out of Parking vacation. SO for business travel where you travel by Taxi or train its fine, but if u need to pay so much extra for a couple of days vacation is a lot. Rest the location is right in downtown which is good and so is the great shopping around. Very close to Stanley park and North vancouver Capilano Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt during the Holidays”
Reviews.Author: RAW9
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through a travel website that offered a discounted rate. That did not mean I got discounted service. My first impression was positive as I was greeted by a uniformed bellman that assisted me with my luggage from check in all the way to my room. The hotel was not filled to capacity so getting the choice of a room was easy. The room offered a fantastic view of downtown and it was on a higher floor so the noise from the street below was minimal. The blare of a siren could still be heard. The room was spotless and well equipped for the business traveller. An IPOD docking station is part of the alarm clock radio. Neat! This property offers an electronic check in and if you avail yourself of this feature, you simply proceed to the self serve check in counter. The same arrangement can be made upon departure. Checking out was simple and the front desk clerk was most accommodating, offering precise directions to the skytrain. There are ample opportunities for meals in and around the hotel. I did not patronize any of these establishments so I am not able to post a review. Overall, a great hotel and I do look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: TGordL
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed overnight at the Hyatt for my company's Christmas party. We had a room on the 17th floor with a view overlooking the downtown core. The room was clean, nicely decorated, and in a corner so we thought it'd be peaceful and quiet. Unfortunately, I was awoken at 6 am by the loud sound of running water from an adjacent suite and the sound of either their TV or music blaring as well. After a late night Christmas party I had hoped to have a peaceful and lazy morning to start the next day! What a shame as I enjoyed everything else about the hotel. Our Christmas party was a lot of fun, the meal was delicious and the service overall quite good!

Reviews.Title: “Lousy restaurant”
Reviews.Author: jeh106
Reviews.Content: 11 of of our family dined here on a Thursday night. Food was spotty (some good, some terrible). Service was good but the server could not get our bill correct. It took about 45 minutes and three trips to finally get them right. Would not go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Made my 21st birthday one to remember!”
Reviews.Author: bearworly
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and his mother gave me trip to Vancouver for my 21st birthday. It was booked though a travel agent. Once I was made aware of the trip I was instantly excited, the excitment quickly turned into panic when I did my round of double checks on our flights and hotel. EVERYTHING was incorrect, wrong name on my flight pass, wrong room type....it was unbelievably. When we tried to complain and get some kind of fix for our trouble we were told " well sh** happens, im sorry my brother died and was not able to help her with this, next time i wont go to his funeral". The point to my story..as much as I was excited I was dreading the troubles we were going to have once we landed. Once we arrived we had no troubles with our bags or anything (good sign I was hoping) we grabbed a ride to our hotel soon after our landing and were greated by lovely staff at the front door. Our bags were taking and brought to the front desk where we checked in with the sweetest front desk agent. Aftter an effortless check in we were taken to the elevator and shown where our room was. Our room was upgraded to a lovely balcony suite with a view of the street below...it was everything I dreamed and more! We had no problems with noise other than the cars below which i expected. Our extra lock on our door did look like it was ripped open but we called down and went to lunch and by the time we were back it was fixed. Whenever we asked for directions or anything the guest service agents were so quick to help to the best of there ability. We also were given a beautiful gift compliments of the chef for my birthday which left me breathless! The pool facilities are decent, the hot tub sure gets packed though. My only complaints were the ridiculous prices of things. My local call was even charged. We avoided anything of any charge as best we could. No internet included, buisness center was pricey to even use there computers Other than that our stay was lovely and I would definitly reccomend this hotel to anyone who doesnt mind spending that little extra for a celebration or special night, you wont be dissapointed if you are willing shell out the coin.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: WallyGreenblatt
Reviews.Content: just what you can expect from this kind of hotel. Location is good, walking distance to the harbour and all touristic spots in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Jassenia
Reviews.Content: That hotel was amazing, very nive and extremely great people.

Reviews.Title: “We were very impressed.”
Reviews.Author: snydertxgal
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. The rooms were very clean and the bed had fluffy, comfortable covers on it. Our view of Vancouver was nice. The amenities in the bathroom were very enjoyable; I don't remember the brand of the lotion, shampoo, etc., but they had a ginger scent and I took the extras with me. Right next to the hotel is a little mall with several places to eat, so if you don't want to spend alot of money on food, you can walk next door. The staff was attentive and polite.

Reviews.Title: “An Interesting Experience”
Reviews.Author: aspenhawaii
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel with a balcony. Just needed a way to escape the room and this hotel featured the rare Vancouver balcony. This treasured balcony was large and triangular in shape. Oddly, it had a rather large light shaped and sized like your old style hubcap that was mounted to the wall. It was really bright, almost like it was put there to warn ships in the harbor. I called the front desk and asked how I could shut this light off. The nice young lady at the desk told me that "you can't shut it off, it shuts off automatically at mid-night. But you should have heavy drapes in your room that you can close if it bothers you". At this response I had a laugh and sensing how strange I thought their balcony light protocol to be, she cheerfully told me that she "could send someone up to take the light apart and loosen the bulbs". Now that is service, though I declined. It did finally shut off at 1AM. On arrival at the room the bellman explained that ice was available on the floor below us. A few minutes later I took the ice bucket to go in search of ice, leaving my wife and the room key card behind. Arriving at the ice machine I discovered you needed your room key card to enter the ice room. I hadn't run into this before, but ok, I headed back to the room to retrieve the key. Of course now I couldn't operate the elevator without the key. The greater point is this. If Hyatt needs to lock access to their ice machine it suggests they don't really have any control over who is wandering around their building. Finally this, if you do choose their balcony room, it come with an added benefit. The door to the balcony functions like an exercise machine. The door is heavy and the sliding tracks not maintained at all. Opening the door just 16 inches is sort of a combination bench press and squat exercise. On the other hand, the room was clean and recently updated.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Trip-Lvr-SLC
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic - the beds are so comfortable that you almost don't want to get out of them!! I wanted to package one up and take it home! :) The staff was also exceptionally helpful - they helped us to get where we needed to go and also helped get tickets at discounted prices. I also had a little snaffoo and accidentally booked for only one night. They promptly gave me the online rate (saving us $70) and set us up with a room for both nights. THANK GOODNESS! I highly recommend this hotel - you won't be disappointed. The location is also great - we walked to Stanley Park a few times during our stay and it was easy to get to and pretty to walk along the pier.

Reviews.Title: “amazing customer service and great location”
Reviews.Author: TOlimo
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Vancouver after spending a few days on Salt Spring Island at a wedding. We had only booked one night and were planning to spend our first night with family (we were in Vancouver for two nights). Our family accomodation fell through so we thought we would head over to the Hyatt and see if they could give us our room a day early. Kristen at the front desk was a joy to deal with and upgraded our room and gave us a major discount. We had just spent an extra $200 on our rental car and needed a bit of cheering up and she did the job quite well!! We were very impressed with the service. Hotel wise it was great. Obviously updated rooms which felt modern but cozy. We had a balcony with a great view of the water and Grouse Mountain. The hotel was within walking distance of a lot of things. I was shocked at the amount of homeless people and how aggressive they were. We live in Toronto which is not without its homeless but I have never had experiences like this. We were sitting in a restaurant just up Burrard and had a couple gentleman (homeless) come up to the window and stand there tapping on the glass and watching us eat (with hands stretched out I might add). All in all it was very uncomfortable to say the least...Anyways, we had rented a car and were trying to get creative with the parking. $28 a day sounded a little steep. The front desk was actually very helpful with alternate arrangements and did not force us to use their service. We ended up parking both nights on Melville street which runs along the north side of the hotel. We were warned about break ins, but we just removed EVERYTHING from the car (change/GPS etc) and had NO problems. It is $2 for 24 minutes which is high BUT if you park after 8 its free til 9 the next morning. We made sure to be there for 8 and ended up paying virtually nothing for parking the whole trip. Saved a lot for sure. The room was nice. I agree about the shower being a touch odd. Very nice and modern in theory but the water pressure was not great and it was hard to find a great angle for the square recessed head. Street noise was there but we actually slept with the patio door open for that reason. All part of the ambiance of a city. Unfortunately the outside light was on the first night ALL night (on the balcony) which I am assuming is a safety measure as the railings were not very high. About to my waist and I am 5'8. The second night it was mysteriously off so that was alright. We booked through priceline and got a great deal. The only real downside is the amount of security. Don't get me wrong, security is a nice thing to have BUT when we walked in after 9pm there were employees everywhere which seemed like veiled security dressed up as bellman. Using the room key to get up to the room seems like a popular thing these days and im cool with that. Also at the actually room door they have a gold guard near the handle that I guess is there to stop people from jimmy-ing the lock to get in...that was a little disturbing lol. All in all I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: overseastar
Reviews.Content: Similar to an early poster here, we booked through Hotwire ($99USD per night) and also stayed in Room 519 during this September long weekend. The floor below us (4th) is where the fitness centre and the pool was located. Check-In went rather smooth. We were originally offered a king-size bed on the 12th floor, but I asked if we could get 2 double beds instead, and was kindly accommodated and switch down to the 5th floor. As previously mentioned, this room is at the corner of floor pretty much. As you opened the door, you get a long hallway, then make a right turn before you see the actual room. Its perfect if you have lots of luggages since there was a lot of space in this "hallway" as you entered the room. There was a huge desk with a lamp at the corner of the room. Everything was clean and the bathroom was just perfectly lit with just the right amount of lighting. From this room, we can see the pool & hot tub, and there were people in the hot tub still at around 10pm. No noise issue though since this room faces away from the street. Even though we were on a low floor with absolutely no view but the pool & hot tub, it was good enough for us since we were on a 9am-9pm schedule and the view doesn't really bother us that much. The beds were comfortable and room temperature was comfortable. The beds do look a little small for a double bed though. But for 2 small people sleeping in one bed, that wasn't a problem at all. Overall, I'd recommend this hotel to others. After reading all other reviews, and if you don't care much about the view, request for a room that faces the pool & hot tub. That side is much quieter, and I had no noise issues whatsoever on a busy weekend on the 5th floor. Getting to the hotel was convenient with the newly opened Canada Line Train. It took us 45 minutes to get from the airport to the hotel (Burrard Station). Once you walk out of the train station, the hotel is right there (less than a min walk). We did consider taking the airporter originally from airport to hotel but it would have taken us an hour or more based on its schedule...but I believe this service wiill no longer be offered as of mid-September since the opening of the Canada Line is much more convenient and obviously takes less time to get to Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Good Location, Modern Rooms, Street Noise a Problem”
Reviews.Author: RedSoxRox
Reviews.Content: This hotel was decent. We stayed here for one night prior to our Alaskan cruise. We had two rooms split between the 5 of us. Check in took a while because they couldn't seem to get our reservation quite right. We booked through the cruise line for 2 rooms at the hotel by we had 3 rooms on the ship, so I think that's what caused some confusion. Initially they said we had three rooms, which we would have taken since they said we booked and paid for 3 rooms, but when it came down to it, they found out that we really did only have 2 and one of the rooms listed 0 people being in it which confused them. It took us a good 30 minutes to finally check in. We were given an ocean view room on the 6th or 8th floor, I can't remember, but there are more than 30 floors in this hotel, so it was one of the lower ones. The "ocean view" room we received meant that we could see a sliver of the ocean if you looked far down a busy street. I would never have considered this an ocean view. Maybe if you were higher up you might have seen more ocean, but not where we were. I also found the rooms to be very loud and the traffic below woke me up several times in the middle of the night. I didn't have any issue with noise in the hall or other rooms, but outside was the loudest. The hotel is located on a busy street, so the noise was really a problem. This was the biggest issue for me because it did wake me up multiple times in the middle of the night, and I was exhausted from our trip from the East Coast, so to be woken up, shows how loud it really was. I really enjoyed the modernity of this hotel because that's my style. The rooms were very modern with a nice desk, 2 double beds that seemed VERY small, not like other double beds I've slept in. The one complaint I could see people having here was that the lighting in the bathroom was very modern, but not super bright. I would have liked more light when showering, but it wasn't horrible. If I was going to a special event and needed to really perfect my makeup, I might have struggled as well, but I wasn't doing much makeup since I was on vacation and tend to just do the basic foundation, eyeshadow, and mascara when I'm on vacation, so it wasn't a big deal. We didn't eat at the hotel, so I can't speak to the food there. We had breakfast at the Tim Horton's across the street the morning we had to leave for our cruise. For dinner, we went to a restaurant that the concierge recommended down near the water. This hotel was in a decent location. We walked down to the pier and walked around for a while. You could see a lot of the work being done for the Olympics all around the city. You could walk to the pier if you're taking a cruise and IF you know that your ship is going out of the nearby pier. We sailed with Celebrity, and our dock most certainly was not within walking distance. We did have an issue with getting our transfer tags for our luggage at the hotel. The hotel claimed they didn't have our tags and tired calling Celebrity but said they got cut off. We tried dealing with this for a good 30-45 minutes with the hotel but got nowhere. They told us to go have dinner and they'd work on it when we were out. They weren't there when we returned after dinner, and we had to make several phone calls to the hotel and the cruise company to finally get them LATE that night. It was a big inconvenience, but luckily other people in our party were the ones taking care of things. I never found out who's fault it was, but there was a breakdown in communication here. We were very surprised when we were told that they wouldn't be mailed to us like in other cruises but that they would be waiting for us at the hotel. I mention this bit to help others out in case they're staying here prior to a cruise as well. Would I stay here again? Maybe. We weren't too concerned about our hotel and someone else picked this one in our party as our night before our cruise. I'd have to do more research if I were to return. I will say, I didn't hate this hotel, but I didn't love it either. If I were to stay here again, I'd request a higher floor because the noise was really bad and is the main reason this hotel only has 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...OK for a nite.”
Reviews.Author: traveljack1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Regency in downtown Vancouver for one night prior to an Alaskan cruise. The hotel was nice. The only downside was not really the hotels fault.. We took a bus from the airport to the hotel that took over an hour and then dropped us off on the little side street on the back side of the hotel. There was actually a door there with a phone to call the main bellman station to assist persons at that door with their luggage. That helped a lot since my sister and I had about 7 bags between us! The bellman came right away and put our luggage on a conveyor that took it too the main lobby area of the hotel! The room was typical with no real view, but we didnt expect one since we got the room for a steal on Hotwire. We were in a corner room on the fifth floor(519 I think) facing the air conditioning units and the backside of an office building. The front desk check-in was a little different, it was all electronic. We would not have had any human interaction at all at check in if my credit card had swiped correctly. There was staff there, but they let guests check themselves in and out at three sort of "kiosks". That was different, but I guess a little speedier if it gets busy. Anyway, not a bad nite and the bed was VERY comfy with fabulous European linens and sheets. I would return there and would recommend to others for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gregirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights after getting a great deal with Priceline. Hotel was in a great area with other luxury hotels nearby. Minutes front waterfront, 2 blocks from Robson Street (shopping area) and the subway was right downstairs. Room was spacious modern and clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. I would request a room in an upper floor just because it is on a busy downtown street. All in all great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Chill out balcony”
Reviews.Author: Supermercado
Reviews.Content: We stayed in what the hotel calls a “balcony view room”. The room was on the upper floors of the building (26), facing south for great sunsine and came with a huge balcony offering spectacular city views and comfortable seating. The room itself was awesome: large, comfortable with great design and thick carpet. I loved the wood and dark colors that brought a classy & zen touch to the room. The lobby of the hotel is hectic and confused and common areas do not offer any sense of luxury at all. But once in your room or on your balcony, this becomes a heaven of peace and you can really relax after a long day walking around this fabulous city. One downside: all balcony rooms are connecting rooms, which means they can be somewhat noisy at times depending on who is staying in the room next to you. The hotel has a weird ecological policy that allows them NOT to replace linen and even used towels every day unless you specifically call a special number and make arrangements with them. This is pure lie – this only saves them money and time on housekeeping. Why would they keep the balcony lights on all night (who needs light outside the room when you sleep?) if they really cared about environment and ecology? For me, this is a pure non-sense and nothing else than an attempt to rip clients off. Although this is a huge hotel with constant traffic in the lobby and in the lifts, service and front desk were top notch and staff really attentive to your needs. As a conclusion, minor problems and issues, some negative points (but all hotels have their donwsides), but highly recommended however, even for those who would not consider major hotel chains for their holiday. And make sure you book a balcony view room, these are the best ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: EurotravelerTO
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate of $153 CAD with Breakfast on the Hyatt site with the AAA discount. The hotel was as advertised, and we were totally pleased. The recently refurbished room was great. We thought the "free" breakfast buffet was fantastic. Every time you went up it seemed like they had put out new stuff. The lobby could be a bit chaotic at times, but that's a big hotel in a big city. We arrived from Whistler on the Pacific Coach Bus which drops you right at the Hyatt. That's convenient. Vancouver is a great place NOT to have a car. We used room service for one dinner, and it was excellent. We did supply our own wine which was a great way to control the cost. Le Crocodile French restaurant which is a couple blocks away was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Guard your car”
Reviews.Author: 19Coldwell45
Reviews.Content: We traveled from Seattle for a day and night stay in Vancouver. We traveled in our son's car and parked it in the Hyatt's underground parking facility for $28/day. Our sightseeing after checking in wa the down town area. The hotel is right in the middle of all areas to view. The next morning, as we were preparing to leave, we were notified that our car had been broken into, the driver's window shattered and the interior ransacked. Calling the police, they would not even come out unless we lost over $5K or our pass ports. They said it happens all the time. The parking garage said they had no liability but did comp the $28. Hotel was of no help.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel - if you pay the right price!”
Reviews.Author: fsba20
Reviews.Content: we booked this on Hotwire and got a great deal, breakfast not included. The hotel is in a great location, right downtown. The rooms looked liked they had just been. We had originally booked 4 nights on Hotwire and asked about adding one more night at reception. The only way we could do this was to pay the full rack rate, they wanted $259 canadian which was nearly twice as much as we had paid on Hotwire, Needless to say we moved to another hotel for our last night. Would definately recommend the hotel but would also recommend you shop around on the price before booking it.

Reviews.Title: “One night only”
Reviews.Author: FrqTravlr
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here on the backside of our Alaskan cruise, The hotel is downtown within easy walking distance of the lamplight district and very close to the main shopping streets, I haven't stayed in a Hyatt for a number of years due to cost but we got a great AAA rate and with the exchange rate the room and taxes were around $150 each. The rooms very spacious and they have a rooftop pool which was awesome. It's not large but you have a great view of the surrounding area and there is a hot tub and enough room/chairs to relax poolside. We had the hotel arrange our transportation from the cruise terminal and to the airport which was helpfull. I would stay here again if traveling to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: freshLouisville
Reviews.Content: We got a great nonrefundable ($119 C) deal, and thought that the room was a super buy. Renovated recently with Asian decor, the room was large enough, well maintained, and sleek in design. The desk and conceirge were more helpful than most, although the person we spoke to did not know that the Mountaineer train bus service stopped at their hotel (which caused us a major problem). Great location as others have said.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location (and value if you book ahead)”
Reviews.Author: darksecret1
Reviews.Content: We're in vancouver often and I have to say the Hyatt so far is one of our favorite hotels. It's modern/contemporary. (none of that awful 'heavy furniture' that typical hotels have nor that cheesy bedspread with washed-out flowers on them. Very clean design (as a matter of fact, just clean in general). We paid 159 (not incl. tax) and got the Winter Special (which includes a complimentary movie of any choice on their list) with a deal for free breakfast for 2 buffet and it was very good. Cody provided wonderful customer service. (small note: don't do parking through the hotel, it'll cost you less to just do night parking by taking a white ticket in the underground, however if you want to take your car in and out throughout the day then hotel's your best bet) We love COAST, and now that it moved a block or so away from Hyatt (coincidence, but it was perfect). The restaurant is better than ever, and their new O-Lounge is all the buzz (dress to impress folks). I have no complaints (except for rain on one of the days). We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “standard Hyatt in the congested city”
Reviews.Author: IndianaTravelmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 quick night on way to Victoria after having spent an earlier part of our trip at the Westin Bayshore in Vancouver. Lobby was plain to drab. Staff were upbeat and pleasant. Rooms were newish,standard Hyatt rooms with very comfortable beds. Location is in very congested area(Fairmont is within site) that felt a little gritty to me(eg you have to use your room key for the elevator to take you up presumably as a security measure). Much preferred the location of the Westin but probably depends on what you have planned and if you are a "big city" person

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: 1234j
Reviews.Content: Check-In: For a Hyatt, I was a bit disappointed with check-in. We booked an ocean view room on the Club Floor (floor 29). When we got to our room, we were on the other side of the hotel, not facing the ocean. We went back to the reception and complained. After 4 rooms being available and not available on the club floor, we finally got an ocean view room, 2908. Rooms: The rooms were newly renovated and very clean. We had a king bed in our room, along with a cot bed that we got sent to our room. The beds were very comfy, and we had an HD TV (I think). The bathroom was very modern. We had everything you would expect from a Hyatt bathroom. However, I was disappointed with the shower. The water came out of a square piece of metal on the ceiling with holes in it. I also found that it took a while (aprox. 10 mins.) to get warm water. Another thing that bugged me was the low pressure of the water. Other than that, I thought the room was very clean and spacious. Club Lounge (Only Have Access if on Club Floor (Floor 29): The Club Lounge was pretty nice. It had free breakfast and snacks throughout the day. It also had an HD TV with a computer that had free internet access. The lounge was painted a tacky yellow colour which wasn't the nicest, but it didn't bother me that much. Service: Other than check-in, the staff were very friendly and helpful. The people who worked on the Club Floor/Lounge new all of the guest's names and we extremely helpful. The maids did an outstanding job to keep our room clean. Overall: I would highly recommend this hotel for any traveller, any age. I would've given it 5 stars, but I thought it was necessary to give it 4 because of the poor check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & Location”
Reviews.Author: TFtraveller
Reviews.Content: Excellent location within walking distance of cruise docks. Remember, downtown locations come complete with vagrants but we were not afraid. Public transportation to local sights was was near and easy. Shopping and many of the sights were "right there". Hotel was fairly elegant, pool was clean, staff was very helpful. Only downside was that queen beds weren't available and there was no fan in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Bad soundproofing. Take your own shampoo.”
Reviews.Author: zoejessica
Reviews.Content: Good location downtown from which to explore the city – we hadn't been to Vancouver before and found it an easy walk to all the areas we wanted to see – Stanley Park, Yaletown, the seawall. Taxis were easy to grab outside too. The rooms had very little outside noise, the only disturbances were a couple of sirens and seagulls. But our room had a connecting door through which we could hear absolutely everything in the adjoining room (luckily our neighbours limited themselves to recounting their life stories and telling off their teenage son, but it could have been so much worse). The bathrooms are tiny with the shower in the bath (yuck), and the toiletries smell of (sorry, there's no other way to describe it) of pee. \ Buffet breakfast was decent with good croissants but appalling coffee served by harassed staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - a touch expensive”
Reviews.Author: Dean1967
Reviews.Content: Second time staying here, got a 50% off the rate on a summer deal so made sense to come back. Hotel has been updated, long lines at the check in and concierge desks. overnight parking is almost thirty bucks a night. Great location just 2 blocks from Robson street. There is an IGA market just a couple blocks past Robson street which was nice as we could pick up some fruit and other groceries during our 5 day stay. Hotel restaurants were bit too pricey for family dining, but there were several restaurants nearby (Red Robin, White Spot, Earls, etc.). Pool was OK for kids, good to cool off after a long day of walking.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for 1st time Vancouver travelers”
Reviews.Author: traveln4
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for myself and two daughters. The room was available 4 hours early, was clean and perfectly located on the 23rd floor. The concierge desk was extremely helpful, thanks Cody! Check in was quick, parking conveniently located, bellman available at my 4AM checkout. This was our first time in Vancouver and saw many hotels during our 4 night stay, wouldn't choose anything else but the Hyatt. Some nearby neighborhoods a little scary, many popular hotels located in these neighborhoods. Hyatt was located in a safe, well lit area with most local attractions within walking distance. If this is your 1st time, take the tour bus. This was the best 35.00 (2 days)I spent. Buses are readily available, drivers knowledgeable, and best of all you don't have to worry about parking which can be very hard to do in Vancouver. We had a great time and will return to the Hyatt again. Also, McDonald's and Tim Horton's (sandwhiches) are right next door and opened 24 hours!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but a little dark”
Reviews.Author: Janhome7
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, clean, and comfortable. All the staff were friendly and helpful. The location is great and is on the route for all the tour busses. The only problems with the hotel were that the two-bed rooms only had Double size beds. It would have been nice to have Queen. The room did not have much lighting in the hallway and the closet area. And finally, for the cost of the rooms, they nickle and dime you for ammenities. Although you can print out airline tickets free of charge, there is a charge for internet use in the Business Center and no breakfast is provided unless you pay extra for an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and clean room”
Reviews.Author: duchoa2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 2 nights, had a great deal through priceline.com. However, since we booked through priceline, they gave us 2 full-size beds and wanted to charged extra when switching to a king-size bed. Convenient location to walk to Robson St, Gastown, and the water front. Our room had a good view of Canada Place. Clean room with LCD TV. Fee for internet access. Front desk staff was unfriendly. We had a rental car and the self parking fee was $28 from check-in time to 1pm the next day. It's a public garage which is shared with the mall. Later on, we learned that you can park there yourself, without telling the front desk, at a cost of $6 from 6pm to 6am. So if you're taking the car out for day trip and/or it's your last night, you'd be saving some $ that way. But you'll have to return the parking ticket to the front desk and make sure that they stop charging you for parking with your room. There are also some free parking from 9pm to 8am on the small street on the side of the hotel. But we don't know how safe it is to park outside.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and very central to everything!”
Reviews.Author: dss1953
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through priceline.com, and even though after reading the other July 2009 reviews, it seems we got ripped off with our $82/night price....we don't care because it was worth it! We had a king bedded room on the 25th floor, with views of the harbor and the mountains. The bed was delicious, the bathroom was large and the location was excellent. The concierge staff were super helpful. We were looking for a bar that would be showing the Inter Milan v Chelsea match, but because we didn't have a computer with us and didn't know the local sports stations, we needed their help. They were great! They called around to three or four pubs known to show every soccer game and even though none of the bars were showing the game (apparently it wasn't shown in Canada) the concierge staff were quick to offer us a computer in order to stream the game over the internet. (We denied, fearing the price for 2 hours on a hotel computer/broadband line would be too much!) Thank you for offering, though! The location is great. Only 2 blocks from Robson Street shopping, a short stroll to Gastown for drinks and a leisurely stroll to Stanley Park and its awesome aquarium. We got to see the month-old baby beluga! Who knew a baby whale could be so cute?! :-) We had ok Japanese food at Kamei Royale Japanese Restaurant and pretty good Indian food at Salam Bombay down the street from the Hyatt. Unfortunately, we only had a day and a half in Vancouver, so we didn't get to sample better food! Eating was the last thing we had on our minds and dinner was an afterthought! This hotel is perfect for anyone who needs a centrally located hotel in Vancouver! We'll be back...hopefully for more than a day and a half next time!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: Dave148
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a five night stay at the Hyatt. We scored a $75/night rate through Priceline. Check in took about a minute. Our recently refurbished room on the 17th floor was perfect for our needs. Due to allergies, we requested the bedding to be changed to hypoallergenic. Housekeeping arrived within 10 minutes. Easy transport options just outside the hotel. The Burrard Skytrain stop is across the street . Several bus routes stop in front of the hotel on Burrard. The concierge was very helpful. Plenty of shopping options nearby. A downside is that the pool is only 4'9" deep the entire length. The Jacuzzi is a bit on the smallish side. Not a huge pool area, but pleasant. No free internet in the business center. A great hotel at an especially good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Anyone”
Reviews.Author: Moxsd
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt was a great hotel for a 3 night visit to Vancouver. The hotel itself is well located, extremely clean and just renovated apparently. Location, this aspect cant be beat its right near Robson street and I walked to Stanley park, the aquarium and gas town. I almost missed gastown and am glad I didn't! I highly recommend checking out gas town for some shopping and a drink. Rooms, the rooms are extremely nice and much better than most Hyatt's I have been to. The flat screen, work desk, new beds and bathroom make it beyond comfortable and a great place to relax. The shower is a "rain" shower that comes straight down from the ceiling which was really cool. The lobby bar was actually pretty well priced for beer and was a nice place after a day of walking. The beers are 6.25 of course food and your scotch is really really expensive like any other hotel. The hotel also offers free cabs to the casino, just ask the bell desk it saved us a few bucks and was a nice added bonus for us spending money at the casino which is small but a lot of fun for a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Room, So So Service”
Reviews.Author: ArvinLee
Reviews.Content: Since my family has accumulated good amount of GP points (my family is a diamond member, and i am listed as a full sharer) , I decided to redeem the points at Hyatt Regency Vancouver for 11 nights (9th July - 20th July) Likes : 1. Room: - Nice, minimalist, big, with balcony. - View : amazing, Stanley park, North Shore etc - Great Pillows - Quality Amenities 2. Noteworthy Staffs: - Emily Yuan (Regency Club Concierge) and Kristen :both very helpful and friendly. 3. Locations: Right on Burrard and Georgia. which provides great access to shopping, food, and public transportation. 4. Regency Club: great view, delicious food Dislikes 1. Check in : the receptionist wasn't friendly (Vicky), was actually a bit rude (Not a Hyatt standard), but after 18hours flight i didnt feel like arguing. 2. Room: - No Stationery : envelopes, etc was missing - No Spoons, wine opener etc (i think those items are standard) - I could hear the next room was talking 3. An incident which gave me a rude awakening : 2:30 AM : i heard someone was trying to open my room, so i decided to look thru the peep hole and saw a couple outside. and when i told them that it's my room, and i've stayed there for a week, they showed me their keys which said 2907 (my room). Manager on duty (Maria) apparently gave my room to someone else. (after i checked with her that night, her excuse was a hiccup in the system). i have double checked with her colleague (Kristen) and a lady at Regency Club concierge day a day before about my booking, and both confirmed my stay till the 20th. This raised a concern, if this happened during the day time when i wasnt in the room, someone could have entered my room. 4. SOME of the staffs (bell boy, door men) - I was carrying lots of stuffs, none offered to open the door nor help in carrying the goods up into my room. 5. Lobby is in need on renovation. very cramped, and outdated. Overall it's a nice hotel, but there are lots of room for improvements

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and a very good brunch”
Reviews.Author: ltleeds1
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a very nice hotel but perhaps a bit expensive. The rooms were large and very clean with a modern touch. Sunday brunch was very good with a wide selection of items all freshly made. Come with an empty stomach!!! The cost was $25 pp CAD. Unfortunately at check out they billed us twice forcing me to correct the issue at the front desk at check out.

Reviews.Title: “Walk to Everything”
Reviews.Author: ParrotheadMN
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay the Hyatt. It was booked through Priceline for $70/night. The room was always clean up to Hyatt standards, it had an excellent bed. The location is the hotel is perfect to walking the major attractions of Vancouver. Also - kudos to Eric the conceirge - he was extremely helpful in helping us find some nightlife (that suited our taste/age range) as well as provide directions..... We also used the pool - it was small which is understandable due to the downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: kbakshi
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hyatt Regency Vancouver was excellent. The hotel's location was perfect - walking distance to many of the major tourist destinations in Vancouver. The front desk personnel sent us champagne and chocolate strawberries after hearing it was our 10th anniversary. The hotel staff was very kind and helpful in all possible ways. The room was nice and the beds very comfortable. We asked for a higher floor, since the hotel is located right in the downtown area and the street noise might be a problem. I would highly recommend this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable beds, near to Robson Street,”
Reviews.Author: fmc208
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Hyatt Regency. The beds were extremely comfortable especially after two weeks in London and France. The hotel staff were efficient and friendly. We managed to get a late check out until 1.30 which was appreciated. This hotel is very near Robson Street so if you like shopping it is perfect. The breakfast and lunches at the Blue Horizon on Robson Street are especially good. We booked thru expedia.co. and the booking was in order. This hotel was a stopover from London to Auckland.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for Cruise Passengers”
Reviews.Author: GlitterTucson
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days in Vancouver prior to our Alaskan Cruise. This hotel is in the best part of the downtown area, has an efficient and courteous staff, is upscale in decor and ammenities, has a coffee/pastry/fruit bar and a gourmet on-site restaurant. It is a short distance to Stanley Park, within walking distance to the cruise ship terminal, fabulous restaurants and shopping (from designer to everyday). We travel on the light side, so just rolled our luggage down the street to the terminal on our scheduled departure date. You could also get a cab to the terminal and since it is so close, will probably cost you less than $20. The hotel does does not have a courtesy shuttle from the airport, but cab fare will only cost you about $25. We stayed here two nights and booked our reservation through one of the on-line discount hotel websites. Prices are relatively high in Vancouver for any place nice and in a good location and we got a reasonable deal at about $150. The next day, we rented a car from Enterprise which has a downtown office conveniently located to the hotel (they provide pickup from the hotel). The weather was so nice and the downtown area so clean and vibrant, that we just walked the few blocks to the rental office. We drove the "Sea to Sky" highway to Whistler. It is very scenic and an easy drive despite areas of construction for the 2010 Olympics. This was a delightful day trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: twoshirts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt twice, once for 5 nights, and then another night a week later. Both booked via Priceline at $75 and $80 - amazing value. The location of the hotel was great, right next to Skyrail, lots of busses and a couple of blocks from shopping. I was surprised that downtown Vancouver around the hotel is riddled with more beggers and panhandlers than any other major city I have visited - it get irritating very quickly. The rooms were slick and plush with very comfortable beds and other furniture. It is worth skipping the self check-in screens and asking for a higher room. Our first room on level 6 had only a view of the pool, the second on level 30 had a fabulous view across the city - you just have to ask. The pool area was disappointing for a hotel of this class. There is only an outdoor pool that was cold even in summer and a small outdoor hot tub. Breakfast buffet at $25 was disappointing. The egg station was not manned and the overall selection was below par. We only ate there once, but didn't really find anywhere good for breakfast in the area - particularly at the weekend when most of the business cafes are closed. If you want to splash on a great breakfast, try the Pan Pacific at Canada Place.

Reviews.Title: “Free Breakfast ...Not. I know how you feel but nothing we can do.....”
Reviews.Author: cleaningbee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. It is comfortable with a great view. It is a walking distance to China town, Art museum, Gas town and 7 minutes drive to the cruise ship port. The check in staff in the other hand was very strange. I am a member of Hyatt Gold card so I receive emails promoting CHEAP rates very often. One of their promotion was $119/night at Vancouver Hyatt including breakfast for two adults. We called up to make a reservation for 4 rooms. The travel agent did not know about the promotion; he checked with his manager and the deal was I had to pay for 4 rooms right away, they would charge my credit card as soon as finished my reservation and the reservation was not cancelable. That was fine. The agent ensured me that it included breakfast for 2 adults per room. The confirmation email came and it did not mention the breakfast. I called and they said "Oh we did not put it in the email but it includes breakfast buffet for two". When we checked in the clerk said "yes madame it includes breakfast for 2 for each room. We try to be a paperless company so you do not need a breakfast coupon" so sweetly. Later we received a note printed on a piece of PAPER "Dear Mr. S Our manager on duty looked up your reservation. Unfortunately your room does not include breakfast..... If you have any questions, please contact our manager on duty at 4777. Best Regards, Midori" We talked to Tsukasa and he whispered to us like we committed a crime since our rate was soooo low "shh...your rate is TRAVEL ZOO rate and it is just $119. It was a good rate. ". I did not know that I booked through Travel Zoo. The email was from Hyatt, I called Hyatt 800 number and Travel Zoo never was mentioned in our conversations. We talked to a manager on duty and she was computerized: "for i<1000 times say 'I know how you feel but nothing we can do' " This is a very strange experience. Polite but nothing we can do.....

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: MegW
Reviews.Content: We arrived late Saturday evening and were upgraded on arrival with a view over the Fairmont Hotel (much better than our usual car park view we always seem to get everywhere!) Staff helpful and friendly. We were on the club floor which provided complimentary continental breakfast - cold/hot drinks, croissants/pastries, toast/bagels, smoked salmon/cream cheese and cereals. Also every evening there was complimentary snacks and of course there was the free internet available. Good location, near to Robson Street, next to Skyrail and 10 mins walk from the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Downtown Location!”
Reviews.Author: JP_Phx
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance directly between Robson St (shopping and dining) and Canada Place and the convention center and seawall (Vancouver scenery at it's finest). We stayed for a week at a Priceline cost of $82 US/day and the parking at the hotel $28/day seemed exhorbitant but well worth it as we loved having a car handy. Didn't want to pay for internet and enjoyed having the break from a computer! Room was nicely appointed and well maintained, instant hot water, small gym, lots of nearby places to eat, McDonalds and Tim Horton's right next door. Beds were comfortable and the room was quiet, if not for the connecting door. On Burrard, we ate at Cactus Club Cafe (across the street for upbeat, contemporary food) Imperial Chinese Restaurant (expensive dim sum) and Elephant Bar and Pub (fun, pub atmosphere and good fish and chips) On Robson you'll find the best outdoor shopping. We ate at Hon's House of Noodles (best Cantonese food we had - cheap and delicious, watch the waitress use an iPhone or something to place orders!) Tropika (SE Asian food, restaurant is much nicer than the street entrance portrays) Tsunami Sushi (decent immediate sushi fix from revolving boat conveyor belt) Make sure you visit Granville Island Public Market and eat the best croissants ever at the bakery, and Capilano/Grouse Mtn. area for a great getaway from city life!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service!”
Reviews.Author: Tomatinho
Reviews.Content: This hotels excels in service, and its location is unbeatable: beside the skytrain station, close to Robson St and a few blocks from the pier. Rooms are comfy. Breakfast is great. There are probably newer hotels in town, but I would definitely return to this hotel if I visit Vancouver again. I definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MFrito
Reviews.Content: We booked on priceline for about $110 and this hotel exceeded our expectations. We got a corner room that was huge and beautifully decorated. The location was excellent for exploring the city. You can not go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not the best service”
Reviews.Author: laalaa888
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice inside. Our room was large and updated with large floor to ceiling windows that showcased the city view. The hotel as a couple blocks from Robson Street as well as Canada Place. Close to Pacific Centre, Chanel, Louis Vuitton, Coach, etc.. It is next door the Skytrain which was very convenient for us as driving was madness during Canada Day. When we checked in the first hotel clerk was very nice and helpful. However after that the service was downhill. We got locked out of our room and the staff were not helpful at all. It was a runaround to find a person to open it. We waited in a line and the desk clerk brushed us aside to help someone else that was from the same country she was!! We ended up just walking away and leaving it for a later time. Oh and you have to pay $14.95 a day for their internet service. Parking for two days was $40.00 and was located right next door to the hotel. It is shared with the Royal Centre. I found a lot of people in this area to be quite rude. As we drove in on Hastings Street I was alarmed with the area and all the homeless people on the street. It get better however as you go further in downtown. Beware of the homeless downtown even in the nicer areas as one tried to steal my husbands hat and tried to pick a fight with him for no apparent reason.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room and bath with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Misslinda68
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself were only in Vancouver for 2 nights after our Alaska cruise and found this hotel to be lovely. The check in and bell service were very efficient and prompt. The concierge was extremely helpful since we wanted to pack as much in 2 days as possible. Our room on 32nd floor was large, clean and very modern in design. The bathroom was large compared to many large hotels. The downside was the price we paid. I guess it is my fault that we paid $150. US dollars a night. I learned from friends, they stayed at the same time and only paid $55. It still is a great hotel and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: ggerson
Reviews.Content: This is a first rate hotel in an excellent location. Prior to arrival I was contacted by the concierge who arranged our tours and restaurant reservations before our arrival. When we arrived all our reservations were ready. I had requested a low floor because my wife does not like riding in elevators. But it turned out that the street noise made it tough to sleep the first night so the next morning I requested a room change and was moved to the 28th floor. No noise there. The location is excellent. Just a couple of blocks to Robson Street and a couple of blocks to the water. Tour bosses stop right at the hotel. The sky train (which will soon take you to the airport), is a block away. They have a nice bar with piano music. Everyone on the staff we met was super nice. The rooms were very nice, large, and the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location...nicely remodeled”
Reviews.Author: babygoldfish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hyatt for a couple nights while we were on a road trip. Compared to other Hyatts I have stayed at, this one was very nice, modern and updated...they had just recently remodeled the hotel. Beautiful city views and very convenient location...we were able to walk to many different restaurants and retail stores. There was ample parking available, but you did have to pay. We did really enjoy our stay, but felt there was nothing really special about this hotel, just a nice basic 4 star, so the next time we stay in Vancouver we would probably try out another hotel. However, if you are able to get a great deal on this hotel I would definitely recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Canadian weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: The_Zhukamotos
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at the Vancouver Hyatt through priceline.com for $90 US (but I have a feeling you can get it for cheaper) and were pleasantly surprised by the nice, modern accommodations. The standard room was large, clean, recently renovated, and with nice amenities- large comfy bed, flat screen tv, neat shower. The hotel was centrally located in downtown, perfectly situated for access to shopping and restaurants, and within walking distance from Stanley Park. We found the computerized check in and check out to be very efficient and the front desk staff to be very attentive. Additionally, the concierge was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. For parking, we found the overnight parking in the Chinese-owned (?) parking lot right beneath the hotel itself. For overnight parking on a Friday night + Saturday parking until 6pm, the parking bill came out to only $10.70 US- significantly cheaper than hotel parking, and just as convenient. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and a stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamsandwich101
Reviews.Content: Our three-night stay at the Hyatt came at a good value through Priceline. We're extremely happy with what we received for the price we paid: an absolutely lovely room and a hotel with unerringly helpful and friendly staff. First, the room. Maybe we've been staying in the wrong places, but the decor in the room we received was far more style-forward and modern than any hotel we've visited in recent memory. We were very impressed, especially when comparing the rate we paid for a passable small-town motel room the night before. Location is excellent, on Burrard just a couple of blocks away from Robson and basically sitting directly on top of Burrard SkyTrain station. Stanley Park is also a fairly easy walk. The staff created an excellent first impression. From the woman who assisted in checking us in to the bell staff, everyone jumped to serve us -- whether they were likely to receive a tip or not. This attitude continued throughout our stay. Indeed, the check-in lady advised us -- very kindly -- to pay for parking directly with the garage, since we weren't planning on using the car on our three nights (and therefore didn't need in-out privileges) as it would save us money. In the end we paid $60 for the three nights of parking -- two of them weekend nights -- versus the $84 it would have cost at the hotel's $28-a-night rate. Which really brings up the hotel's main shortcoming: value. For a discount rate, it's a no-brainer. But like many higher-end hotels, you'll be nickeled and dimed on incidentals. Parking, as mentioned is $28 a night. A lot, but I've seen worse ($35US a night for self-parking in downtown Seattle, for one). High-speed Internet runs $15 a night. After asking about the business centre and later hearing someone else ask a different concierge person, there may or may not be charges for it, and if there are they're pretty astronomical. Crazy hotel rates for direct-dial long distance ($12 for a two-minute call within Canada). At the rate we paid, these were no big deal. And I suppose for the type of person who routinely seeks out four-star accommodation at full rates, they're just a drop in the bucket. But there are obviously other quality hotels around the downtown area that advertise better rates and get similar accolades on this site. I wouldn't try to dissuade anyone from using this hotel. I'm a big fan... but if bang for the buck is the largest concern, there may be more bang elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best locations in Vancouver, but some of the staff are very rude”
Reviews.Author: Westinhan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located near all the shops and everything. It is even close to the bay. One of the staff was very rude when I asked him something and when I said I was going to complain about his bad attitude and walked away, I looked back and saw that he was glaring at me. We only had carry-ons, so we could have just taken our bags up to the rooms ourselves. But we gave them to the bell staff, who were very old, and they never brought them up! When I called to ask about the bags (30 minutes later), they were promptly brought up by a younger bellboy. There was a cheap cafe on the second floor and an average bar on the ground level. I was not impressed by the facilities at all. The food served at the reception for our conference was not very good at all and ran out faster than receptions at other hotels. The mixed drinks sucked. The rooms were alright. I shall say no more about them. I could not believe this was a Hyatt Regency. I thought it was a Hilton. The hotel looks and acts like an airport Hilton. No worse! Much worse! In fact, there are some very good airport Hiltons now so I would rate this hotel even lower. SUMMARY: I could give this hotel another try since I read here that there was a renovation in late 2008 (after my stay). But I really think management needs to train the staff better. Three and a half stars.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury, excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: TrueSingaporean
Reviews.Content: Our family has had a great stay at the Hyatt Club Floor. From the moment we arrived to the minute we departed, the service was just so efficient and hospitable. The room was really really spacious, clean and new, even after adding a rollaway. We had free internet service and good spread of refreshment at the club room throughout the day and evening. The club concierge gave very good advice on tours and eateries. Right in the smack of shopping belt and eateries like Orchard Road. It is inexpensive compared to other similar class hotels (most hotels in vancouver are expensive anyway), and the overall experience is really comfortable and enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: Laraine8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night pre-cruise. We were upgraded to a suite upon check-in and I only wish I knew people in Vancouver, becasue I could have thrown an amazing party in that suite! Floor to ceiling windows overlooking the waterfront with 2 bathrooms and a wetbar. We had room service breakfast to take advantage of the view and almost did not want to leae for our cruise! The location of the hotel is ideal; within walking distance to a variety of sights and restaurants. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. I can't wait to return to Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Recommend This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AverageAmy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights for a meeting, followed by some sightseeing. Given the opportunity, I would definitely go back and would refer the hotel to friends. Rooms: The rooms were gorgeous. We attend a technical meeting twice a year with the same group of people in various cities. However, this time people immediately started talking about how wonderful the rooms were. The rooms have lots of space, are nicely appointed, and have a great working area. Service: The hotel personnel at all levels were very helpful and service oriented. I can’t remember the last time the staff at a hotel were so impressive. From the hotel restaurant and bar, to the cleaning staff, to the front desk – all were willing to help even when it didn’t immediately translate into a tip. We were very comfortable there. At one point, I noticed that there was a card in the room where you could make requests to the cleaning staff. I was in a bind, and decided to try asking my request on the card, not expecting much. However, I was pleasantly surprised at the response – they took care of everything, freeing me to take care of my business. Price: The price was reasonable for the amenities received. Fitness Center: Hyatt’s StayFit gym is convenient and guests can use it at no additional charge. I love the fact that it’s open 24 hours. It’s not enormous, but has all the components I look for in a gym – cardio machines, strength machines, weights, and resistance tubes.
