The only thing that would have made it better was if there was a tiny bit more room to do some floor work, like pushups, stretches, and lunges. Location: Great access to downtown, restaurants, and Stanley Park with some walking (which we were into) and golf by public transportation. Be sure to allow plenty of time at the airport (at least 2.5 hours before your flight) if flying back to the US.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Remodel on this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aybc
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. The entire hotel was closed and remodeled in late 2008. It is a whole new hotel. Beautiful public and guest rooms. Modern design, great bed, friendly hotel staff. This is now my hotel in Vancouver. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and modern - great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: everyshadeofblue
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights over a 4 day period during a vacation to Vancouver/Whistler. The first two nights were $67 a night on Priceline and the third night was $99 on Priceline. This hotel was an incredible deal! The location is ideal and is located close to everything in downtown Vancouver. Easy walk to the Gastown area, Canada Place, and the swanky, upscale Coal Harbor area. This hotel isn't much to look at from the outside but inside everything has been recently remodeled. I loved the updated rooms and appreciate the modern, minimalist design with lots of blacks and whites. Everything was simple and stylish but of course this is a matter of opinion. Bed was comfortable and the bathroom was very nice with nice black/white walls and black granite counters. One of the rooms had the rainfall showerhead which was fine but a bit gimmicky. The other room had a more traditional showerhead which I slightly preferred. The rainfall showerhead is a neat idea. The bathroom mirror was my favorite with a fog-free circle in the middle surrounded by a light. Extremely classy! The only thing the bathroom could have used was a makeup mirror. I had rented a car in Seattle and drove up. Thanks to other reviewers on here I was aware of the famous Chinese parking garage located a short distance from the hotel. Here are the directions again: Go south of the hotel on Burrard and just after you pass Alberni, but before Robson you'll see a small alley. There's a parking garage with chinese lettering on the top of the sign. Instead of paying $28CAD a night at the hotel I walked a short distance and only paid $13.50 here. The people working at this garage are the NICEST people and were so friendly. I happily gave them my money and would rather support them than the Hyatt's parking. Internet - The Hyatt charge a lot but you should also see a wireless service available called "Guest Internet Access" which is much cheaper. I paid $16 for 2 days rather than the Hyatt's $16 a day. If you are on a lower floor you'll get a better signal from Guest Internet Access. I was on the 22nd floor the first time and it was spotty one morning. On the 14th floor during my second visit it was much stronger. I didn't like the self check-in because I wanted a higher floor. Despite booking on priceline, they accommodated requests and were VERY friendly! They even offered to go to the room with us to make sure the key works. Talk about service! I couldn't have been more pleased with this hotel. Excellent service, clean, friendly, modern, and a great location. The gym was very good and the pool area was fine for a city hotel. Unbelievable deals available on priceline. Vancouver has a lot of vagrants and homeless looking people but they weren't too aggressive but they did become annoying. While in town check out Stanley Park and the Capilano suspension bridge, both excellent. If you want a very classy lounge/restaurant, try Lift near the Westin Hotel in Coal Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “What more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: doublebzz
Reviews.Content: Oversized, recently renovated rooms, quality toiletries, perfect location and a staff that goes out of the way to please. The valet who got us a cab on departure and loaded our heavy suitcases into the trunk refused a tip. All for a Priceline rate of $65 a night.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tackle
Reviews.Content: Check in: a little annoying since they try to get you to use the automated system rather than checking you in in person. If they want you to use an automated system, they should be like airplanes and let you choose your room from a room map. Rooms: large clean, and well furnished. VERY comfortable bed. Nice recently renovated bathroom. Modern clean and relatively new furniture. Excellent bath products. OK towels. nice flat screen TV. Internet: fast and efficient but a little pricey at $14.00 CAD per day. Free wireless internet in the lobby. Concierge: very friendly and helpful, with lots of good suggestions. Pool and Gym: small but nice pool and deck, excellent health club for a hotel. Location: Superb. A few blocks from the water front. Close to shopping and restaurants on Robson Street. Very safe.

Reviews.Title: “A very modern, quality hotel.”
Reviews.Author: stubbs1970
Reviews.Content: Physically, this is one of the nicest, best kept hotels we have experienced in quite a while. Service was pretty good from most of the staff. Housekeeping was a little uneven. Like the reviewer earlier, we hated the self service check in. Hyatt, put that kiosk behind a counter and let one of your front desk personnel go through all of the hassle of making sure my reservation is correct! While we were fighting our way through your system, there were Hyatt employees at the Concierge desk who were just chatting with each other rather than helping someone. Bell service could not have been better. And the loaner umbrella that they leave in the room is a great touch. The only serious problem is the restaurant. The food is only okay. The service in the restaurant is a little below average. In spite of the fact that the restaurant thus grades out below average, it is hugely expensive. Had dinner there one night, which was pricey but pretty good. It was a worthwhile choice because it was so very convenient. However, also had breakfast there once, which turned out to be a huge mistake. $25 breakfast buffet that would have been only average, at best, even if it had been eight dollars cheaper. Did not eat lunch there at any time, frankly because we could find lots of less expensive, convenient options. Finally, what is it with Vancouver restaurants that you need to wait an age for the bill? We had that problem everywhere. We are resigned to having Hyatt charge us for high speed Internet. That does not mean that we have to like it. On the plus side, they have new fitness equipment. The variety is limited, and the fitness facility is rather small. This is still workable if you go early or very late, and the fitness center is open 24 hours. We did get a decent rate at the Hyatt, and the location is very convenient. We would stay here again, and grit our teeth when seeing the Internet charges on the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, did not like the self service check in.”
Reviews.Author: Wereldreizigster
Reviews.Content: Find it weird that in this nice hotel they try to let the guest check them in themselves. It is very unpersonal to me. The room we had was big, clean and we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is very centrally located, for shopping you just walk outside and there you go! We have not had dinner in the hotel because we had made reservations outside of the hotel. Nice about the location of the hotel is that we could walk to the restaurants..one restaurant was a bit out of the way but about that one later more :-)

Reviews.Title: “Comfy with a View”
Reviews.Author: Debimlee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week. Saw it had some unfavorable reviews, but this place was great. The first night we had some Pep Rally going on next door, but that was solved with one phone call. The beds are the most comfortable I have ever slept on in a hotel. The view was great, right above the pool and hot tub and beyond to skyscrapers and mountains. The housekeeping staff, actually ALL the staff, were great, couldn't ask for better. Bathrooms have cool mirror/lighting as do the headboards (backlighting). Location was great with everything you could want close by. There is a small fridge, but it's filled with mini bar stuff. No mircrowave. The Hyatt is also a stop for the Trolley. Just one note. Parking your car here is $28.00 CAD per night. No way around it. Also, if you want to hook into thier Wireless Internet, be prepared to pay $15.00 a day for it.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Librasrock
Reviews.Content: We had the executive two story suite - beautiful room but not worth the price we paid. When we arrived in the room there was not water apparently the whole floor had no water.....when the water was turned on it was black - horrid experience that was. A few hours into the evening there was a knock on our door - our toilet was leaking into the suite below us and had to be replaced. The service was very poor. We will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: CAScreamin
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here last week. The service was fantastic and the location exceptional. The hotel is very close to shopping and restaurants. You can literally go down the escalator and you're in a food court with some shopping. Better options are just outside the door, though. Wireless internet was available for about $15 a day. Good coverage throughout the hotel, and it beat paying roaming charges on my iPhone. Local phone calls are a $1. The hotel offers complimentary printing of boarding passes in the Business Center. Room service was reliable and adequate. I especially enjoyed the jazz club, O'Doul's, located on Robson Street. It is within walking distance. Another great option is to take a bike ride ride around Stanley Park. I rented from Spokes on West Georgia Street. The rental was only around $9. If you visit Vancouver and the weather is even okay, take this bike ride all the way around Stanley Park. You will not be disappointed! It is THE most spectacular bike ride I've ever been on. The ocean views are spectacular! I also visited Canada Place (within walking distance) and saw the IMAX movie there. Impressive 3D films! I also visited the aquarium located in Stanley Park. It was nicely done. Vancouver is very family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend getaway at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: TravelLib
Reviews.Content: We recently took the train up to Vancouver, just to get away for a bit. Booked a room at the Hyatt and received outstanding service, even before we arrived. Opting to use SkyTrain to get into downtown, we were delighted to find that the hotel is just across the street from the Burrard Station. The room was lovely. I do like the Hyatt beds, though hubby thinks that they're a bit too firm. The hotel is amazingly quiet, which makes staying there again very probable. Econcierge made reservations for us at our favorite restaurant and even arranged for me to have a facial at the spa next door. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “A solid performer”
Reviews.Author: 2traveltheworld
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Vancouver was a solid 4 star hotel. The deluxe room was large in size and featured a balcony - a lucky get, as it seems only corner rooms feature the balcony. Staff were friendly, and accommodated us as expected. My only complaint would be the shower. In an effort to do something different, they have designed the shower head out of the roof of the shower. It's ineffective, lacks water pressure and takes twice as long to shower. Aside from that, the rest of the room features, design and comfort levels were good.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay in a Year via Priceline”
Reviews.Author: Velvalee
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how we managed to get this hotel at $65/night on Valentine's/President's Day weekend, but it made our decision to go away for the weekend a snap! We stayed at this same property last winter via Priceline, although I can't recall the rate we got then, and we enjoyed both our stays immensely. First of all, the location is just perfect...walking distance to everything you want to do downtown and across the street from the Sky Train if you want to wander afield. There are countless restaurants, pubs, cafes, markets, shops nearby for anything you could possibly need within a short walking distance. The service we got from the staff was absolutely top-notch, even though the hotel was crowded to bursting for the long weekend. Check-in went very smoothly, as did check-out. Everyone was friendly and professional and efficient. Our only hitch was the parking--as stated in other reviews, it's $38CN to valet with the hotel, $28CN to "self-park" with a hotel "pass", and, in our case, cheaper than that to just pay the garage meter directly. We checked the car into the garage on Saturday afternoon at around 4pm, then out again on Sunday afternoon, and the fee was $10.50CN. We checked back into the garage on Sunday evening around 7pm, where the car remained until we left at noon on Tuesday. The 2nd time, the fee was $45. That's a total of $55CN, and the hotel would have charged us 3 full days at $28/CNday, or $84CN total. Now, the price may vary if you are checking your car in and out several times per day, but we only used our car one day, to drive up to Whistler. So my advice is to check out the rates carefully, know what your plans are with your car, and pay accordingly. Also, using the hotel "pass" is a pain, because you have to buzz an attendant upon entering (or is it exiting?) and wait for him to validate. We never could make that system work, so ended up canceling the parking pass with Hyatt and just paying the garage directly, which as I explained above, was significantly cheaper anyway. The rooms are enormous...we ended up with a double double on the 23rd floor, facing Burrard--great city views with peek-a-boo glimpses of mountains and water. The rooms are extremely comfortable, decorated in neutral tones of gray, black, white, and brown, but the beds are great--nice crisp linens, down comforters and pillows, with extras in the closet. Amenities included a good-sized room safe, huge closet with lots of hangers, an ironing board and iron (full size), a folding suitcase stand, which fits easily in the back of the closet to get your empty suitcase out of the way, and a loaner umbrella. The bathrooms are black marble, well-equipped with plenty of towels, etc. The toiletries are nicely scented and include shampoo, conditioner, bath soap, facial soap, body lotion, and a shower cap. The showers have the fun "rain" head, which sprays directly down onto you out of the ceiling. There is a full-size hair dryer in one of the cubbies, but there is no make-up mirror, and the lighting in the bathroom is fairly dim--this is my only complaint about the hotel room. The vanity is kind of deep, so it's hard to even lean in close to the mirror when trying to put on mascara! There is a double low-boy which has 4 good size drawers for unpacking--with the closet, you could unpack and live here easily for a week! There is a desk with lighting and extra built-in plugs for your electronics, as well as a surge protector, so we were able to plug in everything we needed without having to sacrifice a lamp, etc. The low boy includes a mounted flat screen TV above it, which we only used for about an hour, but it was great quality and convenient. Between the beds was a nightstand with 2 deep drawers to hold our books and incidentals, and a nice clock radio with an iPod docking station that we used to listen to music while in the room. There is only 1 reading lamp between the 2 beds, so if your partner likes it dim while you read, might want to bring your own booklight. There is a small "dry bar" in its own alcove, which has nice countertop space for the ice bucket and bottled water sold by the hotel. The coffee maker and supplies are there, as well, and beneath is the mini-bar fridge, which had room for us to stash our own water and drinks supply. We also had room on the counter for our own fruit and snacks, and there are some cubbies below to stash more goodies as well. As usual, the mini bar snacks are expensive, so if staying more than a night or two, go to one of the many local markets or convenience stores and stock up at much better prices. All in all, the room is really well laid out, with floor to ceiling windows across the whole room, so lots of natural light if you want it, and good heavy drapes if you don't. The air-conditioning/heater unit worked perfectly--we used both, since one sunny day, the room started to heat up a bit in the afternoon, and few chilly mornings, we cranked up the heat while we showered. We had drinks in the Mosaic bar one evening--nice views and friendly staff, if a bit soul-less, but it's a hotel bar, after all. We also had room-service on our last night, after a long day and evening out...it was nearly 10:30pm when we ordered, and the staff did not flinch. Our food arrived hot and promptly, and although yes, it was outrageously expensive ($17 CN for a hamburger and fries), the quality was VERY good--the meat patties were thick and lean-tasting, the veggies crisp and cold, the buns warm and toasted and the fries crisp and hot-- and we were, after all, paying for the convenience of eating in our pajamas late at night! I recommend their chocolate cake, by the way...it's heavenly! Our room was serviced every day without anyone banging on our door impatiently, even though one afternoon, we stayed in reading and relaxing until after 1pm. We were given extra toiletries, clean towels, and everything straightened up nicely each day. Everything seemed very clean and well-maintained. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and wouldn't hesitate to stay again, although, since we always priceline our hotels, we don't normally get to pick them. I'm encouraged, however, that we've won the Hyatt twice now, as it is quickly becoming our favorite place to stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Beautiful view, Clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cali54
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance to prime shopping (Louis Vuitton, Tiffany, Gucci) and two blocks away on Robson street holds major brands ( Banana Republic, BCBG Maxaria, Gap, etc) to cute little boutiques. Great restaurants and coffee houses are all within walking distance, and English Bay Beach is also just a 15-20 minute walk from the hotel. The skytrain is only steps away from the hyatt so you wouldn't really need a car to get around. We rented a car knowing parking was $28 CAD/night at the Hyatt. Taking another reviewers suggestion, we parked at the Chinese-owned parking structure between Alberni and Robson for $12 CAD/day (the rates vary). We took the car to Granville Island and Capilano Suspension Bridge which was more convenient that public transportation, but you could easily get there using Skytrain or by cab. The hotel was nice and clean. You can tell it is a little old and was recently renovated. The rooms look exactly as it does in the picture. I absolutely loved the rainfall showerhead, but I was disappointed to find my king size bed was actually two matresses pushed together and framed as a king size bed. I'm not sure if all rooms are like this but I know another reviewer also mentioned the same thing. When booking the hotel, make sure you request a non-smoking room if you don't smoke. It completely slipped my mind when making the reservation and we got stuck with a smoking room. We used the self check-in machines and the front desk lines were super long, and we didn't want to wait in line to switch rooms since we overhead others say the hotel was completely booked. All in all, we had a pleasant stay. I would definitely stay there again if I get a real king bed and a non-smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great!”
Reviews.Author: URDeAD747
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel for 5 great nights, the hotel is located in a great place .. just in the middle of downtown .. Robson St. is just 2 blocks away.. It's luxurious and quiet hotel .. with huge beds that immediately take you to your dreams! The service is really good, staff are smiling and willing to serve you all the time and room service serve really good food as well. I would stay there again if I had to go to Vancouver ..

Reviews.Title: “Great—just work with the downsides!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaPlanner
Reviews.Content: We booked a last-minute trip to Vancouver on Priceline for the New Year's holiday and ended up getting the Hyatt for 3 nights at $70 (US) per night! We'd read previous reviews complaining about the decor and, more important, internet and parking charges, so we were prepared. After doing some more pre-trip research, we learned about a few other parking options and decided not to take our computers. The hotel itself is extremely well located in downtown Vancouver. Robson is just a few blocks away, and you can walk to the SeaBus to North Vancouver (or take other public transportation anywhere else). If you can avoid taking a car, you'll be better off--in many ways, it's more of a hassle than anything else. We'd driven up there, though, and we really didn't want to pay the $28 per night (or more, for valet) parking charge in the hotel's lot. So we checked out a TripAdvisor tip about a parking garage nearby that was a lot cheaper. Here's the scoop again: Drive up (going south from the hotel) Burrard a short distance. Just after you pass Alberni, but before you get to Robson, you'll see a small alley on your right. Turn into the alley and you'll see an apparently Chinese-owned parking garage. We parked our car in this garage for 3 nights. Each night was different--I think the rates and times the attendant decided on depended on how many reserved spots he anticipated getting the next day and at what time. We arrived at the lot around 4 p.m. each day. The first night, we paid $12 (Canadian) to leave the car there until 11:30 a.m. the next day. The second night, it was $5 until 10:30 a.m.; the third, $5 until 9:00 a.m. So we paid a grand total of $22 Canadian for 3 nights of parking--much better than the $84 or more the Hyatt's lot would have cost us! This lot is just a couple of blocks from the hotel, so walking there is no problem. As for the hotel itself, we really liked it, especially at our fantastic rate. We thought the new decor was very nice, but I can understand how some people might find it dark. It's very Asian/Zen-like in feel--I've posted some photos. Interestingly, we discovered while looking for a phone book that the bottom drawers of both the nightstands and the dresser didn't open. Maybe it's a cultural thing? Anyway, it wasn't a problem. We had two double beds for 3 people; queens would have been nice, but the Hyatt isn't the only chain that uses doubles. Choosing doubles over queens for multiple-bed rooms seems to be a decision hotel chains make either to make the rooms look bigger or to save money. But queens are definitely more comfortable The rain shower was okay--we're used to the typical angle of showerheads, but it was fine. The flat-screen TV had lots and lots of channels--very nice! The TV makes a strange sound when you turn it on, sort of like a video game sound, but that was okay. We also had a nice view from our room (see photos). The only contact we had with the hotel staff was at check-in and check-out, and everything went fine. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt and would stay there again. Just park your car somewhere else or, better yet, don't bring it, and, if you can, avoid bringing your computer.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and extremely comfortable hotel in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: L0nd0ner22
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is a fantastic hotel, very conveniently located and with really nice bedrooms. The beds are blissfully comfortable, the bathrooms freshly and stylishly renovated, and the view spectacular. We checked in very early, at 11am, but our room was ready to go, and the service was helpful and polite from start to finish. There was a music system with an ipod dock on the bedside table which was a lovely thought, and the tv was a huge brand new plasma flat screen. I have no complaints at all and would stay there again in a heartbeat. In addition, the roof-top hot-tub is heaven on a freezing winter Vancouver night. The pool could benefit from having some sort of outdoor access to changing rooms, but that is a small quibble. Some of the incidental costs are a bit expensive, such as $15 per day for wifi, $28 per 24 hours for parking, and $5 for a bottle of water in the room, but these are easily avoided. The hotel is so convenient that you wont need a car (the skytrain is 5 seconds walk from the hotel), there are plenty of drugstores within a few blocks of the hotel to purchase all the water you could ever need, and if you're not spending on water or parking, the wifi cost isn't that bad!

Reviews.Title: “Best guest serviced Hotel in Vancouver with updated lux rooms”
Reviews.Author: advcardio
Reviews.Content: This is Vancouver's most modern hotel in the downtown area. Be prepared for a modern simple lux hotel room. Modern check-in style where the agent will come around the desk to hand the keys to you, this says style and welcome in many ways to the business client. Then will proceed to walk you over to the elevators and let you be on your way to the room. At check out, as they will go around the desk to hand over your account papers.**be prepared to pay a Destination Marketing Fee % of your daily room charge -only some Vancouver hotels charge this fee. The bed and linens were new and very comfortable. Even though our room was beside the elevators (which I try to avoid) we were not bothered by noise of the elevators or bellman putting out the papers in the morning. Prices for room service are higher than normal in Vancouver and the fact the hotel is in the business area you can find many choices for food right outside the hotel doors. Parking in under the hotel. This is more of a business hotel vs a cozy honeymoon accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have visited”
Reviews.Author: Nickypoo
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, stay here if you get a chance. Great food great views. Centrally located, handy for Sky Train and a 1/2 hour bus ride from YVR.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Emotions on the Hyatt Regency”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter99
Reviews.Content: Got an absolutely fabulous room rate of $105 CDN a night! I stayed at this hotel 35 years ago and remembered how special it felt so thought it would be the same experience. Wrong. The staff are awesome, absolutely no complaints there. What I really hated was the new Zen decor. Twenty million dollars spent in renovations and to me, it's ugly. Black, tan and white is not inviting, people. As a couple, we also disliked having a desk arrangement in the room, which left only one comfortable chair to sit in and no side table to set a drink on. I think the decorator was on an ego trip and thought little of the guest. That said, the bed (once you got all the pillows off) was very comfortable. Lovely duvets and pillows. We also found the hotel quite noisey due to thin partitioning and wide gaps in the doors. Our neighbours frisky antics woke us up in the middle of the night! You can't beat the location for downtown Vancouver. There are plenty of shops and restaurants within easy walking distance and not too many panhandlers close by. All in all it was a great stay, but again, I really hated the decor.

Reviews.Title: “We will be Back”
Reviews.Author: Trailblazer44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights and it was excellent from check in to check out..The front staff were really helpful and nice.. When we originally went up to our assigned room it was not a king that was booked on the their website but two doubles.When I went down to hopefully correct it (hotel was fully booked that weekend) they not only found a king but we also moved us up 8 floors.When staying here it is better to have a room higher since road noise can be heard on the lower floors facing West Georgia St.The room was a nice size and clean with a 32' LCD TV and endless hotwater.It is centrally located downtown and has a mall attached with a food court a floor below that.We ate at the food court a few times and the pizza at Flying Wedge was great...Tims is located on site and also a McDonalds as well.We had tickets to Robbin Willams and walked to the Queen Elizabeth Theatre about 8-10 minutes which is in desperate need of a major overhaul!!When returning to Vancouver we will book a room at the Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Very professional staff in a well serviced hotel”
Reviews.Author: game_misconduct
Reviews.Content: We had a one night weekday stay at the Hyatt and it was very good stay. Check in was incredibly efficient and friendly. We arrived before the 3 pm check in but they were able to put us in a room quickly. The room was booked via a third party website but they were able to accommodate our bed request. The furniture in the room was looking a little worn but everything was clean and the room was reasonably spacious. Beds were very comfortable. We were pleased with the stay at the Hyatt and wished we had stayed in the Hyatt instead of trying our luck at the Listel Hotel further west. The only reason we went to the Listel was because one of our group wanted to try the boutique atmosphere that was sold on the Listel website vs the standard corporate 4 star feel of the Hyatt. We wish we had stayed with the Hyatt after the disappointment of the Listel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has everything”
Reviews.Author: monarg
Reviews.Content: What a super hotel. The beds are super comfortable. The bathroom is super modern, the shower faucet comes straight down on top of you from the middle of the tub, this takes a little getting used to. The parking is expensive $28.00.if you want to save some money take the B-Line right down Granville Street to the Burrard Station, this will let you off right in front of the door to the hotel. Location is great, there are so many great restaurants on Alberni Street & Robson. The fitness room was great also.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for a Hyatt Regency”
Reviews.Author: splatnz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights while passing through Vancouver. Likes - Recently Renovated - Good Location - Service was friendly and efficient - Decent sized rooms - Hyatt bed Dislikes - Paying for bottled water! - Only a small amenity range - No free WIFI (CAD$14.95 per day!!) Overall I'd stay here again; good clean modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible check in computers and they'll nickel and dime you to death”
Reviews.Author: JasonTil
Reviews.Content: Check In: First off, we booked two nights and they only had one on record. I called a week prior to change the card it would be charged to and they said it was a confirmed change. When we arrived, they had it on the wrong card and the check in machines were incredibly slow and horrible. Nothing is complimentary: They charge for holding bags at the bellhop for a whopping $3 a bag! All they do is hold them behind the desk. What a crock. Check Out: When we checked out, they double charged us. We had to call to get this changed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Sabbydoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Vancouver for 5 nights in October. Overall it was a great experience and I would highly recommend the hotel. Check was smooth and uneventful -- and I did not have to "self" check-in, as there was someone there at the front desk just like there normally is, and he was extremely nice and helpful. Room was on the 10th floor and was very nicely decorated and spacious. The only complaint I had was that it was a bit dark, especially when trying to apply makeup in the morning. Otherwise, everything was perfect. Bed was very comfortable, bathroom was clean and looked newly-renovated, flatscreen tv was great. I could hear some noise from the street at night but it didn't bother me at all. I had room service one night and it came quite speedily after a very pleasant woman took my order. Pretty pricey, though. I had breakfast in the hotel restaurant every morning and that was also typically expensive, but really delicious. There is a McDonald's and Tim Horton's connected to the hotel for those who'd rather spend less on breakfast and there's a grocery store about 5 minutes walk away. The sushi restaurant up the street is really good too, and there are tons of restaurants on Robson (about a 2 min walk) to choose from. The location is perfect -- close to shopping, restaurants, the waterfront, nice jogging paths in Stanley Park, etc. The gym is small but clean and well-stocked with free weights and lots of treadmills. The cardio machines are very modern and all have tvs built into them, which I appreciated. I did not try the pool or hot tub as they are outdoors and I wasn't going to brave the cold, but I did see a few people using the hot tub. It is a bit annoying to have to use your key every time you use the elevator from the lobby but I did appreciate the extra security measure. I was attending a conference at the hotel and the service and quality of the food for this was excellent. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claybasket
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay thru Priceline for $95.00. It was a beautiful room with a beautiful view. The front desk was extremely helpful. The location was great as Gastown and addl shopping nearby plus it's near where the cruise ships come in. I would highly recommend it to anyone. Lorie-Nebraska

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel With A Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: CLBG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Vancouver for 2 nights before getting on a cruise ship. The hotel was in a very good location directly next to a sky train station and very close to Robson street. I booked our room using Priceline after reading a few reviews at TripAdvisor and I paid 175 a night when most all hotels including Best Westerns were going 175+. I arrived with my wife and son at 11 a.m. on a Friday morning and was able to check in right away with no problem at all. I had room 907 which was one of two rooms per floor with a balcony. The rooms were extremely clean. I walked the room, lobby an hallways repeatedly with my 18 month old son in our sock and they only showed the slighted amounts of dirt, so I was very comfortable letting my son crawl or walk around the room. The room was well apponted and the beds were comfortable. The staff was extremely professional and friendly. They took care of whatever I needed right away. The only thing I didnt care for was that there was a lot of corners and edges in the room (the dressers and the desk) that I covered up with extra towels incase my little one took a header into them. I would absolutely stay here again. if I didn't have a toddler I wouldnt have had anything no matter how minor to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: Ringettechick
Reviews.Content: Check in was a little odd, as the front desk staff comes around the desk to a computer screen and helps you do a self check in. Upgraded bedrooms start on the 20th floor and there are 34 floors with banquet space on the 34th - beautiful views. I got thankfully put on the 27th floor with a balcony - love the fresh air. Rooms are just like the pictures - newly renovated and gorgeous. Being a Starwood fan I do miss the Starwood showerhead. The trendy showerhead in the Hyatt isn't a showerhead at all, it's a square in the ceiling that rains down on you. For me with thick hair, it was pain getting the shampoo out with the lack of angle. Trendy is not always practical. Being at a conference the service here was great! The internet is expensive in the ballroom and the food was too, but that's the Hyatt quality. I missed the Q-tips that normally come with the Starwood bathrooms. Robes at the Hyatt are nice. Gym is a fair good size and pool is decent with a great hot tub. Our room looked down onto the pool, so not exactly private pool or hot tub - something to think about if you get a room on that side of the building. Parking is crazy at $28 for 24hrs, so I recommend walking everywhere or the SkyTrain entrance is right beside the hotel. Staples is also at the side door of the hotel so very convenient if you need to make photocopies instead of using the hotel's Business Centre. Tim Hortons & McDonalds are on the other side of the hotel. The Club lounge on the 29th is lovely for snacks if you qualify to go in the lounge. Great outdoor patio people often miss off the lounge, since it's tucked further into the room. Since we were on the 27th floor and the lounge was on the 29th, I tried taking the stairs since it would be faster, but access was locked. Probably due to the Lounge Reception needing to track qualifying guests. Hyatt is a very decent brand, with higher prices, with higher quality and service, so you really do get what you pay for. It was a truly lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: letterdude
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Vancouver Hyatt Regency. My fiance and I decided to spend the weekend by splurging - rather than our usual "budget" accommodation. The Hyatt has been newly renovated. We chose a "balcony room". These rooms provide you with a great view of downtown Vancouver. The "balcony 'view' rooms" look out over the ocean/mountains. I guess it depends on how much you're willing to spend for the view. The room, itself, is really great. We loved the set-up. The flatscreen TV was a nice touch. The bathrooms are very modern with the shower/tub being one of the best I've found of the many hotels in which we've stayed. My fiance noted, however, that the lighting does not lend itself toward the easy application of makeup. I've been told that it's too dark and should illuminate from the front - not from behind. As a guy, I was fine. The bed is the best I've ever slept in, ever. Extremely comfortable. It needs to be. Even on the 12th floor, the sounds of downtown Vancouver can be heard. Mostly, it's muffled quite effectively. Sirens, however, are common and clear. It's the downside of the great, centralized location. As with other Hyatt's, ice machines are not placed on guest floors. You can get ice in a special room, on the 4th floor, or through room service. While other reviews mention the quality of the hotel food, I found the cost to be very expensive so we didn't make any purchases. As an example, the water bottles placed in the room (which, in many hotels are complimentary) cost $3.95. Additionally, the coffee maker does not come with a little coffee pot. Instead, it only provides one cup servings. Really good coffee, though. We enjoyed a drink in the lounge. The jazz trio was really good and the ambiance was well worth the visit. The staff were awesome. The pool was not too impressive. We enjoyed a short swim. The hot tub, while small, was clean, hot and the jets worked very well. Nice - small - workout area. Very nice equipment. Yes...this place is a little pricey but you do receive professional courteous attention from the staff and it was a very enjoyable experience. It's worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: valmae
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hyatt Vancouver. The rooms are absolutely fantastic. The bed extremely comfortable and all modern touches are supplied. Our room was quite with a great city view. I did go and look at the pool but didn't use it - wasn't up to the same standard as the rest of the hotel. The staff were excellent and the doorman greeted when we first arrived and remembered us for the rest of our trip. I used the internet access in the business centre which was very expensive. They do have wireless in the rooms but I leave my laptop at home when on holidays. Overall I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Hockeyfan_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 13 nights. Our second visit to Vancouver (previously stayed at the Fairmont Watrefront). Couldn't beat the location - near to shops and restaurants of Robson Street, Canada Place, and not far from Stanley Park. Excellent transport links directly outside the hotel, buses and sky train. Room was lovely, great views of water and mountains, clean and comfortable. Used restaurant every morning for breakfast, which was menu or buffet. The buffet was good quality and very good value. Only negative point was that the pool area was a bit drab. Small pool, never seemed to be in the sun, slight excess of bird poo aound the pool! Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: HoustonFamily
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this Hyatt at the end of a trip. We had two rooms - one with a single king and one with two double beds. Both rooms were very nicely decorated, everything appeared new and fresh with a modern style decor. (see pictures). We had views looking up Barrad Street. The rooms were quiet. The large flat screen TV was a nice touch. Room service was responsive and the food good. We did not try the restaurant. Bell service was prompt. The location is convenient - close to many shops and restaurants and just a few minutes walk from Canada Place. My only complaint is the price of valet parking - $38 - this is in excess of that charged by comparable hotels in the area. (I understand self parking is $28 - this was not offered to me when I pulled in.) I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: ChunFay
Reviews.Content: We are from Toronto and we are only staying for one evening wedding event. Before the event, I looked at their web site and saw they will charge $28/day self parking or $38/day for valet parking. I was thinking whether they will give the guests a break, such as validating parking or lower parkign rate. I called in the hotel and the guy is basically talking in a "dead-person" mode. He only respond, "yes" or "no" with HUGE pauses right after those single-word answers. Also, I asked him whether he could suggest any alternative options, he REFUSES to tell me and told me that I should park on the street meters! Basically, his attititude is etiher we pay the hotel daily rate or good luck to go somewhere else. I have checked other reivews and I saw that there is evening rate available and if you park yourself without getting through the hotel, you will get a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “great location. Good rooms.”
Reviews.Author: PedroPortugal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in downtown and from there you can walk to most of Vancouver's attractions and restaurants. We arrived at 16h30 and our room was not ready yet (!). The lobby is boring and doesn't feel like a 5 star place. But the rooms are very good and their signature bed is also great. We had a club room with a fantastic harbour view and access to a club lounge. But the lounge it was quite small and had poor amounts of food and drinks available. There is also a gym available for guests. It's well equiped and opened extended hours. Food in ther hotel restaurant is average and the staff is overall professional and friendly. In summary, a nice, confortable place. However it doesn't feel like a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Faubourg
Reviews.Content: I booked the room through Priceline after an Alaskan cruise. The hotel was very nice. We had a wonderful view overlooking the Fairmount and the city. The location is perfect. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the lovely city of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Run Away!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: walkabout
Reviews.Content: Arrived late on July, 25 2008 for a 3 night stay only to find that they did not have the type of room we had reserved though Vancouver Tourism. We had booked a non smoking room for three people with 2 double beds. They had nothing like that available, they could give us a smoking room or a room with one king and bring in a cot. (which the manager said he would not charge us for...how kind) We could stay in either of these rooms for one night but would have to change rooms the next day. (very inconvenient when you are out sightseeing during the day) To make a long story short. The manager was rude...refused to give us our money back because we had not cancelled before 6 pm. ...would not help us find another room at a different hotel...would not let us use a phone to call other hotels. I went to the pay phones and started calling hotels at 10:30 pm...I was lucky to get a room at the Delta for 3 nights. While on the pay phone the door man approached me and offered his cell phone to call other hotels. Apparently he overhead the heated arguement between my husband and the manager at the front desk and felt sorry for us. He informed us that we were not the first people that night to walk away without a room...apparently they overbooked the hotel. When a hotel overbooks don't they usually find you a room at another hotel? Oh well... had a great time in Vancouver despite this upset. That night after we settled into the Delta Suits Hotel we went to a local bar...the waiter thought we looked a little tired and upset. After crying the blues about our chaotic night he quickly brought a round a drinks and told us they were on the house. What a great way to say "Welcome to Vancouver".

Reviews.Title: “Great Bed, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KingKreole
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this hotel. The room was very nice. It was on the 27th floor and featured a nice peek-a-boo view of the harbor. The location is great. We're originally from Vancouver and know the spot well. Within steps to good shopping on Robson and Granville and within reasonable distance to nice scenic places such as English Bay, Stanley Park and Gastown. The bed was the real hit though. Extremely comfortable king size bed, with excellent bedding and nice fluffy pillows. The only real minus was that they want to charge $15 for internet. I think a hotel of that price-range should include free internet. Tips: If you stay on a weekend - self-park in the underground (which is the Royal Center Mall parking shared with the hotel). They have a standard weekend rate of only $15. If you do so with the hotel, they charge $28. We parked at 1PM on Saturday and removed the vehicle at 12:30PM Sunday for the $15. For great coffee go to Artigiano at 763 Hornby Street, right across from the Art Gallery (this is about 2 blocks from the hotel). For a great value in Asian food...try Azia Restaurant at 990 Smythe (about 3 blocks south of the hotel, beside a multiplex movie theater complex). Azian fusion (Japanese, Thai, Chinese, Indonesian etc) in a very cool, hip, modern room. Prices are good and service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty High on themselves”
Reviews.Author: ogopogie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt from July 15th thru 27th. From the 15th thru the 20th I was there on Convention business and the 20th thru the 27th on Gov't business combined with some pleasure. I have never been more disappointed in a Hyatt. Upon check in, my room wasn't ready. After three hours it still wasn't ready. It took a lot of complaining but I finally got a room. The bell boy lingered waiting for a tip. I had every intention of giving him a tip, but he didn’t give me a lot of time to rummage through my purse to get my wallet. It was uncomfortable. Once in the room, I learned that internet access was $16.75 per day. Being that I needed to have internet access for the entire stay, I felt that this was a crazy price. Not all of it was going to be reimbursed by the company, so I called the front desk. Seeing as how I was going to be there for almost two weeks, I wanted to see if there was some way that I could get a discounted rate on the internet. They would not budge stating that the internet was not controlled by the hotel but an external company and that they had no way to compromise on the rate. This I found out was not true when speaking to some of my counterparts who also stayed at the hotel. The parking rates of over $30/day were outrageous. These rates are far more than what should be charged. Because I paid $259 for one week and $159 for the second week, surely I would have thought that something could have been worked out. But no, the hotel staff would do nothing. My husband arrived on the second week of my stay. I needed the bar fridge cleaned out as my husband has a medical condition which requires the use of the fridge for medical supplies. They said that it would cost $15/day to not have anything in the mini-bar. Again, after fighting with them, and the front desk going back and forth to the manager, finally this "fee" was waived solely because medication needed to be stored in the fridge. They wouldn’t have gotten one dollar out of us, because we do not use the mini-bar products. $5 for a bottle of water! $17 for a pot of coffee….no thanks. Calls, are crazy. I was charged 4 times for calls to my cell phone that were allegedly from my room. Now, I was the only one with a key to my room on the date that the calls were charged, and I was not even in my room at the time the calls were supposedly made. None the less, I was charged a $10.35 Connection fee each time along with a .52 cent charge for the call. After a lot of arguing with the hotel, and the hotel stating that they are not responsible for the phone rates as an external company owns the lines etc. etc. etc. The charges were reversed after they charged me for these calls a second time. None the less, I felt that the rates being charged by the hotel were CRAZY. You are better off to use your cell phone or buy a phone card and use the pay phones located in the lobby and second level. The dining options at the hotel again were way over priced. I just could not fathom paying $25+ for breakfast or $20 for a continental! That is nuts! The concierge didn’t even know what time the mall shops opened in the mall that is attached to the hotel, nor were they aware of the services within the mall. I found this to be very unprofessional! This hotel nickel and dimes every one who stays there. It is not worth the money spent (even if you are staying on a corporate rate), and I am so disappointed. I didn't have a choice to stay there for the two weeks, and I certainly will not stay there of my own free will again. It is just a hotel, that has an ego the size of mount Everest and thinks that it is an upscale New York boutique hotel. It is not. I cannot believe the prices and the trouble that I had to go through during my stay! Not worth it by any means! When I contacted the Hotel regarding my complaints again after I returned home. I did not get a satisfactory response, just an email saying SORRY. Try the Sheraton, or some of the cute boutique hotels on Robson. If you like the water, I would recommend the Fairmont Waterfront down by Canada Place. I loved it there. They treated you well, didn’t nickel and dime you, and treated you like royalty…no arguing…no hastle!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from a Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: konakona
Reviews.Content: It's a bit confusing to me how there can be so many positive reviews of this hotel along the lines of "best Hyatt ever." I stayed in a suite for three nights. The hotel in general is showing signs of age and is in desperate need of a renovation. The carpet in my room was noticeably worn in various places, there were wood chips flaking off the doors and corners/edges of drawers and dressers. Lighting in the room seemed insufficient, but that was probably accentuated by the overall dark colors used to furnish/decorate the room. There was a faded dark stain on my pillow case, and I found a piece of hair (not mine) underneath one of the pillows. Other minor gripes include the fact that they don't provide any complimentary bottles of water (which I've gotten used to from other Hyatts) or slippers, and there was no letter sized stationary (only the small pad sized stationary). The lobby felt cold and uninviting. Positives.... well, besides being dreary, the room itself wasn't too small, and the flat panel tv was a decent 32 inches or so. The valet parking attendant was prompt and courteous. I haven't stayed at any other hotels in Vancouver, so I can't say how this compares with other hotels in the area-- for all I know, this Hyatt could be great in comparison. However, compared to what I've experienced at various other Hyatts in the US and Asia, the Hyatt in Vancouver was a big disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lynz001
Reviews.Content: 2 adults early 50's August 1 - 6/08 stay with Priceline. The hotel was great! The location was excellent we walked everywhere which we like to do. We walked to Stanley Park, Granville Market, Robson Street and waterfront is very short walk,and all the other places we visited. The concierge was very helpful. My only complaint about the hotel was we had to pay to use internet and the valet parking was expensive. We arrived at 12:30pm and our room was ready on 22nd floor with nice view. The room was large and very clean and always made up on our return. The price we paid was awesome for such a good 4 star hotel. You can do no wrong staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised they didn't charge for breathing.”
Reviews.Author: mocelery
Reviews.Content: The staff at the front desk, however, was unfriendly. They also have a $15/day internet charge which seems a little strange since Hardee's has free wireless. It was in a good location and the room was pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with one unpleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: jbbryan04
Reviews.Content: We departed our cruise ship and prepared to enjoy 2 more days in Vancouver. Taxi cab from the cruise ship port to the hotel was only 3 or 4 dollars. When we arrived (in the morning) the bell hop mentioned that the hotel had not been full the night before and suggested that a room might be ready even though it was late morning. The front desk clerk confirmed that there was a clean room available "right now", but that there would be a $25 fee. I asked why, and she said because we were checking in "early". I replied that we were going to be touring the city anyway and didn't need the room, to which she said, "then we'll see you at 4 p.m. which is check in." Candidly, this surprised me. I didn't expect to be assigned a room that early in the day, but on the other hand, whenever a hotel has had a room available, eventhough prior to the "check in" time, I've always been accommodated. The hotel's reception really bothered me and I intend to contact management with the hope that they will rethink this policy. This is certainly not the welcoming reception I had hoped to receive in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: carouseltravel
Reviews.Content: Getting in so late we weren't sure how much help would be around. Being in a wheelchair it was great to find staff so helpful and pleasant at that hour. We were checked in and taken to our room very fast. Room was very nicely appointed and the handicap bathroom was everything you could ask for. Beds were some of the most comfortable I've ever had. Tim Horton's was right next door for that late night snack and for morning breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, great price!”
Reviews.Author: jddorian
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline and paid less than half the quoted rate. After reading the stories on here about sofa beds, I was a little worried. No reason to be! The hotel was easy to find (although we arrived during rush hour and the traffic was terrible). Our room was just like the ones pictured on their website. The whole thing was luxurious and definitely worth the price I paid. The parking situation was slightly confusing. When you pull up, you automatically get valet parking unless you tell them no. Then you have to park in the underground lot, which is also the lot for the Royal Center shopping. There were finally signs about the hotel on the second floor. Also, we had to pay for parking when we checked out, so we couldn't use express checkout. Other than that, the location is right in the heart of downtown, the beds were great and it was a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Deb-Mark
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Vancouver is a really nice hotel - great location, right in the heart of Downtown Vancouver. Our room was on the 16th floor, nice size, comfey bed for a really good nights sleep, nice flat screen TV - and we were lucky to have a balcony. The lobby was often busy and bustling, even at 3am. Staff were courteous, helpful, and always available to ask for assistance. The pool is outside so easily viewed from half the rooms in the hotel. There's a little coffee shop/cafe in the lobby which strangely always seemed to be closed - althogh overlall our stay was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: zlabrie
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, friendly staff, great downtown location, within walking distance to many sites and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Central Location, Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: wanderer05
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is about as central as you can get to be able to walk everywhere in downtown. The Burrard Station skytrain stop is across the street, shopping, restaurants, churches, even a hospital, all within a few blocks. Stanley Park about ten blocks up Georgia Street. The hotel service was quite good, one waitress confused my breakfast order asking how I wanted my eggs when I didn't order any. But, otherwise good. The lounge was good, had a glass of wine and enjoyed a little live music and an elderly gentleman making great use of the dance floor. One hopes to be that young at heart. The food prices in the restaurant are ridiculous though, seventeen dollars for two eggs and sausage? The pancakes were maybe $14. Seriously now. Parking, Internet, most everything is extra and expensive here. The room was nice, contemporary styling, LCD TV, nice desk area, good size bathroom. The bed however was a disappointment. It was hard and the sheets were itchy, even a couple of hairs which is gross. Hopefully they were clean. Everything else seemed to be. Nice full windows, okay view out my 27th floor window with a hint of the harbour in the background. Encountered no problems with checking in or out. Nothing special, but decent. For the Priceline bid price I'd stay again, but I could do better for their asking price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: fredsmom
Reviews.Content: Arrived Saturday afternoon (June 28) for two nights. I was quite pleased with everything about the hotel. The location was excellent close to the cruise terminal and Robson St. Our room was tastefully done and clean. The concierge and doorman were quite helpful and answered all our questions. I would definitely recommend this hotel when in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: hotelhoundAlberta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt in downtown Vancouver for 5 nights in June. It was not a pleasant stay. After ensuring that my request for a queen or king non-smoking room had been entered on at least 3 occasions before arriving, I was told upon arrival that all that was available was a smoking room or better yet, a non-smoking room which only contained a sofa-bed (no bed!). As a costly 4 star hotel (over $300/night), I would expect non-smoking room requests to be matched at a minimum. While the housekeeping was very good, the rooms and furniture are dark and the balconies (concrete, ugly chairs) are overrated. Pool and hottub are in an ugly concrete area sandwiched next to another building. Located on a noisy street. When I went to check-out, was charged for overnight parking that I had not used. Would not recommend this overrated, overpriced hotel. Tip - use the free street parking overnight and avoid excessive hotel parking charges.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: Codester
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay at this hotel. The people at the front desk were amazing, will helpfully answer any questions and are very helpful with anything to do with tourism. They even will call places for you and do anything to help. The hotel is conveniently located with a mall attached. There is a McDonalds, Tim Hortons, with some additional clothing stores and a Rexall where you can buy snacks and drinks. It is within walking distance of many restaurants and a block from Robson St with amazing shopping. Its also walking distance to Stanley Park which is amazing. I hung out at the harbour most days. The hotel rooms are very nice and exactly what I had expected. The lobby is a nice place to sit and hang out. The hotel bars and restaurants are excellent also. There is a gym of decent size where they hand out head phones, towels and water. There is an outdoor pool (only) with a hot tub. It would have been nice to have an indoor pool because we had a lot of rain, but i went out anyway. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: dmcgregor
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night getaway and have nothing but great things to say about this hotel. Beautiful, modern 31st floor room with a grat view of downtown buildings, cruise ship terminal, and the bay. Staff were extremely helpful and went out of there way for us, even bringing us up tooth paste and brush, (which I forgot). Recommed the spa which was great and just off the hotel. Also reccomend Yuck, Yuks comedy club 4-5 blocks up the road, they put on a great show and it was very reasonable. Will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_TX88
Reviews.Content: Overall this was an average to good Hyatt. The staff was reasonably friendly and the location was good. I had a great view of the city on the 24th floor. The restaurant was nice as was the bar and I really appreciated the concierge (Lorri) who chose some great restaurants for me and my customers (be careful if you are on a tight budget - Vancouver restaurants can be quite expensive!). The workout room was adequate but the pool was dinky for a Hyatt. My main complaint concerned phone service. The first night I asked the front desk to tell me the rate to call Texas and I was told that she had no idea and rates would vary based on location in the US. So I only made several very short (1 or 2 minute) calls to Texas. I was quite surprised at checkout that these calls cost me $12 to $15 per call. Could not the lady on the first night have told me that calls to the US could be quite expensive? Any why this exorbitant phone rate to the US? Were these calls really that expensive or was the hotel just charging this rate because they thought they could get away with it? Either way, don't use the phones for long distance unless you know just what you are paying.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: Return75
Reviews.Content: Very impressive building.Our 25th floor room had great views of Downtown Vancouver. The hotel is very conveniently situated with easy access to the Sky Train, 'hop on and off' trolley and bus and all the downtown shops. The decor is new, modern and attractive with comfortable communal rooms like the Mosaic Bar.Our room was spacious, with attractive furnishings,huge comfortable bed and a very good bathroom. Extras included a flat screen television, fridge and mini bar. However, hated the cardboard cups with the coffee machine.Tacky! Breakfast was superb, but expensive.All the staff were very attentive,charming and very helpful-reception,concierge,room service,dining room and bar staff.Made to feel special.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MaryCork
Reviews.Content: I spent ages reviewing reviews on Trip Adviser before finally settling on the Hyatt, and I'm delighted to say it was the best choice. The staff were helpful and friendly and very efficient. We were coming off an Alaska cruise and found we were in a 3 hour queue for a taxi from the cruise terminal which is only a short distance from the hotel (but not walkable with 4 large cases). I phoned the hotel and was put through to a very friendly bellman/doorman Ray who kindly sent a cab for us (although this isnt a usual part of their service - we loved his 'can do' attitude to help us out). The room was huge and we had asked for a preferred view room overlooking the city - we're glad we paid the bit extra for that. 27th floor, 2721 was the room number. Bathroom spotless and modern. The coffee/tea service in the room was great. We found all the bellmen very helpful. The location meant we could walk to many places, or easily take a bus. We had a great day out at Grouse mountain - the weather was good that day but got a bit chilly for the last couple of days. Robson St shopping was only a few blocks away, with great restaurants on offer. Granville Island was also worth the visit and it was interesting getting there - a Skytrain to Main St and an autobus to the island. The Skytrain station is connected with the Hyatt, in the shopping centre nextdoor so very handy. That shopping centre also has great foodcourt eating. We didnt really get time to eat at the hotel restaurant except for breakfast one morning, which was good. We also ordered room service on the last night as we had an early start and this was excellent and we felt good value. We thought the accommodation was also good value for the standard we got. There is good security in the hotel too. We would definitely stay at the Hyatt when visiting Vancouver in the future. Vancouver is generally pricey but coming from Ireland, we're used to this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MUK808
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with modern room decor. The staff was friendly and helpful. Excellent location which was within walking distance to many restaurants, shopping and the art museum.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Regency Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: sproutandthebean
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Regency Hyatt for two nights as it was a convenient pick up point for a Key West Coach Tour visiting the Rockies. The hotel is very well located, the 18th floor room was superb, with very comfortable beds and modern decor. A special note: You MUST eat at the hotel restaurant and try their 5 course tasting menu. This was superb food, beautifully presented and the waiter was brilliant. It was more of an experience than a meal and we would stay there again just for the food. The front of house staff were both charming and helpful and we highly recommend you to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Erinh1
Reviews.Content: Perhaps my opinion is biased because I received this hotel via Priceline; appreciated the good rate in this very expensive city. I've stayed at many Hyatts and this one ranks right up in the top ten--definitely a 4* hotel. Decor is new & very nice--business-like, modern, masculine & a touch of Asian. Personally not exactly my style, but I can appreciate it. Some beautiful glass work & pieces in the lobby. Service was 5* from check-in/out, bellmen, concierge, to restaurant. Hotel seemed very full with many tour groups, tourists & business people. The Hyatt staff seemed to handle them all quite well. Location was great for us as we were using public transportation; skytrain was right out the door, as was the hop-on & off trolley. A $5 cab ride from Canada Place, $8 to the Amtrak station. Public bus also right outside the door. Room had a nice view of downtown and a sliver of the bay. As is usual with Hyatts, bellman was happy to store our luggage after checking out, as we didn't need to leave the city until 5 p.m. Mosaic restaurant was good, albeit pricey, so we ate there only once for dinner. I normally use room service for breakfast and bite the bullet with the high prices. But this one was really a bit much just for coffee & a bakery item, so used the Coffee stand in the lobby to get it myself. $15 charge for 1 day of internet access seemed a bit over the top, however, it did not show up on the final bill; we'll see if it eventually shows up on my credit card. I'm guessing Hyatt's prices are no higher than any other comparable hotel in Vancouver. We enjoyed our stay here very much, and I am surprised that anyone would have complaints about their stay.

Reviews.Title: “dirty tricks”
Reviews.Author: travlindudeMiami
Reviews.Content: beware. Hyatt has an UNANNOUNCED policy of turning changes into cancellations. IF you change a reservation, it will be cancelled and rebooked at the (higher) prevailing ) rate. That is their right, but I booked this hotel 6 months before this policy was born and they still tried to apply it to me. To much nickel and dime of the guest. Also, the view rooms are not that great after all, so do not waste your money. I compared my (view) room with a friend's standard room and there was no difference in view. Just a way to get you to pay another 30 bucks.

Reviews.Title: “the best Hyatt I have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: gourmet2go
Reviews.Content: My overall experience was really terrific. I appreciate another reviewer's problems with the room keys to use the elevator, which I also had a problem with initially, but that was so minor compared with overall great service, friendly staff, exceptional decor (real art and fresh flowers). I stayed here for a full week, and was completely comfortable the whole time. Even the restaurant was much better than expected for hotel dining. I also understand the issues with internet access...this hotel like many others, uses an outside firm to provide internet access...so they really have to bill back the charges to the guest or else raise the rates. Telephone shouldn't be an issue for anyone these days either since almost everyone carries a cell phone. I would return here any time. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, value depends on price”
Reviews.Author: gimpel
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Hyatt, 2-6 April and thus had benefit of good conference rates. The recent renovations are elegant and comfortable: good sized room, good new mattress and nice bedding, wall-mounted flat TV (but skimpy boring Canadian cable package), room-darkening curtains (v. important to me), and very nice bathroom (but stylish lighting not best for applying makeup) with ceiling mounted 'rain' shower. My only reservation is the hard to control room temperature adjustments, which are not responsive. I like a very cool room at night and thus felt obliged to keep the heat off all during the day, or I feared I would not be able to get the room cool enough for sleep. Another traveller mentioned this in his review, and it is an annoyance at a luxury hotel. Hotel food surprisingly good, but Vancouver is very 'foodie' everywhere. Downtown location is standard big city downtown but easy for transportation elsewhere and even walks take you many places. Value depends on price.

Reviews.Title: “Un-Businesslike Hotel that lacks amenities”
Reviews.Author: escdhp
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good location in downtown Vancouver. We had a renovated room which included nice bedding and plasma tv. Great housekeeping. Very clean room. Great view of downtown from our room (20th floor). Cons: This is not a 4-star hotel. Maybe 3 stars at best. It all started with the initial check in. My wife and I had a front desk staff who looked like she was training. We did not mind that part. We did mind that she did not speak English very well. We were not informed that we needed to slide our room card in the elevator in order for it to work. We ended up getting stuck in the elevator until we figured it out ourselves. Besides that, they do not have free wireless internet anywhere in the hotel.They should at least provide it in the lobby area. I don't know how they consider themselves a business hotel. They also charged for local calls. Even Best Western we've stayed at have those amenities at no charge. Also, the plasma tv did not tell you which channel you were on, so if you changed the channel, you would have a hard time finding that channel again without scrolling through all the channels again. Something minor, but still a nuisance. The water pressure in the bathroom was also fairly weak, but manageable. The ice machines were only on the 4th floor (for a hotel that has over 30 floors), which required that you use your room card to access the elevator and to access the room where the ice machines were at. On my way to getting ice, my room card did not work when I tried to open the ice room. But I couldn't use the elevator to go back to my room either, so I ended up going to the lobby in my pajamas to get a new card. Of course I didn't have any ID on me, which made getting a new card a challenge. We will be staying at another hotel the next time we visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LJ35
Reviews.Content: Got a late deal on the hotel website for a king size room with a balcony on the 20th floor. The room was fabulous - spacious, good design, new decor, great bathroom and a superb balcony with views across to the mountains. As it was March we didn't experience any problems with excessive heat as in previous reviews. We had a meal in the restaurant which at first seemed like a typical hotel restaurant, nothing special. However, our meal was fantastic from start to finish and we must mention the wonderful waiter, Oscar who made us feel so welcome. Overall we were really impressed with this hotel and its location - 2 minutes walk one way to the waterfront and 2 minutes the other way to Robson Street, the main shopping area. Our only problem was that we didn't stay longer! (It was a one night stay on our way back from Whistler, we were flying home the next day)

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seeker_of_fun
Reviews.Content: I recently was in Vancouver on business and stayed at the Hyatt. I paid extra to upgrade to a room with a balcony - it cost $35 but was well worth it. It was really nice to be able to sit outside, read my book and look at the mountains. My room (on the 17th floor) had obviously been recently redone - the bathroom, furniture and linens were all first rate. As a previous poster had mentioned the cost of wireless seemed excessive. I would consider staying here again. I had stayed at the Delta Suites during one of my last trips for about the same rate and I enjoyed the suite set up more, so would choose it if the prices were comparable. I can't imagine anyone being too disappointed with the Hyatt unless something out of the ordinary happens.

Reviews.Title: “Wants to be great but falls short”
Reviews.Author: stewmc
Reviews.Content: You would think this hotel has the potential to be great -- a central location in the heart of Vancouver's financial district, two blocks from the Robson shopping district and the Hyatt branding....but the hotel simply falls short. On the plus side, it seems there was a remodel not too long ago, because the furniture was pretty plush and comfortable. The staff was unfailingly polite and responsive. Wireless internet was consistent throughout the property, though a little pricey at $14.50/day. The biggest negative was a serious problem that, in all fairness, was advised to me before I checked in: rooms facing south on sunny days heat up to unbearable levels. I could tolerate this for this trip, since I was in meetings all day, but at 10pm at night it was still past 80 degrees F. After complaining twice, the building engineer left me a note suggesting I turn on the "fan" (which didn't do anything but recirculate the hot air) and/or open my door to let in the artic-cold hallway air. The engineer went on to say that the air conditioning gets "overwhelmed" on hot days, which I think is unacceptable. I heard others complaining about the same issue so I know I wasn't alone, I really think this is a top priority for Hyatt to correct. The layout of the hotel is a little strange but not too untypical for a high-rise. The lobby is petit and the conference area pushes up a few floors, but the bigger issue is the elevators. There are five elevators that serve all floors, so the wait time is considerable -- especially during the morning rush. It seemed to us that at least 1-2 elevators were out during our entire stay. I loved Vancouver and the location, but next time I'll try the Fairmont across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Safaridog23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Feb 14-19. I have stayed at a lot of hotels and this is by far the best! The room was really nice and extremely clean. The staff were outstanding! The location is awesome, walking distance to many places. Overall I can't think of one bad thing to say about this hotel. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great With One Issue”
Reviews.Author: RobsPicsCom
Reviews.Content: I just finished a four night stay at this hotel. I was upgraded to a suite with an outdoor balcony. I believe the suites are only located on the 33rd floor. So ask for a room on this floor ahead of time if you want a suite upgrade. Everything looked very modern. Room service and consierge service was exceptional. ONE BIG PROBLEM though...a certain waitress at the hotel restaurant was very rude. She must have had a bad day or something, but it kinda ruined my entire day. Oh well. I hope you like the pictures I am posting of this property and the views too :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Wish all were this good”
Reviews.Author: MattNY
Reviews.Content: After 5 nights in Whistler we thought we'd check out Vancouver and we're glad we chose the Hyatt. Recently renovated, our room was top notch. It was spacious with a decent view of the harbor (and the mountains through the buildings). Flat panel TV, elegant bathroom (with one of those toilet seats that won't slam) and a well designed work area should be requirements for all hotels. When I asked about a night light for the bathroom (who likes to turn on the light in the middle of the night?), they brought me two glow sticks, one for each night (creative problem solving). The bell staff was really responsive and the concierge was incredibly helpful for us to play tourists. When I'm back in Vancouver, this is the only hotel I'll consider.

Reviews.Title: “So Glad We Picked the Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: sfka2427
Reviews.Content: Wow! We had a great stay at the Hyatt and were extremely impressed with every aspect of our stay. Here's our rundown... Rooms: Really fantastic - I can't say enough about the rooms. Very recently renovated and in great condition. The beds were very comfortable, the linens were nice, and there were lots of pillows. There was a good alarm clock with radio and iPod connections on the bedside table. The bathrooms were really nice and very updated, and the toiletries (as they are in all Hyatts) were high-quality. The shower was funky - the water didn't come down from a shower head in the wall as is customary but from the ceiling, which took some getting-used-to but was kind of fun. In-room safe, coffee maker, and big flat-screen plasma TVs. No weird stains on the furniture or linens or anything - the rooms really have that new and recently-updated feeling.
