My favorite part of the room was the view! Fantastic views of downtown Vancouver. The windows were floor-to-ceiling and made up one whole side of our room. We could see the port where cruise ships came in day and night, which was kind of fun. Hotel features: Nice, updated lobby. There is a business center off the lobby with a small charge for Internet access if you don't have a laptop with you. The restaurant on the second floor of the hotel is fantastic. Good hamburgers and salads and FANTASTIC service. I cannot say enough about our waitress at the restaurant; she was one of the friendliest restaurant employees we have ever encountered! We had some outstanding meals in Vancouver and our lunch at the hotel restaurant (Mosaic Bar & Grille) was definitely one of them. Service: Very professional, friendly employees. From check-in to check-out, we were treated with utmost respect. I mentioned the great service in the hotel restaurant above, and we also met some extremely friendly and helpful concierges who gave us restaurant and activity suggestions and also lent us board games that we were able to take back to our rooms to keep and play for a few nights. Location: Right in the middle of downtown Vancouver. A few blocks away from great restaurants and shopping centers (the concierges can give you tips there) and in walking distance from the port where cruise ships leave from Vancouver (10-minute walk). There is a stop for the hop-on hop-off Vancouver bus literally 10 steps from the back entrance of the hotel. The hotel is also connected to a shopping center with a convenience store and Starbucks. Overall, we would highly recommend the Hyatt for all kinds of travelers. We had a delightful stay and the Hyatt definitely went above and beyond our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property”
Reviews.Author: Trbear
Reviews.Content: This is a great building in an excellent location. Rooms are updated and comfortable. Breakfast is outstanding. Service is very friendly and sincere. Just a top hotel all around!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatt Regency Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: sukyee28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 1 year old son during the last week of August 2007. This was our first visit to Vancouver and we paid $100.00 per night and it was great. We were on a very high floor with a view of the water and the city skyline. The staff is wonderful and the housekeeping excellent. The bed is extremely comfortable. It is in an excellent location with the train station right below. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: rizatripan
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was very good from valet parking to the room service. The valet parking cost 35 a night with regular self park costing 25. We found the hotel to be very clean and nicely situated downtown only a couple blocks South of Robson St. Our room was large and nicely appointed with modern furnishings and large windows with a nice view of the city from the 26th floor. The bed was very nice but not as comfortable as the bed we had just stayed in last weekend in Vancouver at the Marriot Pinnacle. The room was a standard however came with a nice wall mounted LCD and a large desk with double USB, double power outlet, and of course DSL or wireless internet all at the work station. Good room and hotel for a business traveler or romantic evening.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and Miss”
Reviews.Author: horizonbound
Reviews.Content: It's been 20 years since I was last in Vancouver, for Expo '86. I loved Vancouver then. Now, I'm not so sure. The Hyatt was non-descript from the outside. Downtown Vancouver is very bustling. If I had been asleep and woke up here, I'd have a hard time figuring out what country I was in. The passers-by were a very eclectic mix of all cultures, but it was predominantly Asian in nature. Inside, the hotel was still non-descript. The lobby and public areas were similar to any number of hotels I've visited in the past. My room was quite modern...some good, some not so much. The bed was quite comfortable, yet I did not sleep well. I suspect it was due to the noisy ventilation system, which was too warm for the first several hours. Seems to take a LONG time to respond to a thermostat with tiny numbers. Wish I'd brought my magnifying glass! There's a large desk for business travelers, but I left my laptop home on this trip. I have a PC card for the thing anyway, so I wouldn't have tried the hotel's internet connections anyway. When I sampled the Hyatt properties in Hawaii, they all had i-pod docks and the Vancouver property has them, too. I'll not pass judgment on these since I don't have an i-pod. The bath has one of those curved shower curtain rods, a feature I like. Plenty of high-quality soap, shampoo and conditioner. What I wasn't to fond of was the shower head, mounted not high on the wall as you expect, but in the ceiling so it can "rain" down on you. Since the initial blast from any shower is the cold water waiting in the pipes, this was an uncomfortable shock. I'll keep the old-fashioned preference, here. We were all there for business meetings, so food was provided by whatever large-scale kitchen the hotel uses. The chef inventing this menu needs to be disposed of immediately...the food was consistently overcooked, low-quality, bizarre-tasting and just plain terrible. We were actually thinking of heading to a nearby McDonald's for an improvement in quality. 'Nuff said? Vancouver has better hotels with better food. Next time I go, when I have the choice of accommodation (I didn't this time), I'll shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Jansix01
Reviews.Content: Traveled here on business last weekend. Room was large and very clean. We had two double beds, and they very comfortable. The bedding was very nice, and the pillows were wonderful. The rooms were cleaned in a timely manner. We never saw the maids wondering the halls, it was like the rooms were cleaned by invisible maids! The bathroom was large and nicely tiled with granite. Great colors, great counter space. The down side to the bathroom was the lighting. The lighting was very dim. Also the lighting in the entire room was dim. The towels for such a high end hotel were thin and not very soft. The shower itself was nice, roomy but the shower head being as modern as it was, wasn't all that great. The shower head is in the ceiling and pours down on you. It is like standing in the rain. No control of the water pressure, no angle control either. Did not really care much for the shower. It was beautiful but not that functional. Men may disagree as they do not have to manuever to shave. The food is great, very creative dishes and nicely presentated. The staff was very friendly. Beware of the homelss pan handlers hanging around the hotel. I had one ask if I wanted to buy a peanut for a dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, great rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marinova
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - everyone was very helpful. The rooms were very comfortable, classy, and clean. The shower was one of the best I have ever had at a hotel and beds were ridiculously comfortable - I would no doubt recommend the hotel and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good overall; not the best of Hyatt or Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: brushwing
Reviews.Content: One of the problems I find with booking hotels in cities to which you have never travelled is that you never really know where the hotel is. Sure, you have a map and description but until you're actually there you can't get a sense for the place. In the case of Vancouver, especially if you are visiting for pleasure, the ideal location is the waterfront (ie Pan Pacific and Fairmont Waterfront). The Hyatt is located downtown, as downtown as you can get, in fact. This is fine, but don't expect the sea-to-sky views Vancouver is famous for. The hotel has recently undergone a renovation though it would appear the lobby area and corridors have been untouched. The lobby is laid out strangely and both could have benefited from a theme which reflected the modern, minimalist rooms. That said, the Hyatt offered cheap rates at under CAD$200 per night and friendly, helpful service. The rooms were well done, apart from the walls which were a bit overwhelmingly white and the black/grey colour scheme which seemed a bit corporate. The bathroom included a showerhead inside the bath with curtain. This is unacceptable today in a Hyatt as the curtain both clings to you, blocks your view and lets water escape. The pressure of the shower head was weak as well. If the Hyatt was to fix the aspects mentioned above, it would bring it in line with the chain's standard of deluxe, modern hotels with good service. As it is, I would be inclined to try the Pan Pacific and Four Seasons instead or the soon-to-open Shangri-la.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad word to say...”
Reviews.Author: MadamK
Reviews.Content: You know you've had an excellent stay when you can't think of a single bad word to say about a hotel. I stayed at the Hyatt Regency for a weekend in August before heading down to Seattle on business and found it to be a modern, well-located hotel with great facilities. On arrival there were plenty of polite staff to assist and my check-in was smooth. Having never been to Vancouver before, I was keen to stay in a room on one of the higher floors for a good view of the city. I made this request and without a flinch the receptionist arranged for me to be upgraded from the 7th to the 30th floor at discounted rate of $25 per night, which also included breakfast: an absolute steal. The room itself was very large with a comfortable bed and plasma television. The bathroom was well-stocked and had a strong rainfall shower. Breakfast was a delicious selection of muffins, pastries and home-made breads, but this could be exchanged for anything on the menu of similar value. The waitress was very helpful and brought me a fruit smoothie to test while I waited (only about 30 seconds!) for my food to arrive. I was dining alone, so she made sure I wasn't left waiting and offered me a newspaper/magazine to read while I ate. The concierge was just as helpful and getting a taxi was no problem at all. Equally, being only a few steps from Robson Street, it was easy enough to walk to a number of interesting spots. I would certainly recommend a stay at the Hyatt Regency. NB. I booked my stay on the Tourism Vancouver website as recommended by other reviewers. I got an excellent price which included a $10 bill(!) to use towards a taxi journey and a Starbucks' Card with $10 of credit to grab breakfast on the run if needed.

Reviews.Title: “nice and stylish”
Reviews.Author: davidchilver
Reviews.Content: This is a stylish hotel. On the plus side, the bedroom was very elegant and the bed very comfortable. It had access to the club lounge, managed by a senior concierge who is the most helpful I've ever encountered. Her name is Katie and she is great. Slightly less impressive were the bars which lacked atmosphere or character. The location is great, however, and I'd gladly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency Vancouver gives what you expect from Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: BZT
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a two night stay at the Hyatt Regency Vancouver. This is not a budget hotel for the thrifty. It does deliver elegance, refined service and amenities (but know that the ubiquitous Internet access is $10/day and parking is $24/day). Met our high expectations of Hyatt Regency in every way. A formal, polite and business-like attitude among the staff is prominent. We used kiosk checkin so had relatively limited contact. Excellent shampoo and conditioner. Check out the view from the 34th floor of the canyons of downtown Vancouver, adjacent mountains and harbor. Within walking distance of Canada Place.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Strength2Jan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful week in Vancouver. We stayed at The Hyatt in downtown Vancouver and have no regrets. The staff was attentive and friendly. The rooms were recently beautifully remodeled with a very warm and inviting style. We even loved the luxurious soaps and lotions in the room. One of the more spectacular parts of the hotel was the view. Although the hotel has over 25 floors, we stayed on the 15th floor with an incredible view of the Coastal Mountains. We snagged a great rate via Travel Zoo's website and we have no regrets about this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: manika24
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay at this hotel for 5 nights. Location was perfect. The room was exactly as shown on pictures. Flat screen TV located on the wall across the bed. Comfortable bed and pillows. Huge umbrella which became very handy when it was raining. Cons - towels were not soft as you would expect, ones you will find in motels. Noise from seagals even though the room was on 26th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: MSW2
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late at night and were greeted with an upgrade to regency level! A beautiful hotel in a great location centre to all of the beautfiul sights of the city. The regency club was great and offered a more than substantial breakfast with good service. The bedroom was gorgeous all newly done brand new flat screen tv's fantastic view! Definitely a good choice !

Reviews.Title: “Modern rooms/decor & great location!”
Reviews.Author: Sweetee Pie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on Friday July 20, 2007. All the pictures and reviews from others are true...the positives ones that is. Rooms are very well appointed, clean, comfy, down duvets, spacious room, modern washroom with rain shower head from ceiling, spa toiletries (shampoon, conditioner, body lotion and massage bar), hair dryer with funnel attachment, flat screen TV and mini fridge with snacks. Excellent location...hop, skip and jump to everything. Robson is just 2 blocks north for great window shopping and restaurants which is fully accessible by walking. Internet is $9.95 per day. Self parking is $24/day. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: NYCAlarmGal
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt in Vancouver is in a fantastic location near the Art Museum and shopping and restaraunts a block away from Robson Street in the heart of downtown Vancouver. The hotel is luxe and has recently been completely renovated with minor remodeling still going on which the hotel is very clear about. The rooms are clean and efficient and one of the much more luxurious Hyatt hotels. Marble bathrooms and nice ammenties. Great shower which pours out through a ceiling over head shower. Great for both business and pleasure. While most of the staff (Customer Requests and Restaurant Staff ) were extremely cordial and welcoming, I couldn't help but feel the front desk staff and bellmen were not up to the same standard. Still a good stay for 3 days on business so needs were minimal. Vancouver is under construction everywhere you look as they gear up to the 2010 Olympics. Great restaurant albeit expensive for all meals, but great food and fantastic service. Also a coffee bar with light sandwiches and pastries just off the lobby. Hotel leads into a small shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the pics!”
Reviews.Author: Kaysar
Reviews.Content: Last February I found out that I was attending a conference in Vancouver for 3 nights around April 1, 2007 and because I like to plan my adventures I started by checking out the hotel selected for the conference. Wow! The room I had was just like it's pictures! beautiful with a wonderful slate bathroom., LCD tv etc.. A few of us arrived early, I'd say about three hours before check-in and much to my delight (and the others) we were all offered rooms with a terrace, yes a terrace where you could throw a small wine and cheese party for about six! with an amazing view of Burrard Street, the inlet, and North Vancouver in the mountain area (I was told). My room was always kept very clean and the staff would bring me up anything I requested. I did not hit the bar, or restaurant in the hotel but we did have fa fabulous feast of asian and other ethnic appetizers on skewers while drinking beer (pricey in the hotel or at least at this event) and wine. Another thing I did hear was that the pool area was terrific, outdoors but excellent, even in April! I would definitely recommend this hotel, for it's rooms, cleaniness, very friendly staff and terrific location. We were there for a gay Pride conference (this hotel is just minutes walk from both Robson Street for shopping, restaurants and sushi bars and Davie Village (the gay area). It's also close to the waterfront and maybe a twenty minute walk from Stanley Park. Anyways, big mistake if you don't stay here. I recommended it to a female co-worker who just got back yesterday and she too loved it! except that the boarding pass machine (yes they do have one) in the lobby was out of order!

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: Air747
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hyatt for 2 nights. I stayed at 12th floor. The room, in my opinion, is nice size. The hotel pictures match to the room. The bed is comfortable and the flat screen TV is nice. The bathroom is nice as well. The room deco is simple and modern. The bed does not have ugly (and perhaps not so clean) bed cover. The pillow case, bedding sheets, and covers are all white which is nice. One thing that I would like to see is to offer free Internet services or reduce the fee. (It is 9.95 CDN per 24 hours + tax). The location is good as well. There is a 24 hours McDonald and Tim Horton next door. There is a mall (Central Pacific Mall) near by. It also close to Robson street. There is a Airporter transportation at Hyatt location which takes you to airport. You can buy ticket from the hotel. Just a note, plan extra time just in case the traffice and bus stops at few hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for first trip to Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: hdblue
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vancouver for a conference. I stayed at the Hyatt for a week during the conference and the hotel is wonderful. The rooms have been recently remodeled and are fantastic with very comfortable beds, plasma tv's and a great bathroom with rainfall shower. The hotel is located downtown within walking distance of everything you will need, restaurants, shops, starbucks...anything ! The staff is friendly and helpful. The lobby is very stylish and the restaurants are on par with hotel restaurants. Great desk area for working and wonderful fitness center with new equipment and TV's on each treadmill. You cant go wrong with this hotel when in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Room”
Reviews.Author: CFF
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in Feb. We had a room on the 29th floor, and loved the huge windows. Great bed, fine shower, nice room. Every staff person was friendly, and we were well served. I would consider this hotel if wanting to go to a concert at the Commodore, or shopping on Robson.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms are great”
Reviews.Author: lce2
Reviews.Content: We had one of the renovated rooms on the 27th floor and it was beautiful. All blacks, whites and neutrals. The beds were extremely comfortable and the work station was just that - a work station not a coffee table. I was a little disappointed that they charge for Internet connection as every other hotel (usually smaller and cheaper) had supplied it free of charge. It's in a good location, close to Robson Street and the department stores and the Skytrain station. The restaurant was a little pretentious and the waiters too obsequious for my taste ("Hello, my name is ..... May I know your name, the better to serve you? May I place this napkin.......). Too many interuptions of our conversation to ask if everything was alright, was there any other thing he could do for us. The food, although precious, wasn't bad, it just took itself too seriously. Two pleasant bars with friendly (less obsequious thank God) staff. Overall, a good place to stay, especially if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: MrsRotten
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt from Nov 29/06 for 4 nights. Hotel is in the perfect location, a block and a half to Robson St ( shopping & restaurants ) and a half a block to W.Georgia St ( Pacific Centre Mall, shops & restaurants). It was an easy 10 minute walk to GM Place or the other stadium or to the play house. The bus to Whistler stops around the corner as well as the mono-rail and airport bus. It is easy to get to Gros Mountain from hotel. The airport is about 1/2 hour by car but very easy to find. The rooms are very masculine / modern as the decor is black, slate & white. The room had an amazing king bed that just beckoned each night. There is a mini-bar in the room that you can use for your personal use also. We were on the 27th floor and we never had to wait for one of the 5 elevators. Underground parking is available for $24 which permits in and out privledges. Staff were very friendly. There is a Tim Hortons & Mcdonalds as well as a drug store next door.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Chic”
Reviews.Author: GOVTtravel
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying in a freshly renovated room with a 'grand bed.' Instead I was given a dated room, with dated, worn furnishings which I can only describe as 'shabby chic.' The room appeared clean upon first observation, but when putting away clothing and opening up the closet there was a layer of dust which I noted later by the bites came fresh with dust mites. The shower's tile grout also was in bad need of some bleach, there was actually black mold (ugh!) between the tiles. Overall disappointing room, but the location in downtown Vancouver is good. Would only stay here again if everyone else is booked!

Reviews.Title: “Good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: chocobee_76
Reviews.Content: Checking in was very fast, no line. We got up to the room, it looked like we were staying in a Suite. I compared it with our friends and all the rooms were gorgeus. Everything was clean and neat, the staff was very friendly and room service was GREAT.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFool29
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through priceline at a great price over Labor Day Weekend. I read some of the other reviews of this hotel stating that not all rooms had been renovated so I didn't have the highest of expectations. When I checked in I requested a renovated room on one of the upper floors (as another poster had suggested) and received a room on the 24th floor - it was absolutely beautiful - we even had a balcony!! Could not have asked for a nicer room with a flat screen TV and a very, very comfortable bed!. It was in a great location as well. We loved Vancouver - they had Starbucks on just about every corner!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has a few problems to fix....”
Reviews.Author: tommydcanada
Reviews.Content: First let me say that the renovated room I had was overall quite nice. The bed was very comfy with good sheets. The problems with the room were...1. You had to get out of bed to turn off the bedside light - very annoying, poor design. 2. The rainshower pressure was weak. The biggest problem was that on my last night there was a fire alarm at 11:15 PM. We all trudged down the stairs and after getting the "all clear" sign from the fire department, we were allowed to go back to our rooms at around 12:45 AM. However, the elevators were locked open and no one had the key! We had to climb 23 flights of stairs back to our room, where we arrived at 2:15 AM, totally exhausted and drenched in sweat. Imagine my joy of having to wake up at 6AM for a conference after just 3 hours of sleep. When I checked out, there was no offer of compensation, and not even an apology. Obviously I will choose another hotel next time and will not stay at a Hyatt again if I can help it. In general I have noticed over the past couple of years that many Hyatt hotels have slipped a bit in their quality. Hyatt used to be known as a luxury hotel chain. I don't think they can make this claim any longer. In my opinion they are a class below Marriott and even Hilton at this point.

Reviews.Title: “Got a bargain on the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: PeterMF
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline's auction, offering to pay $100(US) per night for five nights for a 4 star hotel in downtown Vancouver and we got the Hyatt Regency. Confirmed our stay in advance with the Hyatt requesting a renovated room and we got one no problem or extra charge. Room is very nice with a plasma TV (about 32") and a decent view. Fitness centre has new equipment. Outdoor pool with whirlpool was OK. Location is very convenient for business or shopping and one block from a Skytrain station which will take you to some of the sights. One caution: parking is $24/night. Cheaper options exist a few blocks from the hotel. The three of us (parents and 9 year old) would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Redo like a dorm room”
Reviews.Author: golfscotland
Reviews.Content: Not a good location....not a good redo....stay somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms great, but had to pay extra for it”
Reviews.Author: Sea_36
Reviews.Content: Got a reservation on Hotwire for $169 for a Saturday night. We asked for a renovated room and the lady checking us in said we'd have to pay an extra $20 to get one. I said yes but it seems like an arbitrary fee after reading the previous reviews who paid less and got a renovated room for no extra charge. The lady checking us in even noted that the renovated rooms were "much, much nicer" than the old rooms, so why would I even consider staying in an old one? That said, our renovated room was lovely and comfortable, with a fabulous view. Just wish I wouldn't have had to pay extra for something I feel like I already paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the newly renovated Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: LUSKJU
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a terrific location in the heart of Vancouver. The lobby and puiblic rooms have all been recently renovated as have many, but not all, of the guest rooms. On arrival, we asked if they might have a renovated room available for us. We had booked through Priceline at a very good rate but, without hesitation, the friendly clerk offered a view room with 2 double beds on the 26th floor. The room was very modern, florr to ceiling windows, upscale modern furniture, flat screen TV, great beds and well appointed bathroom. There was a mini bar plus caffee maker with complimentary coffee and a newspaper was delivered in the morning. There's also a safe and an umbrella! We didn't check out the restuarants or the pool nor did we eat in any of the restaurants. We were absolutely delighted with the Hyatt and would love to stay there again. However, I have been told that the non-renovated rooms really do need work so we might not feel the same if we had been given one of those rooms.

Reviews.Title: “flatline”
Reviews.Author: villoin
Reviews.Content: OK is about the best I can say. Nice folks, easy check-in, gave us a King bed with balcony after paying on Priceline. But the hotel's in a noisy part of downtown and the room is just average. Not a bad experience, not a good one. I wouldn't pay more than $110 on Priceline for this hotel--it is definitely not a 4-star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not great”
Reviews.Author: illinineil
Reviews.Content: Lobby/public areas Most look to have been recently refurbished. Lobby and restaurants/bars were nice. Food at bar off lobby was pretty good. Rooms Need updating badly. Furnishings were out of the 1980's. Desk area was bad - an odd spotlight shining on the desk from across the room. Location Very good. Easy access to Robson street for shopping, food, people watching. Service Check in was very slow and complicated - but they apologized. Overall it was good. I would stay here again if the updated the rooms. Otherise I would look elsewhere - especially at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, Good Location but Not Special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at this hotel in early June for a convention plus I arrived a day early to take in the sights. The best aspect of this Hyatt is its location - you are in the center of the action and all the major attractions can be reached by foot. Public transport is immediately available. You can see the water and mountains by just walking out the front door. The staff is also excellent and was on the ball with maps and directions. Check in/out in record time. Cabs camped at the door with no waiting. The rooms themselves are pretty humdrum. Veterans of this hotel warned that the beds are like boulders and indeed they are - hard and lumpy. The rooms are average and kind of a letdown considering you are checking into one of the marquee names in the center of a major city. You might get a great view if you are up high enough - I did not. As an aside, I liked Vancouver very much. Great restaurants and attractions. Its unfortuanate the city does not do more to deal with its aggressive population of panhandlers. I have traveled to many major cities of the world and have never encountered anything like I did in this city - beggars on almost every corner and more than a few aggessive junkies who will dash across the street to seek money from you, or argue with you. Of course, they are attracted like a magnet to places like the Hyatt, which is not the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Contruction”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was under major renovations. They did not have water from 11:00pm to 5:00am. If you needed a bathroom at night it was not an option.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt fine, but hardly a WOW”
Reviews.Author: ABtraveller
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Regency has a great downtown Vancouver location. Close walking to Robson St, Pacific Mall, Stanley Park, the Art Gallery, and waterfront. The lobby is remodelled, and the elevators take on the same look. Check-in was fast and friendly. However, my room was bland. The bed just average. The view okay - but some rooms have spectacular views. Room furnishings are simply adequate. My price included buffet breakfast in the 2nd floor restaurant. Great meal, including custom omelettes. The fitness room is great - and open till midnight. The new LifeFitness equipment is high-tech with a television monitor in each treadmill and eliptical. A hot tub and small outdoor pool are next to the fitness room. The outside area is available till 10pm. Overall, I'd rate the hotel 3 star. The rooms need a complete makeover to consider it any higher.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Justin_Magro
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. Close to most downtown spots and next to a Sky Train station. The rooms with balconies have a nice view over the city. The outdoor rooftop pool and hot tub are heated making them a great spot for a winter swim. The Hotel bar and restaurant are very good and well staffed. Justin Magro, Halifax, Nova Scotia

Reviews.Title: “Great location polite and considerate staff”
Reviews.Author: chris_schene
Reviews.Content: The staff and this hotel are some of most polite and considerate I have come across. Nice lobby with beautiful Christmas displays and a beautiful view from my hotel room. Highly reccomended! This in a great location in central vancouver with the Royal Centre right next store: the royal centre has stores, fast food eating establishments. I was very pleasantly surprised to get this room for $70.00 per night on Priceline. A little known secret about Vancouver, Seattle and Victoria is that you can buy nights at high class hotels for excellent prices during their off season (roughly Mid Oct-March) via Priceline. They do not seem to change their "official" prices very much, but the Priceline price drops greatly. I got the Sheraton Seattle Hotel and towers (another great hotel) for $60.00 last year (normally goes in the 140-160 range). Chris Schene

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: prose01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt for 3 nights this December. The first night was business and the rest was holiday. This hotel is the perfect location for either. It's walking distance to the business sector, the waterfront, Robson Street and many retail stores and restaurants. At $145 Cdn. per night, the rate was very good value; perhaps reflecting that early December is probably low season for Vancouver tourism. The room was very nice. We requested and received a room at the very top (32nd floor), which had a very good view of the harbour and the mountains. The service was very good, especially the concierge. She provided extremely good restaurant advice for all three days, including getting us reservations on the Saturday night at one of the most popular restarants in town (which was likely not an easy task). Both the front check-in staff and the full time doormen were both friendly, helpful and efficient. Their are a number of other topflight hotels in the same area (Sutton Place, Four Seasons, Fairmont Hotel Vancouver, to name a few), and it was my opinion that our stay at the Hyatt was very much at the same high level of quality and service, but at a somewhat lesser price. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel for anyone looking to spend a few days in Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “satisfied with accomidations”
Reviews.Author: ronadebra
Reviews.Content: we only stayed one nite before our cruise, but thought the hotel was very nice, clean and I know others complained about having to use your key in the elevator but we thought this was a great idea for safety reasons. Hotel had great location. we had a room with a small balcony that we could overlook the city. Beds and pillows were fine. we had mini breakfast in the lobby coffee shop since the restaurant was pricy for breakfast. Bell Staff was friendly and helpful. Girls at concierge desk weren't as helpful. We didn't get a deal and paid full price however I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good Value if you negotiate a good rate”
Reviews.Author: maestro
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler and in terms of both price and quality, I stay in a wide range of hotels. Vancouver’s Hyatt hotel is a good hotel in a great location with plenty of great shopping and sights to see. Room amenities include ØLarge room with a great city view. Due to the hotel’s terrific downtown location, high-rise buildings block much of the harbour view, though it’s only 3 or 4 blocks to the sea and the cruise ship terminal. ØHigh-speed internet access (at $15 extra per day), a worktable (without a proper chair for computer use – hence it’s the bed pillows on the seat). ØA reasonably comfortable king size bed with a cozy, fluffy comforter. ØA threadbare easy chair and ottoman (that many families may have relegated to their rec room by now.) ØA large bathroom, which lacks an exhaust fan. ØA classy, high ceiling lobby. ØHelpful friendly staff. ØWhen staying downtown, take a walk along 2 great, yet different streets… Robson, for it’s shopping & people; Denman, for it’s funky character and colour – it’s what Robson was 20 years ago. The Hyatt may be amongst Vancouver’s best values if you can negotiate a good rate. We paid $115 Canadian.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good deals on priceline, not worth the regular rate”
Reviews.Author: SixtyDays
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt for two nights in September. Paid £50 per night on priceline and thought that this was a reasonable amount. Was able to check in at 10.30am and got a north facing room with a view of the mountains through some high rises. Similar to other comments here, the lobby and bar are nice and the rooms are ok although look a bit 1980s these days with their floral prints. However, the beds are very hard and not very comfortable. However, the good location, cleanliness and good service from the staff prompted me to give 4*s. The gym and pool looked fine too although I didn't try them out.

Reviews.Title: “5* Location and Lobby - 3* Rooms - 2* Beds!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets 5* for location (on Burrard Street with Robson Street and the Fairmont on the doorstep - Canada Place etc within walking distance). We were actually slightly disappointed with the shopping on Robson Street - it was hyped as Vancouver's answer to 5th Avenue, but we felt that the Park Royal mall (just over Lion's Gate Bridge was much better). Back to the hotel, the lobby has recently undergone a major multi-million dollar renovation and really looks the part. An excellent coffee shop offering good value pastries, paninis and drinks. As other reviewers have noted the rooms really don't really meet the standards of either the lobby or location. We had the dreaded double beds which really were minute and extremely hard (we're unsure whether they actually were full doubles). More surprising was the floral bedspreads and curtains which did not sit with the hip new lobby at all. Even if the rooms aren't going to be renovated with new carpets etc, the hotel might do well to have newer fabric choices with sharper lines which would be more in keeping with the modern public areas. Bathroom was clean (as was the main room). Bellboy especially helpful and polite. Room service extremely quick and pretty decent. Overall for the rate we paid ($75 through priceline) we couldn't complain - and our request for a non-smoking room was granted. Would be disappointed with the beds if we were paying rack rates though. If the Hyatt do modernise their rooms a little to match the lobby, given its location it would make an excellent choice.
